story:
My cartoon characters serve as positive role models who help with problems and who help children grow.  

You can help me bring my dream of AmeeraLand into existence and help hundreds, thousands, perhaps millions of children as they grow and develop into outstanding human beings.

I am seeking funding to develop the curriculum, character development, operations, logistics and eventually Licensing.

The dream of AmeeraLand can be made possible with your help.  I am asking for $100,000 to grow this business and to bring this business to market.

     20,000 for curriculum development

     25,000 for character development

     25,000 for operations/logistics

     15,000 for website development

     10,000 for licensing development 

       5,000 for education development

$100,000 Total

Please contribute to my campaign and help us recreate the world, embrace all people, and share some love because “Everyone IS A STAR”.  Thank you.

story:
My Story

My name is Matt (Mathieu in French), I am a big Stand Up Paddle (also known as SUP or S.U.P.)  fan and for the past two years I have been blogging, facebooking, instagraming, youtubing, tweeting, shooting photos, videos, interviewing,  translating, skyping (etc.) the entire SUP planet on www.TotalSUP.com - in three languages. As a self-proclaimed SUP journalist, I have also been driving to tens of SUP events in Europe meeting local and international riders, brands and businesses.
--
All of the above, pretty much on my own and for free! 
--
Stand Up Paddle is one the fastest growing sport in the world.  Currently only a few specialized media exist, but there is not a single one that offers a worldwide coverage of the SUP scene in more than one language. 
My goal through TotalSUP is to dig up local SUP stories from every corner of the globe and share the SUP love  between paddling communities without the language barrier.
In order to achieve this, I need to move from the bloggy feel of the current website to a solid new platform which will allow TotalSUP to grow as a multilingual website and build new features that will be useful to the entire worlwide SUP family.

What we need 

The funds we need will be allocated by order of priority to the following:

1. Hire a freelance developer / web agency to build a professional website and move all the current content to the new platform.

2. Build exclusive features by paddlers, for paddlers. The more money we receive, the more features we will be able to develop! 

3. Get a team of contributors and ambassadors together in various parts of the world - and start paying them for their work!

4. Start financing a small production of TotalSUP rewards and merchandise (T-shirts, lycras, mugs, etc...)

5. Build an advertisting program for brands and businesses to be more visible and finance TotalSUP.


How important is your help?

Very! 

- With a great new website we will be able to help SUPers (likely like you) to find shops, destinations, spots, products, events, places to stay or weather conditions.

- Working with a team of writers will enable to TotalSUP to cover more subjects, in more languages and give visibility to more brands and businesses.

If I have been able to make TotalSUP a recognizable brand within the SUP world in less than two years on my own, just imagine how much WE could achieve together, with lots of suggestions from paddlers everywhere in the world, with the right technology and a team of people. 

The Perks / Rewards

- Anyone giving their support to the TotalSUP campaign will have their name displayed on a big Thank You page on TotalSUP.com and all social networks at then of the campaign

- From $12 to $50, receive a postcard from an international rider in your mail box, a TotalSUP mug, a TotalSUP teeshirt or a Howzit leash from our partner www.Howzit.com 

- Stand Up Paddle brands and businesses, riders, clubs etc.: Why not use this crowdfunding campaign to start marketing your business on TotalSUP.com via various packages of SEO-strong advertorial articles about you and your activities? Kill 2 birds with 1 stone: Get seen and get links from an "authority" website + all TotalSUP social network  and help TotalSUP grow! Various packages are available. I will get in touch and we can plan how to best communicate via TotalSUP. 

- Join the future TotalSUP business directory at discount rate ($75). We are determined to build the biggest ever SUP directory on the planet, for anyone to be able to find a brand, a shop, a club, a school, a camp, a distributor or manufacturer anywhere on this planet!

If you can't give any money...

You can still help! Your ideas and suggestions are more than welcome. They are in fact the cornerstone of TotalSUP. 

For more info, contact me mathieu@totalsup.com

story:
Our Story

Hi there! We are Josh & Lindsey Dugue, a coffee professional and a pastry chef, respectively, and we are making efforts to purchase a cafe in our Lincoln Square, Chicago, neighborhood. Since I (Lindsey) decided to pursue a career in pastry five years ago, everyone we met noted our compatibility: "You two should open a coffee shop together!" The enthusiasm of others quickly became a dream of ours and now we want to turn that dream of being business owners into a reality. We want to build a legacy for our family and neighbors and feel this is the right fit for us to do so. With over 20 years' combined experience in the cafe and bakery worlds, we are ready to take on a new challenge together and are excited to be a part of our community in a new way.  With your help, we will get the counsel needed to make the right investments to pave the way to ownership. 

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, we seek to raise $6,000 in 30 days. These funds will:

  • Afford us business counseling and guidance, enabling us to develop a solid and marketable brand
  • Provide some of our start-up and marketing costs as we develop the business 
The perks that we offer are under condition that the owner accepts our bid to purchase; we plan to make perks available in Spring 2016, once ownership has been transferred to us. Here's what you get in return for your contribution:  
$25: Chicago locals will receive a 14-visit punch card, which entitles you to one free coffee per punch. Donors outside of Chicago will receive two bags of our favorite roaster's best coffee delivered by UPS to your doorstep. 
$50: $25 Perks + a 1-hour coffee class with Josh, either in-house or Skype
$100: $50 Perks + a 1-hour baking class with Lindsey, either in-house or Skype
$500:$100 Perks + a 1-hour class with our kitchen chef, in-house only
$1000: $500 Perks + a private dinner for you and 4 friends, held at the shop
($1000 limited to 4)
If we are unable to reach our goal, the funds that we do get will still contribute to our plans, but we will have to secure other channels of investment, which will take more time to do than what we originally planned. 
We have leads on the investment needed to purchase the shop, but your contribution is an investment in us as we build a brand that we are confident will be successful and prolific. 
We look forward to meeting you in our shop for a cup of coffee and a tasty treat very soon!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, please feel free to cheer us on by sharing this campaign URL by Twitter, Facebook, Indiegogo share tools, and email. We are very excited about this opportunity and can't wait to share in our ongoing story with you!

Thank you for reading our story!

Thank you for your contribution!

Thank you for sharing!

story:
SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS was started in 2016 with the goal of bringing sustainable food production systems to schools across Canada. It is our vision to have aquaponics incorporated into the school curriculum.

Schools often have very limited budgets and SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS' aim is to develop a variety of more affordable aquaponic systems for schools. Funds received will be used to accomplish this goal!

SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS has been invited to take part in the Amazing Agriculture event at Northlands (May, 2017) - a free event for schools which will see over 40 schools taking part. The goal of the event is to educate children about where their food comes from. SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS ' new system designs will be shown at this event and available for schools to use in the future. It is hoped that this event will give SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS the opportunity to expand its program into more schools across Alberta and British Columbia.

SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS will also be working with James Stuart of St. Richards Catholic Elementary (Edmonton, AB) to develop an aquaponics curriculum that directly applies to the biology, chemistry, physics and mathematics school curriculums. We will be meeting with David Eggen, Minister of Education (Alberta) to take the initial steps in seeing how aquaponics could be incorporated into the Alberta School Curriculum. At the very least, it is hoped that this meeting will provide further opportunities to bring aquaponic systems to more schools.

SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS' fundraising platform is easy and works as follows: for every dollar you donate, SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS will apply this same amount as a rebate to any future workshop or system installation for a school, organization, business, group or individual of your choosing! SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS will issue you a receipt with the recipient of the rebate noted.

For more information about aquaponics and what makes it a highly sustainable form of agriculture, please read the information below!

-------
SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS was started in 2016 by Jonathan Luckhurst. Jonathan received his BSc in cell biology-genetics from the University of British Columbia in 2002, and from 2014-2015 was the lead builder for Nutraponics Canada’s aquaponics demonstration facility – Canada’s largest commercial aquaponics facility to date (http://www.nutraponics.ca). He is a graduate of the Aquaponic Farming Course, (Denver, Colorado, 2015).

SEA TO SKY AQUAPONICS  has had the privilege of working with clients such as BC Agriculture in the Classroom, Skwxwú7mesh Úxwumixw (Squamish First Nation), EchoFlex Solutions, Squamish Climate Action Network, Don Ross Middle School, Rick Hansen Secondary, St Richards Catholic Elementary and Strathcona Christian Academy.

-------

What is Aquaponics?
Aquaponics is a combination of aquaculture (fish farming) and hydroponics (growing plants without soil) and works because of the nitrification cycle - one of nature's most important ecological processes. In an aquaponics system, fish excrete ammonia in their waste which is converted to nitrates by nitrifying bacteria in the system. These nitrates are used by the plants for growth and reproduction. Another type of bacteria, heterotrophic bacteria, metabolize the solid fish waste in an entire spectrum of other macro and micronutrients which are also taken up by the plants. Can you see how an aquaponics system is symbiotic relationship between fish and plants that is orchestrated through the action of bacteria? Plants receive nutrients from the fish waste and fish are able live an environment free of toxic ammonia and nitrites. An aquaponics system is an ecosytem!

Why is Aquaponics Important?
Aquaponics is a sustainable form of agriculture and provides solutions to some of the problems facing our society. The benefits of aquaponics include :

(1) Water conservation
Traditional land based agriculture accounts for over 70% of fresh water usage! Aquaponics has a 90+% plus water conservation rate; the only water that is lost is due to evaporation and water uptake by plants ("transpiration"). Aquaponics can help to solve problems surrounding water shortages and droughts!

(2) Ability to grow food year round, anywhere
An aquaponics system can be installed anywhere you have a power source; they are becoming common in industrial and urban areas as well as in areas where food cannot be traditionally grown, such as in Northern Canada.

The ability to install an aquaponics system anywhere helps to reduce the monetary costs and the amount of fossil fuel consumption associated with shipping food vast distances.

Having access to fresh produce is also a huge benefit of having the ability to grow your food anywhere!

(3) High planting density
Aquaponics provides an optimal environment for plant growth and as such plants do not compete for nutrients. As a result you can grow your plants more closely together compared to growing your plants in soil.

Aquaponic system designs provide the option of stacking growbeds on top of one another. This style of growing is very common with commercial aquaponic (and hydroponic) farms and is known as “vertical farming”. Vertical farming also increases the amount of plants that can be grown per square foot of land.

(4) Food grown aquaponically is guaranteed to be organic
By the very nature of aquaponics you can’t spray pesticides on the plants as this will kill the fish. Furthermore, you can’t use antibiotics on the fish as this will kill the bacteria.

story:
"Toorora o PERK ndjina ondjinda yo $150.00 nokuyandja omatjangero omakahu wena roye otja tjimozeri okutjangwa komira yovatunge ovatenga. Nu tji wayandja kehi yo $150.00 ena roye karina kutjangwa komira" 

Mission & Vision

The overall mission of the project/campaign is to uplift and beautify the Historic sacred grounds at Ovaherero Traditional Authority (OTA) Erf 1755. Site to be known as Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC).

Specific Goals & Objectives

•1) erect anti-climb fence to secure the property,

•2) construct a commemorative brick walkway (interlocks with engraved text to reduce dust and pay tributes),

•3) landscape - trees & bed flowers to beautify the area at its best,

•4) construct a VIP/Activity outdoor stage to provide shade and sitting area,

•5) lavatory facilities with a time bound of 24 months.

Goals

The specific desired goals & objectives were stated above, however, the overall strategic vision is to:

•1) erect anti-climb fence to secure the property,

•2) construct a commemorative brick walkway (interlocks with engraved text to reduce dust and pay tributes),

•3) landscape - trees & bed flowers to beautify the area at its best,

•4) construct a VIP/Activity outdoor stage to provide shade and sitting area,

•5) construct lavatory facilities with a time bound of 24 months.

•6) construct track field - horses & troops,

•7) Herero House (HH)- office & dignitaries use,

•8) Ovaherero Museum, 

•9) Multipurpose Community Hall to generate weekly/monthly revue for OTA,

•10) life animal stalls, 11) construct sitting benches,

•12) Heroes Wall for our fallen heroes and heroines, 

•13) statues of our fallen Paramount Chiefs/Chiefs, etc.

Beneficiaries: Community Project By Us For Us

•The project will have positive social and economic impact to Okahandja and Namibia.

•The project will reinvigorate community pride by raising all three community flags plus the national flag, boost unity and increase annual attendees.

•Furthermore, the project will economically create jobs and aid in the fight against poverty.

•The project will beautify the Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC) site, the city of Okahandja at its best, and attract tourists to the city of Okahandja, and increase Namibian tourist industry.

Risks and Challenges

The goal is to have an open and transparent system in place to account for community funds. In order to achieve the financial goal each donor's name will appear on this site under backers,  a not for profit trust account is opened, online Namibian banking with instant notification will form part of the check and balances.  A monthly financial statement & quarterly auditing report will be released to the public per financial flowchart.   The diaspora communities agreed that all funds collected  through OCP network will strictly be used towards construction and maintenance of OCC at Erf 1755.

The Three (3) Project Phases

Phase One (1):Resources Mobilization.

Phase Two (2):Implementation/Execution.

Phase Three (3):Project Delivery.

We kick off Phase One (March 1st - 15 August 2016). We need your help to make this vision a reality and to give you a chance to shape the future of your community. 

Individual Pledge/Donation:

1) One time $200 CAD for those in the Diaspora (Canada, USA, UK, Europe, Russia, China, APAC & rest of outside world). Also, one time  N$200 NAD direct FNB deposit (Namibia, Botswana, South Africa & rest of Africa) contribution.  

2) Your NAME as sponsor get enshrined on "FOUNDERS' WALL". 

3) Take a tour every August at Okahandja and showcase family & friends of your positive contribution to the community.NOW to LEAVE A LEGACY BEHIND AT OKAHANDJA FOREVER".

Deadline: 15 August 2016. The Project anticipated completion date is August 2017

"Ngatu Ungure Ovyetu"

Disclaimer: Donations are non-refundable. All donated funds will be exclusively used for construction and maintenance of Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC) at Erf 1755. The donor or his/her heir(s) relinquish(es) future claim of ownership of donated funds or structures constructed with donated funds. All properties on Erf 1755 will be community properties managed or controlled by OTA (OvaHerero Traditional Authority), its leasing agent(s) or successor entities.

Phase Two (2):Implementation/Execution.
Phase Three (3):Project
Delivery.
We kick off Phase One (March 1st - 15 August 2016). We need your help to make this vision a reality and to give you a chance to shape the future of your community. 

Individual Pledge/Donation:
1) One time $200 CAD for those in the Diaspora (Canada, USA, UK, Europe, Russia, China, APAC & rest of outside world). Also, one time  N$200 NAD direct FNB deposit (Namibia, Botswana, South Africa & rest of Africa) contribution.  
2) Your NAME as sponsor get enshrined on "FOUNDERS' WALL". 
3) Take a tour every August at Okahandja and showcase family & friends of your positive contribution to the community.NOW to LEAVE A LEGACY BEHIND AT OKAHANDJA FOREVER".
Deadline: 15 August 2016. The Project anticipated completion date is August 2017
"Ngatu Ungure Ovyetu"


Disclaimer: Donations are non-refundable. All donated funds will be exclusively used for construction and maintenance of Ovaherero Cultural Centre (OCC) at Erf 1755. The donor or his/her heir(s) relinquish(es) future claim of ownership of donated funds or structures constructed with donated funds. All properties on Erf 1755 will be community properties managed or controlled by OTA (OvaHerero Traditional Authority), its leasing agent(s) or successor entities.

story:
We seek funds for the manufacturing of a world class,                             

                    D  I  S  I  N T  E  G R  A  T  O  R

  

        

My name is John Kearns of Kearns International Limited;  Challenged by a local municipality to find a solution to their ancient yet nagging dilemma of garbage disposal, I went about designing and constructing  a pilot unit capable of "being affordable", environmentally superior and accepting every known carcinogen bearing waste type (excluding radio active matter.) 

 



Designed along natural phenomena's; Gravity, Angle of Repose and near Stoichiometric conditions (Total Combustion), the Disintegrator renders all waste types inert and broken down to their basic elements. 

                

 


 NO CARBON !   

The end result is a system, now known as the Disintegrator which has demonstrated its ability to achieve the following criteria, which has never been heard of before, in the annals of thermal destruction.  


A  NEW  PARADIGM 

In the area of carbon, Regulators ask for 10 000 PPM we deliver a continuous 0.04 PPM, which is 250,000 times better then the EPA standard. 


In the area of ... Off gas THC's (total Hydrocarbons) from the stack, we are allowed 300 PPM but deliver 0.00 PPM.


 The Stack of the Disintegrator  with 0.00 THC's 



The Disintegrator is the worlds only purpose designed system to process all types of waste, with  total combustion, and totally autothermic, (not requiring the need for any supplementary fuel).   According to the British Thermal Institute, 4520 BTU's can be derived from one pound of North American  "run of the dump" garbage.  The Disintegrator extracts 7446 BTU'S.      


THE DISINTEGRATOR ....THE MOST EFFICIENT FIRE NEXT TO THE SUN 


A FEW FACTS : 


The Kearns Disintegration System (KDS) is the only technology in the World: 

To have closed an existing landfill without having it reopen at another location.


The client Six nations landfill, was the first landfill to be closed and not reopened an another location. 

To have 0.00   THC's ( total hydro carbons) at the stack.

 

To have a carbon-less ash of 0.04 PPM, without the use of any supplementary fuel.


To be able to exhume existing land fills.


That can accept all types of waste excluding radio active. 

   

To hold a Patent for burning water , thereby separating the hydrogen and oxygen molecule. 


What we need now is $5 million dollars to construct a brand new Pre-commercial unit  which we already have sale for , with the best Pollution Control Equipment to match our world class Thermal Destructor.

Any claims written or spoken of are supported by academic testimony from leading stack testers, universities  and laboratories .  We are also pleased to say that several university professor  engineer PhD's , leaders in their field, originally involved in the AMEC Report, back in 1990  on behalf of the Canadian Federal Government's ,  testing of the technology,  will  be joining us. They will be accompanied by qualified engineers  in each of the associated protocols covering the combustion , mechanical, and chemical engineering associated with each aspect of the entire machine. 

We also have, an  Astro Physicists from M. I .T who has studied our ash samples and  has compared the  ash sample  to that of a nuclear fusion inside the core of stars. How we do that with our fire, intrigues him and he looks forward to working with us further.  

Additionally  please find links to videos of the live operation of the pilot machine as well as testimonials from respectable sources  posted on our Facebook page , including a foreign  Government Ambassador a prospective client   who was present while the machine was in operation.  As well as documentation  of where we had a personal audience with that country's   Prime Minister to discuss the location and installation of the technology.   As well, we will  provide test reports done by AMEC, one of the leading Engineering testing companies in the world and  their corresponding data  as well as any other supporting material to any serious contributors.                                   
To date we have got to where we are now  more or less on our own .   What we now require is your  help to get us to that next stage .  We are on the verge of a significant opportunity to assist in making the world a cleaner and  better place. And with your help we will succeed. 


The above photo was taken a few days before we displayed the operation of our machine at our factory to some of the local public who had an interest in the technology.  Most could not believe that we actually made all of this 120 tonne machine ourselves, at our factory.  During the time of operation , approximately 30 people stood less then 80 feet from the machine while it operated and had lunch, tea or coffee and sandwiches.  At no time did anyone either complain amount the noise level or smell.  In fact on one occasion when asked about the smell, one person replied that they only smell they could sense was that of McDonald's, from across the street.

THE  BIRTH OF THE DISINTEGRATOR  1982


The first 20 ton per day machine under construction in the inventors back yard 1982-83. While primitive, it worked and to date there have been no changes with regard to the science.  In some respects the design based on natural phenomena, the machine performed even better than anticipated by " going over the top" in terms of its degree of destruction and has proven itself as a " Disintegrator".  In the process, it even disintegrated the water in the waste stream, breaking it down to its two basic elements, Hydrogen and Oxygen, thus becoming the fuel and providing an operational "Autothermic" condition ( No supplementary fuel required to operate ). 


The machine was essentially built by hand but standard engineering and welding practices were strictly adhered to 

The work crew, with a somewhat younger looking inventor on the extreme left. 
 

The INVENTORS BACK YARD UNLOADING THE FEED STOCK FOR THE BURN..
IN KEEPING WITH THE " PARTICULAR"  CLIMATE OF THE DAY , IT WAS THE FIRST TIME THAT SOMEONE, IN THIS CASE THE INVENTOR, WAS ARRESTED FOR PICKING UP GARBAGE.  AS WE AVAILED OURSELVES TO SOME AT THE CURBSIDE , RATHER THAN HAVE IT GO TO A LANDFILL .   


ITS  EVOLUTION 

Fast forward ten years to 1994. Our upgraded machine at the city landfill, where it ran non stop, fall, winter, spring and summer, it never cooled down and at a total cost of $326.00 for maintenance ad repairs. A bearing had to be replaced, so the inventor made one out of wood, until the new one arrived in. 

2000 AND A MORE ADVANCED MACHINE 


Spring of 2000 and the assembly of the inner ring of the 5 ton per day mobile unit.  The reason we built the less sophisticated 20 ton per day unit, was to eliminate the concerns of scale up, so often associated with such projects. 


5 ton mobile under construction 

The mobile unit allowed the user to travel to the client in such cases as farm and agricultural waste as well as that of boutique and hospitals waste.

ONE OF THE AMEC TEAM TAKING TEST READINGS  DURING OPERATION 


THE ABOVE PHOTO SHOWS ONE OF THE AMEC STAFF BLOWING INTO A DEVICE WHEN  THE FIRST READING FOR THC'S FROM THE STACK CAME BACK IT WAS 0.00 ...THE YOUNG ENGINEER THOUGHT THAT THE PIECE OF EQUIPMENT WAS FAULTY.  SINCE HE KNEW WHAT HIS OWN BREATH WOULD READ HE IS CHECKING TO SEE IF THE MACHINE WAS WORKING.  IT WAS DECIDED THAT HE SHOULD SPEAK TO HIS SUPERVISOR AND A FEW WEEKS LATER HE AND HIS SUPERVISOR  WHO HAD A PhD. IN ENGINEERING ARRIVED WITH A NEW MACHINE, AND WHEN THE SECOND TEST WAS DONE THE READING REMAINED UNCHANGED AT 0.00.   THE SCIENTIST LOOKED AT THE INVENTOR AND SAID... " DO YOU KNOW WHAT YOU HAVE HERE"...? TO WHICH THE INVENTOR REPLIED..." WITH A SHEEPISH GRIN....A VERY GOOD FIRE I THINK "...?  

THE AMEC TEAM  WHO TESTED THE MACHINE, OVER A 4 DAY PERIOD AND WITH A SLIGHTLY OLDER  BUT WISER INVENTOR ON THE RIGHT, FROM WHAT HE HAD LEARNED WITH THIS MORE ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY.  
 

SUMMER 2000 AND THE TON PER DAY MOBILE MACHINE GETTING SET UP FOR OPERATION.   IT WAS SHOWN TO HUNDREDS OF VISITORS THAT SUMMER.



Summer  2000 and the inventor with the mobile 5 ton unit at our factory. 


Summer 2013,  The 20 ton per day unit at our factory, prior to being shipped to the clients.  Due to the clients 3 foot water table, the delivery of the fuel source had to be elevated to accommodate their specific geological situation. 

Now with pilot and prototype models built and tested, we are ready to set up mass production assembly methods, making it completely flexible and capable of meeting the required waste throughput of any global community large and small at a price they can afford.  To do this we have a two pronged plan for expansion. (1). being  upgrading our manufacturing facility ( Currently a 120 year old foundry in much need of serious upgrade) and  (2) the introduction of State of the art ( SOTA) manufacturing equipment as in manipulation and processing metal by modern CNC methods.  We would like to point out that every piece that went into making machine was either fabricated at our plant, or purchased  from a supplier and simply  bolted on. 

THE KEARNS WASTE PROCESSING FACILITY OF THE FUTURE, BUILT ON AN OVER AND UNDER CONSTRUCTION, WHERE THE VEHICLES WILL DRIVE IN AND THE GARBAGE PROCESSED, ALLOWING GRAVITY AND OTHER NATURAL PHENOMENA TO DO THE REST.  
 

                              YOUR   LAND   FILL  OF  THE  FUTURE 


Given what, you have just read, and what we have been able to achieve you might be asking yourself,  why we have not as yet achieved commercial success?   And that is a fair question. 

We are not ashamed to say that over the years everything we have of a financial nature has already been put into this project.   On our first project with a local municipality  the inventor offered to fund  half of the project  at well over one million dollars  and the  municipality  the other half.   Had that first client  honored the  terms of the contract we would not find ourselves in the position we presently do, namely seeking outside funding help.  However, due to  a change in the political power structure and the installation  of a new Warden for the County, that was not to be the case.  Upon taking over the reigns of the county, the new Warden had  the contract cancelled, despite that fact that we had already cashed the initial down payment. 
On two separate occasions with  signed letters of acceptance from clients, including down payments,  only to have the process sabotaged by political interference, greed and corruption.   We knew the tremendous significance on the technology and so did " they".    And " they" wanted it....badly.   
The so called " they"  and the  Government  they represented  had power and influence within the community, so much so that  following our initial success back in 1983,  the inventor  had a visit from two Minister's in the Government along with two  lawyers at which time he was told by them that whatever he needed they would supply.   All they wanted was half the company. They were ordered off the property.  That was on a Friday.
On the following Monday morning the bank contacted the owner and called in the mortgage on his home.  It was their way of doing business.  "If you don't play the game with us,  you don't get to play it with anyone". 
This same government representative, who several weeks earlier had  asked for technical documentation on the technology so he could run it through his department.  The information he requested was given  to  him , thinking he would try and assist us, as well as a list of our clients,  which he has asked for several of whom we were in negotiations with at the time.  And with that information,  a representative from his department  later contacted each and every prospective client, using his position of power and authority and told them that the inventor was a fraud and that he had no such technology. 

 
In one case,  one of those prospective clients called the owner and shared with him what had just happened.   He went on to say the he told government representative that he didn't believe him as he had seen the machine in operation with his own eyes.  And as for the technical  documentation that was given to that Minister,  later when  he was asked about it, he replied " that it had been lost".

Having fought off literally dozens of hostile take-overs and plain theft, we have gone through unbelievable harassment from government and private sector bodies who were interest only in buying or exploiting the technology for their own personal gain as well  that of their political friends, rather than for the benefit to the environment. 

In 2009, we were approached by an "International Merchant Banking Group" who did not have the best interests of the company in mind, and through a number of illegal activities, including fraud and forgery, tried unsuccessfully to steal the company.  And over the next four years, we fought them off successfully through the Supreme Court of Ontario.  Given our financial constraints at that time,  it was the first time, according to the judge, that an individual, other than a lawyer had represented a corporation in the Ontario Supreme Court. 
Over the years we have experienced blackmail, extortion, break and enter, theft, explosions, gunfire, poisoned water, political misbehavior and sheer illegal activities, all with the same purpose in mind, to make it as difficult as possible for us to succeed.  "On more then one occasion, we have come across a retired employee from one of these agencies, ( after all, 32 years has been a long time )...  only to hear him say...," I was told to do a hatchet job on you. We understood and express no animosity or anger toward him... He said " I'm just doing what I was  told to do"...., just like the bank manager.    
On the second and most recent occasion,  A letter of acceptance in our possession as well as down payments,  we were forced off the work site at the reported threat of rifles being pointed at us. The previous day, notification of the acceptance of the technology was printed in the clients local newspaper advising the community that they would be going ahead with the implementation of the technology and that we would be moving on to price negations.  

Armed with this information, the very next day,  a group of about 50 Warriors confronted the inventor, and under the threat of rifles being pointed at him was forced off the work site.  Given the nature of the individuals involved, THE WARRIORS,  he took that threat seriously as he feared for his safety.  As several years earlier it was this same WARRIORS  group who were at the now infamous Oka standoff",  where an R.C.M.P police officer was shot and killed by a high powered rifle. 
As you can see it has not been an easy road.  And by sharing just some of this with you,  the reader will have a much better understanding as to why it has taken as long as it has.  Despite disappointment and hardship we have stayed the course and will continue to do so, until such time that we have achieved our goal of commercial success.  We are poor but principled people. One of our staff members a retired university and college business professor has been on staff for 6 years at no pay.  While the owner and CEO , has never drawn a salary in 32 years.  
While 32 years might seem like a long time to bring a new technology forward to the marketplace,  it is well in line with other significant world class innovations.  The seat belt, fax machine, micro wave oven, electric dishwasher and computer, just to name a few, have all experienced similar 30 plus years time line to market.  

Prior to the Disintegrator, the inventor had developed a number of other creative technologies in the areas of Agriculture, Construction, Energy, Printing, Highway Safety, Veterinary, Soft Toy Assembly, as well as Waste Management, and presently holds a number of related Patents.  As well, he will now be making a number of new patent applications based on the success of the tested technology.

We  ask that you consider giving to this campaign and that you share this information with your friends and colleagues.  Please use the Indiegogo,
 "share tools". 
As we know  even the longest journey starts with a single step and with your help, we will walk the final leg of this journey together.  Hand in hand, "as many hands make less work" ....And now hopefully we will have your hands, to help us, and your hearts as well. 
We sincerely thank you, for your kindness and support.  You contribution will help make a significant difference in helping create a better world for so many people.

Having fought off literally dozens of hostile take-overs and plain theft, we have gone through unbelievable harassment from government and private sector bodies who were interest only in buying or exploiting the technology for their own personal gain as well  that of their political friends, rather than for the benefit to the environment. 

In 2009, we were approached by an "International Merchant Banking Group" who did not have the best interests of the company in mind, and through a number of illegal activities, including fraud and forgery, tried unsuccessfully to steal the company.  And over the next four years, we fought them off successfully through the Supreme Court of Ontario.  Given our financial constraints at that time,  it was the first time, according to the judge, that an individual, other than a lawyer had represented a corporation in the Ontario Supreme Court. 
Over the years we have experienced blackmail, extortion, break and enter, theft, explosions, gunfire, poisoned water, political misbehavior and sheer illegal activities, all with the same purpose in mind, to make it as difficult as possible for us to succeed.  "On more then one occasion, we have come across a retired employee from one of these agencies, ( after all, 32 years has been a long time )...  only to hear him say...," I was told to do a hatchet job on you. We understood and express no animosity or anger toward him... He said " I'm just doing what I was  told to do"...., just like the bank manager.    
On the second and most recent occasion,  A letter of acceptance in our possession as well as down payments,  we were forced off the work site at the reported threat of rifles being pointed at us. The previous day, notification of the acceptance of the technology was printed in the clients local newspaper advising the community that they would be going ahead with the implementation of the technology and that we would be moving on to price negations.  


Armed with this information, the very next day,  a group of about 50 Warriors confronted the inventor, and under the threat of rifles being pointed at him was forced off the work site.  Given the nature of the individuals involved, THE WARRIORS,  he took that threat seriously as he feared for his safety.  As several years earlier it was this same WARRIORS  group who were at the now infamous Oka standoff",  where an R.C.M.P police officer was shot and killed by a high powered rifle. 


As you can see it has not been an easy road.  And by sharing just some of this with you,  the reader will have a much better understanding as to why it has taken as long as it has.  Despite disappointment and hardship we have stayed the course and will continue to do so, until such time that we have achieved our goal of commercial success.  We are poor but principled people. One of our staff members a retired university and college business professor has been on staff for 6 years at no pay.  While the owner and CEO , has never drawn a salary in 32 years.  


While 32 years might seem like a long time to bring a new technology forward to the marketplace,  it is well in line with other significant world class innovations.  The seat belt, fax machine, micro wave oven, electric dishwasher and computer, just to name a few, have all experienced similar 30 plus years time line to market.  


Prior to the Disintegrator, the inventor had developed a number of other creative technologies in the areas of Agriculture, Construction, Energy, Printing, Highway Safety, Veterinary, Soft Toy Assembly, as well as Waste Management, and presently holds a number of related Patents.  As well, he will now be making a number of new patent applications based on the success of the tested technology.

We  ask that you consider giving to this campaign and that you share this information with your friends and colleagues.  Please use the Indiegogo,

 "share tools". 

As we know  even the longest journey starts with a single step and with your help, we will walk the final leg of this journey together.  Hand in hand, "as many hands make less work" ....And now hopefully we will have your hands, to help us, and your hearts as well. 
We sincerely thank you, for your kindness and support.  You contribution will help make a significant difference in helping create a better world for so many people.

story:
Who Are These Scruff Muffins?

When senior year of college rolled around, we had the same thought thousands of others in our position are haunted by: how are we supposed to get a job? Our plan shifted from sending out hundreds of job applications to simply turning the side hustle we loved into a full-time gig. Since 2013, the team at Out There Productions has created shareable videos for startups around Syracuse,  NY. It has been an incredible experience helping passionate entrepreneurs grow their ideas into real companies. 

Dedicating our limited free time as college students to the startup community in Syracuse was an easy choice to make, but now we want to do even more. Studying at Syracuse University’s acclaimed S.I. Newhouse School of Public Communications has given us the skills we need to convey powerful stories, but it’s come time for us to really put our training in virtual reality, Adobe’s Creative Suite, state-of-the-art camera equipment, and impactful storytelling to work.

The next step for Out There Productions is taking our skills on the road to help startups in communities across the United States: we're building our own "skoolie."

We are going to buy a bus, renovate it into a working and living space, and run our company out of it while we drive across the country to the coolest startups we can find. We become the biggest fans of the companies we work with. Our videos help grow their ventures, our experiences mentor their leaders, and all of our adventures might just inspire the country to get itself Out There! 


Put Your Money Where Our Bus Is

Your donation helps us:

  • Purchase an old school bus
  • Refurbish and renovate the space
  • Buy emergency gear if (when) the bus breaks down
  • Acquire food & water for our Lewis & Clark adventure into entrepreneurship
  • Kickstart (or, uh, make us Indiegetget?) our company on the road

Why A Skoolie?

When we decided to grow our own company into a business that could support us after college, we aimed to do the most epic thing we possibly could. As we built our new venture we borrowed inspiration from the most epic organizations we could think of. To us, the most amazing adventures ever were NASA’s first missions into space. That’s why our job titles are inspired by NASA’s original ranks.

CAPCOM refers to the spacecraft (or capsule) communicator. At NASA, their job is to link the astronauts to flight control. At OTPros, our CAPCOM (Erin) coordinates every mission. She ensures everyone does their job on a project, and helps connect our team to the small business we’re helping.

NASA’s FLIGHT (or Flight Director) is responsible for the mission as a whole, and everything loaded onto the space shuttle. For us, FLIGHT (Johnny) manages the everything pertaining to the videos we create. We depend on our FLIGHT to make sure every part of a video gets filmed, and to edit all the scenes together to create our final product.

Our GC, or Ground Controller is the final piece of the Out There puzzle. The real GC is responsible for telemetry and commands NASA’s mission control center. They also direct maintenance and the overall operation of the space shuttles. Our GC (Losa) is responsible for all of our equipment. She makes sure we get the best scenes on every shoot. Her experience in the film industry guarantees us the quality footage we need to make the most compelling videos possible.

Together, CAPCOM, FLIGHT, GC, and you help make Out There Productions the most epic adventure we’ve ever undertaken.



When Your #SquadGoals Is Your Squad

Erin exemplifies relentless entrepreneurship. Out There Productions is the second company she’s founded (she opened a late-night cafe in her dorm her second week in college), and it’s become her obsession. Telling everyone about the incredible startups around her satisfies her thirst for excitement. In May, she will receive her Bachelor of Science degree from the S.I. Newhouse School of Public Communications at Syracuse University in Advertising (with an emphasis in Emerging Businesses and Technologies), and a minor in Information Technology, Web Design and Startups.

During the first three years of her college career, she worked on the Innovation and Disruptive Entrepreneurship Accelerator as a student ambassador to advise and start up over 100 student companies. This past summer, she worked with a strong staff of four at the number one accelerator in Central New York, the StartFast Venture Accelerator, where she facilitated a program that grew 5 businesses (selected from an application group of 2,000 worldwide) over the course of 13 weeks. She is currently a startup researcher at the South By Southwest Interactive Festival.

Johnny is an expert in finding stories that matter. He is primarily in command of storytelling and design. However, he is crucial to the artistic direction as well. In May, he will receive his Bachelor of Science degree from the S.I. Newhouse School of Public Communications at Syracuse University in Magazine Journalism with a minor in Information Technology, Web Design and Startups.

He is currently the Editor At Large of Medley Magazine, with previous experience as a Reporting Intern at the Arlington Advocate. He is also a certified Maine Camp Trip Leader, with further certifications in Wilderness First Aid through SOLO, Small Water Craft Instruction through the American Canoe Association, and High Ropes Facilitation through High Five. Johnny’s experience in outdoor adventure will be our lifeblood as we travel the country and camp out of our modified school bus.

Out There Productions is the most intrepid and intense escapade Johnny has ever embarked upon. In addition to riffing with the CAPCOM to create the perfect video narratives, Johnny is seriously excited by the power and capacity of passionate humans.

Losa is a magician with any kind of camera she gets her hands on. She manages all production and partnerships. In May she will receive her Bachelor of Science degree from the S.I. Newhouse School of Public Communications at Syracuse University in Television, Radio, and Film with a minor in Sociology.

She co-directed a documentary film in Mumbai, India and has worked in production on four film sets in Los Angeles. Accepted to the Emma Bowen Foundation Fellows Program during her freshman year of college, for the past three years she has completed summer internships at The Arsenio Hall Show, Entertainment Tonight, and CBS Films. During her junior year, she founded the Syracuse University chapter of Delta Kappa Alpha, the national professional cinematic arts fraternity, to unite passionate storytellers across the campus.

Losa believes in the adventure that embodies Out There Productions. She passionately pursues storytelling and the human connection. She loves applying her talents to our squad of motivated and dream-driven individuals. 

Where Have You Been All My Life?

Besides rocking explainer videos with Out There Productions, the crew have worked some other epic side hustles:

What Can A Bunch Of Students Do?

Out There Productions specializes in getting great ideas Out There. While working in our spare time at Syracuse University, we focused on local organizations and student startups. Our innovative clients include but are not limited to:


Our Brain Trust

We are super fortunate to have amazing mentors that help us through the growth of our company. Whenever we have speed bumps or need some fresh eyes on a video, these are the people to go to. They have amazing startup experience and their combined wisdom helps us unlock our potential. Special thanks to:
  • Sean Branagan (@sean_branagan)
  • Gabriela Escalante (@gab_escalante)
  • Michael Gursha (@mgursh)
  • Mura Gichane (@mryoungscholar)
  • Dylan Kim (@brevitedesign)

Shoutout to Antonio Zugaldia for his captivating Reddit-related photo in our pitch video! He in no way endorses or is affiliated with Out There Productions, but we used his image thanks to Creative Commons rights.

story:
Greetings and thanks for taking the time to learn more about our cause. I'm Joe Corrado, both farmer at and owner of Joe's Blues, producer of some of the sweetest blueberries the Midwest has ever tasted.

Believe it or not, growing blueberries, or really any sort of fruit or vegetable with organic methods is not an easy process. Aside from maintaining a healthy supply of water, soil nutrients, and creating, gathering, and distributing natural fertilizers, we have a new issue to worry about—an invasion of the highly destructive Spotted Wing Drosophila,

"What the heck is a 'Spotted Wing Drosophila'," you might ask. Well, we were wondering the exact same thing!

It turns out that it's a little fly from the West that has absolutely wreaked havoc on our crop. This past summer, the farm suffered serious losses because of an infestation, which also happened to come right on the heels of two harsh winters. Joe’s Blues Farm Revival's goal is to invest in extensive activities and materials to restore the health and productivity of our 2,400, 8 - 10 foot bushes, through trimming, increased amounts of organic nutrients, and bush replacement. These measures will ensure that our farm continues to operate, so we can continue to produce plentiful crops of blueberries for our expanding base of passionate customers throughout the United States.

About Those "Passionate Customers"

My father, Frank, and I quickly discovered that our customers absolutely loved the taste of these sweet “jersey” and "blue crop" blueberries, which have a reputation for their natural sweetness. Blueberry lovers are turned off by the “blahberries,” as my father calls them, that are sold in most stores. To the grocer, blueberries are blueberries, but Joe’s Blues fans know better. They know what blueberries are supposed to taste like. Sampling them for the first time at our many farmers' market appearances, customers have been referred to our blues as “Wow” and “Oh My God” berries.

About Joe's Blues

I made the decision long ago to not spray pesticides and chemicals on these beautiful, majestic, blueberry bushes. I wanted to have kids and give them a healthy start. All of us at the farm take pride in our naturally grown, raw blueberries raised and harvested in beautiful Bangor, Michigan. Our goal is to grow Joe's Blues into the Chiquita or Dole of blueberries, but with the setbacks we've suffered over the past few years, we've seen our crop get smaller and smaller every year.  Without your help we will eventually have to shut our doors.

So please join my father and I in our quest to revive these great blueberry fields, and continue to bring what is considered the world's healthiest food to our customers, both local and across the country. There are some great perks ranging from t-shirts and freezer bags, to bags and boxes of our signature berries, and even a magical evening at the farm. Help us preserve the tastiest blueberries ever grown. Help keep the "blues" alive and JOIN THE REVIVAL TODAY!

Testimonials!

"Plump, sweet and awesome."
- Jim Slama, CEO of FamilyFarmed, Chicago

"Your blueberries are truly amazing. I tried them out in my morning smoothie. They have such great taste and amazing color."
- Cid Abel, Kalamazoo

"I work at Growing Home in Chicago - we put your blueberries into our CSA this year and last, and they're far and away the best I've ever had."
- Rebecca Silverman, Evanston, IL

"My husband hates blueberries, but he loves yours!"
- Chicago customer

story:
Jennifer Jones, CEO/President of Foods to Fit.

Jennifer — a San Diego native — has been a part of the health and fitness community for over 16 years. As a dancer, a dance educator, and pilates instructor, movement has always been in the orbit of her existence. She is mat certified and has worked at Keen Fitness, Cross Train L.A., and Cresskill School for Performing Arts. Between San Francisco and New York Jennifer has worked in Michelin Star-rated restaurants as well as many fine dining establishments. Learning how to cook with her Father at an early age she quickly became a whiz in the kitchen. In 2005 Her fitness goals coupled themselves with those skills and right-eating and she began casually hosting small dinner parties and catering small events. She is known for her excellence in taste and presentation. Guilty pleasure? Enchiladas. She currently resides in Studio City, CA.


Foods to Fit is a service for you. For the mom. For the busy exec. For the athlete and for the artist who doesn’t have time to stop. Or simply for the person who just can’t be bothered cooking. There is such a high-demand for this service in the L.A. area and in order to Supply the Demand that has already been placed on this business we need to hire some very key players to help this business go start off without a hitch!


YOUR CONTRIBUTION will go towards:

Renting out the commercial Kitchen that you saw on the video weekly $2500 a month.

Hiring a staff of 12 to help execute this small business in complete excellence (that includes the Head Chef (salaried), 2 prep cooks, 2 cooks, 3 delivery drivers, customer service and order rep, insurance, and much more.

Inventory- Cost of Food (working with organic and local farmers $$) It also includes BPA Free Togo Containers, Cooler Bags, Disposable Cutlery.

Advertising and Promotional Cost. We will be doing many events around Southern CA to get the word out about Foods To Fit. These events will be free to the public and we need to cover the cost for inventory.

SO HOW MUCH DO WE NEED?

90% of food/restaurant businesses fail within the first year and 5% percent in the next 5 years. That means only 5% of restaurant/food businesses make it and I want to be one of them. We are trying to raise $50,000 to go into the business, pay the very qualified employees what they deserve and worth (I believe in creating a happy and very healthy work environment) food costs and any unforeseen glitches in the future. Foods To Fit in the near future wants to purchase it's own facility to service the greater Los Angeles area as well as host numerous catered events. This amount of money supports our first year as a business and gives us a good base of support.

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DON'T RAISE ALL THE FUNDS?

We will 100% continue with the project! It will just take a little longer and our momentum will slow significantly. We do have clients interested in the service and they are looking forward to it fully launching in January 2016!

WE APPRECIATE YOUR SUPPORT and encourage you to share this link on all of your social media sites as much as possible. The more contributors the easier we can reach that goal!! Plus when you partner with us you get some pretty cool swag! Thank you!

*** Check out some of our very cool Perks!!

story:
We are a barber school in East Oakland, CA that educates members of the community who aspire to become licensed barbers. The Academy will offer comprehensive course instruction and practical experience to help our students succeed in the haircare industry upon graduation. OBA will also provides quality and low-cost barbering services to members of the surrounding neighborhoods.

 

Just miles away from Silicon Valley, East Oakland is a community with many challenges: a failing school system and few employment opportunities have led to poverty, gang activity, and overall helplessness. Situated at the center of the Bay Area, it’s on the brink of gentrification and rising housing costs that’s plagued San Francisco and other parts of Oakland. 

 

Oakland, CA is a special place. As the birthplace of the Black Panther Party, and independent hip hop music business models, we are an example of the positive impact of black economic empowerment.

 

At the same time, Barbering is a profession at the core of the African American experience. Barbershops are neighborhood watering holes, and barbers are more than just personal groomers; we’re mentors, therapists, juries, families and leaders. 

 

With entrepreneurship and economic empowerment in mind, OBA was created to provide opportunities for economic growth and sustainability for African Americans in a rapidly gentrifying city. We contribute to the City of Oakland’s job training resources by establishing a structured training environment and world-class curriculum designed to transform lives, families and communities.  Upon successful completion of our program students will be ready to pass the California State Board of Barbering Examination in order to successfully launch their careers.

 

While I’m one man with a vision, I know the success of OBA will require many hands and resources. I’m crowdfunding to give the community - both locally in Oakland but also nationwide- the opportunity to participate in the development of OBA. 

 

Starting a school is no small feat. It requires permits, registrations, staff, equipment, curriculum, and much more. OBA must secure enough funding in order to meet the state’s financial requirements for operating a vocational school. 

 

Your contributions will cover start-up expenses such as: consultants, state registrations, barber chairs, barber stations with mirrors, textbooks, classroom equipment and an inventory of professional barber supplies.

 

Challenges are inevitable as we move forward in the building process but OBA’s community-driven team members are committed to overcoming obstacles as they present themselves. 

 

Our risks include:

  • Securing enough funding in order to meet the state’s financial requirements for operating a vocational school.  Our set Indiegogo goal will place us within that range allowing us to officially start construction. 
  • Procuring enough students for our initial enrollment. The state requires that we have a minimum of 15 students registered prior to opening our doors. With a well-promoted campaign, obtaining this amount of students is a surmountable task.
story_txt:
We are a barber school in East Oakland, CA that educates members of the community who aspire to become licensed barbers. The Academy will offer comprehensive course instruction and practical experience to help our students succeed in the haircare industry upon graduation. OBA will also provides quality and low-cost barbering services to members of the surrounding neighborhoods. Just miles away from Silicon Valley, East Oakland is a community with many challenges: a failing school system and few employment opportunities have led to poverty, gang activity, and overall helplessness. Situated at the center of the Bay Area, it’s on the brink of gentrification and rising housing costs that’s plagued San Francisco and other parts of Oakland.  Oakland, CA is a special place. As the birthplace of the Black Panther Party, and independent hip hop music business models, we are an example of the positive impact of black economic empowerment. At the same time, Barbering is a profession at the core of the African American experience. It requires permits, registrations, staff, equipment, curriculum, and much more. OBA must secure enough funding in order to meet the state’s financial requirements for operating a vocational school.  Your contributions will cover start-up expenses such as: consultants, state registrations, barber chairs, barber stations with mirrors, textbooks, classroom equipment and an inventory of professional barber supplies. Challenges are inevitable as we move forward in the building process but OBA’s community-driven team members are committed to overcoming obstacles as they present themselves.  Our risks include:
Securing enough funding in order to meet the state’s financial requirements for operating a vocational school.  Our set Indiegogo goal will place us within that range allowing us to officially start construction. 
Procuring enough students for our initial enrollment. The state requires that we have a minimum of 15 students registered prior to opening our doors. With a well-promoted campaign, obtaining this amount of students is a surmountable task.

story:
Waterloo V2 

*Strategies on outreach

*Organizing groups

*Creating directories to connect with Black businesses

*Organizing retainer pools for Black lawyers

*Networking with independent Black owned schools

*Creating discussion panels with Black health professionals

*and much more.

 

The Waterloo V2 is a 100% non-partisan endeavor. An event like this could be perceived as a challenge to entities with certain political motivations. So we have to be careful not to be swayed by potential outside agitators and saboteurs who wish to undermine a positive project of this magnitude.

story:
About Persephone's Folly 

   Persephone's Folly provides beautiful authentic ritual and magical products to the Pagan community. From Hand-bound Italian Leather Books of Shadows, authentic New Orleans Voodoo Dolls, Magical Goat Milk Soaps and wild-crafted Herbs ,our products are crafted and designed for the experienced practitioner as well as the mage just starting out along The Path. 

  With our move to a physical space we will also be in a unique position here in Lower Northern Michigan to make community gathering, work shops and hands on purchases of supplies and art available to Pagans and Pagan-friendly clients a reality. 

Why This Campaign? 

 There are a couple of reasons that we have begun this campaign.

  Of course there is the monetary aspect- paying for the start up of a physical space is expensive and the more help we can get get in funding the more items and resources we can offer to our Community. 

  Community is key! Persephone's Folly will be a community space and as such we want your involvement - both energetically and physically - in this conjuration. Because that is what this is! A wonderful Conjure for the creation of something physical from the internet-ether! Please come along with us on this magical journey!

  We are asking for a Year and Day's worth of  space overhead- appropriate symbolism, isn't it? This money will go to mundane business aspects such as rent and utilities. The help we receive will free us to offer workshops, classes, and community events. If we do not reach our target goal the donations we do receive will still go directly to those overhead costs detailed above. 

  In exchange for your physical donation we have set up an amazing array of 'Thank You Gifts' that are unique to our company. From authentic New Orleans Voodoo Dolls, to one of a kind jewelry, and personalized Readings. We've even included our exclusive Coven-sized Books of Shadows and House Cleansings and Blessings! 

The Impact 

 By becoming a direct part of this momentous event you are making yourself a part of a larger community of people, allowing for a freedom of expression not currently found in Lower North West Michigan, as well as supporting a valuable resource for those who currently feel alone in their beliefs and practices. Your support will also help to bring about a greater community Outreach in that our presence will allow for a more honest and welcoming exchange of ideas and education within our geographical area. 

 Obviously there are risks to our venture. We are open to these challenges, fully believing that our Gods often provide these as opportunities in order to grow and learn along the way to success.  Some of these challenges may show up in the following scenarios-

1. We may not be immediately accepted as a physical presence within the Northern Michigan community.  Our response to this is to be ever welcoming and available for others to learn about different paths and ways of worship. We will not invite nor incite controversy for controversies sake but we will offer compassion and education for those who are willing to understand and learn.

2. We may encounter retail 'down time' due to the seasonal aspect of our location.  Our response to this will be sound and responsible business practices as this is first and foremost a business. We cannot be a community resource if there is no place for the community to come to. Seasonal hours may differ, number of staff may vary and outreach may be scheduled differently as the seasons dictate. 

Help That Costs You Nothing ~

 While we absolutely LOVE physical donations we realize that not everyone can do that and that's OK- really! So what can you do that won't cost you a single cent?

  Share! share! share! Please share this campaign far and wide! Share on social media, with your Circle or gathering, in an email or call someone and tell them about it. The positive energy that your provide to this project is invaluable.

story:
My name is Rashad Armstead and I am a chef from the bay area with a passion for culinary art and serving communities. The purpose behind me starting this campaign is to open a door for those who don't get exposed to opportunities that will propel them in this world. This is something that has always been close to my heart and God has been building the foundation I need in order to accomplish these goals. Contributors to my campaign will allow me to further pursue my mission and help to elevate it. 

   For my campaign, I am looking to get 10,000 people to donate $100 in order to meet our $1M goal, that will fund our mission. With that money, I will be able to first and foremost keep both Crave BBQ and Grammies fully functional. In turn, I will be able to employ underserved people in the community and give them opportunities that will teach them leadership, teamwork, entrepreneurial skills, and culinary skills. I want to be able to provide a space for those who are looking to further there interest in the food industry and offer a place for them to water that seed. If I was unable to meet my goal, anything that I gain through this will still aid me in pursuing our mission. 

   I feel as though what makes my campaign important is that it's bigger than just me or you, this is something that is geared toward shedding light on making it so everyone has a voice and a purpose. Thus far with faith and hard work I have been able to achieve the successful opening of multiple restaurants. With the help of you all, I will be able to take these restaurants to the next level and make it so they are not only a catalyst for great food but also a source of hope within the community. 

   With doing something that carries so much significance I have already prepared myself for some hardship and challenges. Just as I have overcome many adversities and trials in life, I will continue to step out on faith and put my all into everything I do. When a problem arises I have been tested enough times to know that somethings are out of my control, but what I can control is the mindset I adopt when facing problems. With that being said I am determined to see this succeed and will push through any and all things in order to reach my end goal. 

   If you are not able to donate, that's ok, you can also help us by sharing this campaign. Spreading our message and mission would greatly help us and allow for us to reach more people. Thank you so much for even taking the time to become familiar with what we are trying to do. The sky is the limit and with faith and perseverance anything is possible.

story:
Hello! We're the Courtney's and we're opening Hillsboro's first Parkour facility.

We grew up with a love for moving playfully and as adults, we never enjoyed going to a traditional gym. As our family grew we found it even harder to find time to exercise or manage our schedules to get away.

Even though we replaced our living room furniture with a spring floor a year ago, working out at home was also challenging with our to-do list (and kids) calling our attention.

We found ourselves gravitating towards outdoor activities and playing on the playground with our kids as our preferred choice for movement.

We wanted to create a space that moved as our family did and gave permission for adults and children to learn, play and move together with joy.

When we were introduced to Parkour we knew we'd found the perfect movement form to bring our dream to our community of Hillsboro, Oregon.    

We are excited about our location and it's huge potential for both movement and community events. The space we found fits our long-term vision for The Movement Park perfectly, however, it is almost 2,000 sq ft larger than our original plan and budget.

With the way the market is right now, we took our space "as is" meaning all tenant improvements were on us and we've had to adjust our budget for building obstacles to cover our additional paint and flooring cost that came with our location. 

We've decided to launch this campaign in hopes to continue to build and add on to our obstacle playground before classes being October 15th!

We're almost finished with construction on our warped wall and "playhouse" areas and with your donations, we're planning to continue to add more features and versatility to The Movement Park.  

About the owners:

Molly is National Board Certified Health & Wellness Coach with 17 years of coaching experience. 

Brandon is an Electrical Engineer at Intel who loves coming up with innovative ideas and efficient solutions.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a breakdown of how your donations will help.

  • Paint on walls & obstacles - $2000.
  • Additional flooring $2000
  • Meeting room furniture $1500
  • Additional bathroom supplies (most warehouses have one... we have three + two shower rooms!) $500
  •  Mind/body room + spin bikes $3000
  • Extend our phase 1 build out with additional features and obstacles $1500 

*Please take a look at the HUGE member discounts we are offering as perks for your donations listed on the right side of your screen. 

     

    We understand not everyone can contribute, but you can still help!

    • Help us spread the word by sharing this on social media with Indiegogo's handy sharing tools!
    • We need volunteers to help paint! Please reach out if you love painting! 

    Starting this business is our dream and we are so grateful for this opportunity.  With our young family, it can also be challenging at times. Funds will help extend our build-out and provide more fun things in our space, but even a like, comment, share, or email means the world to us!

    To see our community get excited about something we've been working to bring to Hillsboro for a long time has been our fuel during long days and... did I mention endless painting :)!

    We are beyond grateful for everyone reaching out and supporting us and for all of your donations here. We CAN'T WAIT to meet, play and move with you at The Movement Park!  

    If you are donating from out of town please choose "Back It" to make a contribution of your choice not associated with a member service perk and we'll send you a T-shirt, mug and ebook as tokens of our appreciation.
