story:
Short Summary

Introduction / Business Background (The Magic Mugs)

The sale of customized mugs both plain and "magic" (i.e. thermal color-changing mugs) have caught on very well over the years. My name is William Plange and I am the founder of Mr. Plange Services, a service aimed at easing the burden on individuals with heavy schedules by running time-consuming errands for them.  These include assisting in documentation, customization of products, liaison, sales & marketing of goods and services, as well as providing business consultation to budding local businesses. 

I present to you, my most recent business expansion, 'The Magic Mug'.

The magic mug has very amazing features which attract individuals and groups. There is transformation when hot liquid is poured into them revealing their own pictures, corporate logos, etc. Magic mugs are mostly used to surprise people on their special occasions such as birthdays, corporate events, weddings, and personal gifts to loved ones. There are also plain mugs where personalized photos are placed to serve as memories for special events and occasions.

Starting with only one heat press mug machine, I got my money back from the cost of the machine in just 2 months of sales. The subsequent months up until now have been profits.

What We Need & What You Get

How Magic Mugs are Made

When orders are placed, pictures and inscription details are taken from clients through WhatsApp or mail, and exported and designed on Adobe Illustrator. After the design, I send it to the client to confirm the preview. After confirmation, I go out to print the design on a sublimation printer, as I do not own one, then I go back to my home office to wrap the printed design on the specially coated mugs and set them in my mug heat press machine for a few minutes, and the magic mug is ready!

Who am I targeting?

I am targeting the following:

Families, hotels, restaurants, all corporate bodies and companies, individuals, churches, youth clubs, event organizers, wedding planners, government workers, politicians, and more! 

A magic mug is for all.

Why I Need Funding

A magic mug is very profitable in Ghana. Only a few people are aware of such a product with the amazing feature of seeing their images appear surprisingly by just pouring hot liquid in the mugs. 

In December 2020 I had a deal to design and make 100 mugs for Silas Cash Company, which was a mobile money vendor that wanted to give out customized mugs as gifts to its cherished customers, thanking them for their business. In the same month, I had 2 other deals from 2 families who each ordered 50 customized mugs for a funeral and a wedding which would be used as souvenirs for guests.

These deals were quite challenging for me as I had only 1 heat press mug machine that could only take 1 mug at a time, and had to visit the sublimation print shop several times as well. Despite these challenges, I managed to meet the deadline by staying up throughout the night and dawn and executing the job within 5 days. 

I need funding because I want to expand my territories, enter 3 larger regions in Ghana, hire people to assist me, acquire extra heat press mug machines, and visit more companies to introduce magic mugs to them as they usually give out souvenirs to their customers. Moreover, I need to hire individuals to assist me with this expansion, and other types of equipment which are listed below.

  1. Purchase of Two (2) Heat Press Machines to Increase Production – I would like to purchase 2 machines for the magic mug production. I have only one machine currently and I have been using it for a year now. I wish to expand the business by hitting other regions in Ghana and I need 2 more machines, $380 each. The new machine I want to buy is a 5-in-1, which would greatly increase production as I am entering 3 large regions. Therefore, I need $760 to purchase 2 mug machines.

 

                        

           Current Machine                                         Machine to Increase Production

 

                            

  1. Purchase of a Sublimation Printer - Getting my own sublimation printer would help me save some cost by doing this myself than always going to another shop to print out designs for clients. Therefore, I need $400 to purchase a sublimation printer to enhance my business and save on the cost in the production of mugs.

                                                
  

 

 

          Sublimation Printer

 

 

 

 

 

  1. Purchase of a Laptop – A laptop will be helpful to me as I want to hire a designer to assist me in designing the clients' mugs as production increases. Therefore, I need an amount of $420 to buy a laptop to help me increase production as the new employee will be required to use a laptop for designing.

                                  Laptop

 

 

  1. Branding of Customized Package Boxes - After the magic mug is done, the packaging is quite a problem because I hand-make paper boxes and sometimes I have to wrap mugs in envelopes that are not safe. I want to have a safer customized box as clients are keen on good packaging. I need $500 – This money will be used to customize and make quality packing boxes to secure mug safety. Customers appreciate neat packaging with our brand name on them when delivering.

 

                                                       

Package Boxes

 

 

  1. Delivery Bike - The mugs are delivered to customers using Mr. Plange the Errand Boy - our courier service. However, delivery is limited to customers in Tema due to the limited number of resources, both human and infrastructure. For customers outside Tema delivery is done using other courier and parcel delivery services. This results in extra costs for customers and the safe delivery of the mugs is not guaranteed. I will need $870- This money will be used to acquire a motorbike for our delivery services at a fee, especially when a customer is far from my home office.

                                                

                                                               Delivery Motorbikes

I intend to maintain our existing customers and also expand our services to nationwide coverage. To tap into the potential of the market and increase the existing market share, customer base, as well as profitability, funds are needed to acquire motorcycles, recruit dispatch persons, and engage in active marketing campaigns. Order and Delivery schedules will be made known and available to customers outside Tema at a fee. The satisfaction of customers is paramount to business success. We know expanding our publicity reach and delivery to cover more areas will take in more income and even open up other opportunities.

 

  1. Expansion of Business (Ads, marketing, official website, labor) - I want to expand the business as I am only limited to my city (Tema, Ghana). There are 16 regions in Ghana and I am vibrant only in Tema and some parts of Accra, which makes only 1 out of 16 regions. My research has resulted in discovering people who send some of my mug work outside the Accra region as people in other regions have never seen it before. I believe entering into such markets will earn me more profits. This expansion will need more advertisement campaigns, traveling to these regions, hiring and training unemployed individuals to assist me, visiting potential clients, etc. Therefore, I would need $3400 – This money will be used to expand into these 3 larger regions: Cape Coast, Takoradi, and Kumasi. This includes transportation to each region, making marketing and advertisement materials such as printed posters and sample magic mugs, and accommodation purposes. I will also have my official website as a marketing tool and will hire a helping hand to support the mug production.

 

 

          

                      Kumasi                                  Cape Coast                               Takoradi

 

 

  • Working Space Expansion

I am currently working from my small single room with a desk, a mug machine, and other materials I use in production. Looking forward to expanding my production by acquiring extra mug machines, printers, laptops, motorbikes, etc., I need a bigger working space so I could be comfortable working. Therefore, I need $3500 to rent a spacious room for my operations for 2 years. This amount will also include furnishing.

 

                                                  

                                                                              Office Space

                                                 Office Space

 

The Impact

Employment Opportunities 

I see much potential and willingness in Silas Osei, a senior in high school who lost his father and was left with 9 younger siblings and a single mother. He has much love for graphic design, and I have assured him of getting a professional to train him in graphic designing software and I will later employ him as an assistant graphic designer. He will take care of all the design works for the mug production while I handle the marketing and sales aspects. This will help ease the burden on his mother and other siblings as I will be paying him a monthly salary as well as commission while I work with him. 

I will also employ a rider to use my motorbike for delivery services to customers who purchase mugs from us. I am currently being assisted by some unemployed friends for free in my daily activities, which I believe if I get funded, I can expand and officially hire them to assist me.

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge has been getting orders for about 100 pieces of customized mugs while having only 1 mug machine where I can only make 1 at a time which makes my work quite tedious and time-consuming. This challenge could be solved by acquiring the 5-in-1 (or more) mug machines to make production faster and meeting deadlines right on time.

Another challenge is difficulties in delivering mugs to customers who are not closer to me, and also experiencing mug breakages due to lacking the right package boxes to contain finished mugs on their way to be delivered to customers. This could also be solved by acquiring a motorbike and good package boxes.

Furthermore, I currently run my business from my own small room and it is quite challenging as I have my bed, my belongings, and machine all packed in this room. I will be much more comfortable in a bigger space as I wish to expand my business.

 

Ways You Can Help

If you wish to help, please consider donating here or sharing our link to platforms where other people can help us as well. You are much appreciated!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Introduction / Business Background (The Magic Mugs)
The sale of customized mugs both plain and "magic" (i.e. thermal color-changing mugs) have caught on very well over the years. My name is William Plange and I am the founder of Mr. Plange Services, a service aimed at easing the burden on individuals with heavy schedules by running time-consuming errands for them.  These include assisting in documentation, customization of products, liaison, sales & marketing of goods and services, as well as providing business consultation to budding local businesses. 
I present to you, my most recent business expansion, 'The Magic Mug'.
The magic mug has very amazing features which attract individuals and groups. There is transformation when hot liquid is poured into them revealing their own pictures, corporate logos, etc. Magic mugs are mostly used to surprise people on their special occasions such as birthdays, corporate events, weddings, and personal gifts to loved ones. There are also plain mugs where personalized photos are placed to serve as memories for special events and occasions.
Starting with only one heat press mug machine, I got my money back from the cost of the machine in just 2 months of sales. The subsequent months up until now have been profits.
What We Need & What You Get
How Magic Mugs are Made
When orders are placed, pictures and inscription details are taken from clients through WhatsApp or mail, and exported and designed on Adobe Illustrator. After the design, I send it to the client to confirm the preview. After confirmation, I go out to print the design on a sublimation printer, as I do not own one, then I go back to my home office to wrap the printed design on the specially coated mugs and set them in my mug heat press machine for a few minutes, and the magic mug is ready!
Who am I targeting?
I am targeting the following:
Families, hotels, restaurants, all corporate bodies and companies, individuals, churches, youth clubs, event organizers, wedding planners, government workers, politicians, and more! 
A magic mug is for all.
Why I Need Funding
A magic mug is very profitable in Ghana. Only a few people are aware of such a product with the amazing feature of seeing their images appear surprisingly by just pouring hot liquid in the mugs. 
In December 2020 I had a deal to design and make 100 mugs for Silas Cash Company, which was a mobile money vendor that wanted to give out customized mugs as gifts to its cherished customers, thanking them for their business. In the same month, I had 2 other deals from 2 families who each ordered 50 customized mugs for a funeral and a wedding which would be used as souvenirs for guests.
These deals were quite challenging for me as I had only 1 heat press mug machine that could only take 1 mug at a time, and had to visit the sublimation print shop several times as well. Despite these challenges, I managed to meet the deadline by staying up throughout the night and dawn and executing the job within 5 days. 
I need funding because I want to expand my territories, enter 3 larger regions in Ghana, hire people to assist me, acquire extra heat press mug machines, and visit more companies to introduce magic mugs to them as they usually give out souvenirs to their customers. Moreover, I need to hire individuals to assist me with this expansion, and other types of equipment which are listed below.

Purchase of Two (2) Heat Press Machines to Increase Production – I would like to purchase 2 machines for the magic mug production. I have only one machine currently and I have been using it for a year now. I wish to expand the business by hitting other regions in Ghana and I need 2 more machines, $380 each. The new machine I want to buy is a 5-in-1, which would greatly increase production as I am entering 3 large regions. Therefore, I need $760 to purchase 2 mug machines.
 
                        
           Current Machine                                         Machine to Increase Production
 
                            

Purchase of a Sublimation Printer - Getting my own sublimation printer would help me save some cost by doing this myself than always going to another shop to print out designs for clients. Therefore, I need $400 to purchase a sublimation printer to enhance my business and save on the cost in the production of mugs.
                                                  
 
 
          Sublimation Printer
 
 
 
 
 

Purchase of a Laptop – A laptop will be helpful to me as I want to hire a designer to assist me in designing the clients' mugs as production increases. Therefore, I need an amount of $420 to buy a laptop to help me increase production as the new employee will be required to use a laptop for designing.
                                  Laptop
 
 

Branding of Customized Package Boxes - After the magic mug is done, the packaging is quite a problem because I hand-make paper boxes and sometimes I have to wrap mugs in envelopes that are not safe. I want to have a safer customized box as clients are keen on good packaging. I need $500 – This money will be used to customize and make quality packing boxes to secure mug safety. Customers appreciate neat packaging with our brand name on them when delivering.
 
                                                       
Package Boxes
 
 

Delivery Bike - The mugs are delivered to customers using Mr. Plange the Errand Boy - our courier service. However, delivery is limited to customers in Tema due to the limited number of resources, both human and infrastructure. For customers outside Tema delivery is done using other courier and parcel delivery services. This results in extra costs for customers and the safe delivery of the mugs is not guaranteed. I will need $870- This money will be used to acquire a motorbike for our delivery services at a fee, especially when a customer is far from my home office.
                                                
                                                               Delivery Motorbikes
I intend to maintain our existing customers and also expand our services to nationwide coverage. To tap into the potential of the market and increase the existing market share, customer base, as well as profitability, funds are needed to acquire motorcycles, recruit dispatch persons, and engage in active marketing campaigns. Order and Delivery schedules will be made known and available to customers outside Tema at a fee. The satisfaction of customers is paramount to business success. We know expanding our publicity reach and delivery to cover more areas will take in more income and even open up other opportunities.
 

Expansion of Business (Ads, marketing, official website, labor) - I want to expand the business as I am only limited to my city (Tema, Ghana). There are 16 regions in Ghana and I am vibrant only in Tema and some parts of Accra, which makes only 1 out of 16 regions. My research has resulted in discovering people who send some of my mug work outside the Accra region as people in other regions have never seen it before. I believe entering into such markets will earn me more profits. This expansion will need more advertisement campaigns, traveling to these regions, hiring and training unemployed individuals to assist me, visiting potential clients, etc. Therefore, I would need $3400 – This money will be used to expand into these 3 larger regions: Cape Coast, Takoradi, and Kumasi. This includes transportation to each region, making marketing and advertisement materials such as printed posters and sample magic mugs, and accommodation purposes. I will also have my official website as a marketing tool and will hire a helping hand to support the mug production.
 
 
           
                      Kumasi                                  Cape Coast                               Takoradi
 
 
Working Space Expansion
I am currently working from my small single room with a desk, a mug machine, and other materials I use in production. Looking forward to expanding my production by acquiring extra mug machines, printers, laptops, motorbikes, etc., I need a bigger working space so I could be comfortable working. Therefore, I need $3500 to rent a spacious room for my operations for 2 years. This amount will also include furnishing.
 
                                                  
                                                                              Office Space


                                                 Office Space
 

The Impact
Employment Opportunities 
I see much potential and willingness in Silas Osei, a senior in high school who lost his father and was left with 9 younger siblings and a single mother. He has much love for graphic design, and I have assured him of getting a professional to train him in graphic designing software and I will later employ him as an assistant graphic designer. He will take care of all the design works for the mug production while I handle the marketing and sales aspects. This will help ease the burden on his mother and other siblings as I will be paying him a monthly salary as well as commission while I work with him. 
I will also employ a rider to use my motorbike for delivery services to customers who purchase mugs from us. I am currently being assisted by some unemployed friends for free in my daily activities, which I believe if I get funded, I can expand and officially hire them to assist me.

Risks & Challenges

This challenge could be solved by acquiring the 5-in-1 (or more) mug machines to make production faster and meeting deadlines right on time.
Another challenge is difficulties in delivering mugs to customers who are not closer to me, and also experiencing mug breakages due to lacking the right package boxes to contain finished mugs on their way to be delivered to customers. This could also be solved by acquiring a motorbike and good package boxes.
Furthermore, I currently run my business from my own small room and it is quite challenging as I have my bed, my belongings, and machine all packed in this room. I will be much more comfortable in a bigger space as I wish to expand my business.
 

Ways You Can Help
If you wish to help, please consider donating here or sharing our link to platforms where other people can help us as well. You are much appreciated!

story:
A science teacher, a county treasurer and a line cook bought a cow to feed their dogs.

Chris Cey, who teaches high school science, watched his dog come back to life on a homemade raw diet. He felt that the extraordinary benefits of his recipe for Bert, still thriving at 14 years old, needed to be shared. Co-founders John David Davidson and Alec Barfield envisioned a company that married Chris' passion for biologically-appropriate dog foods with a commitment to the local community and the environment.

 

 

Fresh and Nutritious. Local and sustainable.

IDAHOUND was born.

The three of us butchered and processed that very first pasture-raised cow ourselves. We mixed in the organs and some organic produce, nothing that wasn't necessary. "Food as Dog Intended," we said!

From day one, IDAHOUND did everything from scratch. We got to know and work with local ranchers. We bought more cows and sheep, perfected recipes and added new products. Eventually we moved into our current facility and hired employees. Batch after batch, week in and week out, IDAHOUND kept finding new owners wanting locally-sourced and grass-fed raw diets, green tripe, and meaty bones for their dogs.  

The demand surprised us, but dog owners, like Chris, had discovered the obvious: what we feed our pets has enormous physiological consequences.  Highly-processed and carbohydrate-rich diets (a.k.a kibble) are not what our best friends should be eating. The cumulative effects of poor nutrition can be devastating. It's been our mission from the very beginning to offer a solution.

This campaign is intended to help IDAHOUND achieve the tangible goal of expanding and improving our manufacturing facility. We want to keeping growing, helping as many dogs (and now cats, too!) as we can with raw small-batch foods.

 

IDAHOUND Testimonials

Happy and healthy customers - with words from their humans!

 

How You Can Help

More dogs want IDAHOUND! Here's our plan. 

 

Food Safety Additions:

Beef Processing Room

​Our facility operates as a beef slaughterhouse 2 days a month. It's during this window that we render all of the beef we need for 4 weeks. If you've ever seen a 1-ton bull, you can understand how challenging it is to quarter and debone an animal of that size. A beef-specific processing room would let us increase the production of IDAHOUND's beef products.

Green Tripe Processing Room

When we first started IDAHOUND, Chris Cey made a prophetic statement: "Tripe will eventually be our most popular product." It took a few years, but he was right. As a result, we want to make more tripe! A true super-food, we want to make beef and lamb tripe a staple in every raw-fed dog's diet.

 

Storage and Pasture Additions:

Walk-in Cooler and Freezer

A lot of IDAHOUND's capacity issues come down to storage. Whether we are working with beef, sheep or rabbit, adequate cold storage space is an essential element. A walk-in freezer, as well as an expansion to the walk-in cooler will be essential to growing our operation.

More Room for Grazing

We buy small flocks of sheep from nearby ranchers each month. We currently use only one half of the total usable acreage we have for pasture. Building predator-proof fencing on the east side of IDAHOUND's property will allow for even more happy grazing, plus longer rotations between corrals for better regrowth.

 

What Makes IDAHOUND Different?

Reason #1: Quality

When IDAHOUND butchers an animal, we use 100% of the meat, organ, and stomachs for dog food.  We add the best cuts of whole muscle and organ, not just the "trim," to all of our blends.  There's no question about where this meat came from, how it was processed, or what part of the animal it is. When you buy IDAHOUND you will know exactly what went into your dog's foods, from start to finish.

Freshness is a big deal at IDAHOUND. Much of our meat is never frozen until its packaged and stored. We do as little processing as possible to keep ingredients and their nutrients intact. These details contribute a final product that is undeniably fresher than anything else on the market.

 

Reason #2: Community

Carey, Idaho, (pop. 604) lies at the mouth of the Little Wood River, just south of the majestic Pioneer Mountains. Despite Carey's natural beauty and small town charm, jobs are scarce and most residents have to commute up to an hour for work. The number of business headquartered in Carey is less than ten. However, as housing prices near Sun Valley soar, Carey will be an affordable oasis for families.

       

 

IDAHOUND currently employees three full-time individuals in Carey, and in the next five years we expect to hire at least seven more locals.

Staying where we are, hiring locally, and being a part of the community is an important part of our identity.

 

 

Reason #3: Sustainability

What we feed our pets, who need meat-based diets, matters environmentally. Enormous amount of energy, water, and food are devoted to raising and caring for all types of livestock. In fact, the United Nations estimates that animal agriculture generates almost 20% of global greenhouse gas emissions. Another study concluded that total production related to pet food in the U.S. has the emissions equivalent of 13 million cars!

 

 

IDAHOUND exclusively buys grass-fed Idaho cattle, sheep and rabbits. Making these purchases from environmentally-conscious producers is the first piece to a sustainable product. The next step is reducing the length of our supply chain. By keeping all of the butchering, processing, packaging, in-house IDAHOUND reduces the extra transportation, refrigeration, and manufacturing emissions that would have resulted from a longer production process.

As IDAHOUND continues to grow, we are also committed to reducing production waste, adding on-site renewable energy, and creating value out of every acre on our property.

 

The Basics of Raw Feeding

Idahound uses premium, local ingredients to create an “evolutionary” and farm-driven diet, while pursuing minimal environmental impacts.

When determining what to feed ourselves, it's clear that humans reap more nutritional benefits from whole, fresh foods than processed ones. The same logic applies to our pets! Studies have shown that raw meat-based diets have greater digestibility than that of their processed counterparts. Additional research has shown that raw animal products contain more essential amino acids than dried pet foods. Fresh foods also have more fatty acids, helpful bacteria and enzymes than diets that are cooked. Kibble may be the norm, but it's hardly natural. Fortified or not, dried foods can't stand up nutritionally to raw foods.

 

 

Although “feeding raw” seems like a new idea, it is far from radical. Like Canis lupus, which hunts live prey and feeds on raw meat, your beloved hound demands a carnivorous diet similar to that of its ancestor. For thousands of years, wild canines achieved superior health from diets that didn't include dried cereal! Mimicking these raw meat-based diets, with slight modifications to fit the demands of today’s domesticated pets, is possible through the raw style of feeding.

 

 

Despite what you may think, dog owners shouldn't be afraid to feed raw meat to their dog. A canine's stomach is extremely acidic, allowing for raw meat and bones to be broken down safely and effectively. In fact, raw meat is precisely what your dog is programmed to eat.

A diet high in fresh raw protein and fat is the most biologically-appropriate way to feed your dog. By weight, IDAHOUND's recipes are 71% meat, 9% organ (liver, kidney, and spleen), and 20% produce. We include the latter to keep things nutritionally balanced. It's our preference to add whole foods instead of synthetic vitamins. Finally, none of our recipes contain additives or preservatives. Our philosophy is too keep all of our foods simple yet nutritionally dense, an assortment of only necessary ingredients.

 


 

Growing IDAHOUND has been an amazing experience. But we're also just getting started. Every week we hear from new dog owners in search of small-batch raw diets, the greenest tripe, raw meaty bones, and single-ingredient treats. What these conscious feeder have discovered is that nobody else makes the products like IDAHOUND. To keep things entirely in-house we need to make room and upgrade. 

Thanks for your support!

The IDAHOUND team

Perks Details

For photos and details of each hat and t-shirt variation, follow the links below.

IDAHOUND Snap-back Trucker Hat - Heather Grey/Dark Charcoal

IDAHOUND Snap-back Trucker Hat - Black/White

IDAHOUND T-shirt - Red

IDAHOUND T-shirt - Green

IDAHOUND T-shirt - White

IDAHOUND T-shirt - Grey/Pink

story:
About Me

My name is Shay Port and I am a C.P.A., financial coach, financial counselor and educator. 

I often think about the fact that money impacts every area of our lives yet we often don't know the most useful ways to spend it, save it or even in some cases, earn it.

I’m so fortunate because my job is to help people with something so fundamental to their overall wellbeing - financial wellbeing. When people feel empowered in this area, it expands out into every area of their lives.

Why am I so passionate about this work?

Well - because I have been there!  When I was in my 30’s I got myself into $27,000 of credit card debt and had recently been laid off from a job. I didn't even realize that I was living paycheck to paycheck until this happened, and I had no idea how I was going to get out of this situation. Luckily, I found Suze Orman’s book “9 Steps to Financial Freedom” and it truly changed my life. Over the next 4 years, I not only paid off the entire $27,000 debt, but I also saved $15,000 in my 401k, all on a salary of $36,000 a year. 

This proved to me, it really doesn’t matter how much you earn, but rather where your focus is and how you apply the money you are earning.

After this experience, I knew I wanted to be able to help people in this way.

I started my financial wellness business in Los Angeles in 2010, and after helping hundreds of individuals move from envisioning a more abundant life to actually living one, I am now ready to expand this work in my hometown of Pittsburgh by bringing these services to businesses who want to offer this work as a valuable benefit to their employees.

Why Bring Financial Wellness to the Workplace?

More than half of all employees in the United States report that they are financially stressed, and nearly one in three employees reports being distracted by personal financial issues while at work.* Employees' productivity, health and relationships all can suffer from these stressors.

These statistics lead to the only conclusion possible - workers in our country, at every level, desperately need financial capabilities training and financial education. 

The workplace is an ideal location to offer both for the following reasons :

  • Employees don't have to hurdle barriers such as childcare, transportation or buy-in from a spouse/partner because they can receive these services at the company itself.
  • Confidentiality is assured by the company, a trusted source, and guaranteed by the third-party provider.
  • The workplace is a natural location for offering services that promote financial well-being and deal directly with issues and questions surrounding personal finances.

The one-on-one approach is so helpful because the focus is on identifying, setting and achieving the financial goals that are important to each employee individually. This is no cookie-cutter approach, but rather an approach that allows the employee to set their own goals as well as their own timeline. 

By supporting this campaign, you will be helping to increase the health, happiness and financial wellbeing of all workers, regardless of income, position or title. 

Where Your Funds Will Go

I'll be using the campaign funds to:

  • Train and hire additional financial coaches in order to expand our reach and work on larger commissions.
  • Increase marketing efforts through creating professional videos, brochures and branding that will generate more awareness of this work and its benefits to interested companies.
  • Pay for legal and other business costs that will cover contracts, tax and business compliance, insurance and general administrative costs.

After establishing this business model here in Pittsburgh, I plan on expanding to other cities across the U.S.

Creating a separate non-profit segment of the business is also in the works, the focus of which will be on offering these services to local community service organizations who serve people currently living in poverty who are working very hard to get out.

How You Can Help

3 BEST WAYS:

  1. Purchasing a webinar or service for yourself or gifting one to your son, your daughter, niece, grandchild or anyone else you think might benefit.
  2. Connecting me to a company who you think might be interested in offering these services to its employees. And of course, if it's the company you work for, you'll also be getting the benefit. Here's an awesome animated video you can share with your HR dept.:

                                 

 

   3. Sharing this campaign with your followers on FB, Instagram or Twitter.

    The Perks

    My goal is to offer something valuable at every level of contribution, and starting at the $99 level, you will be receiving personalized services in exchange for your contributions.

    Rules for services are:

    • You may use any service for yourself OR you may gift the service to someone else. A personalized gift certificate will be sent to the recipient.
    • All services below the $1,500 level must be completed by February 15, 2019.
    • Any service at the $1,500 level and above must be completed by June 30, 2019, except the annual coaching plan.

    THE BREAKDOWN (all reward levels receive the level $10 perks):

    $10: Download of my amusing and useful Can I Afford This?  flow chart that you can print and keep nearby in case of over-spending emergencies. Plus you'll receive a personal thank-you and my undying gratitude.

    $25: Download of one of three in-depth webinars, created and led by me on the following topics:

    • Extreme Budgeting: How to create a realistic budget and how to follow it successfully
    • No More Debt!: How to get out and stay out of debt
    • Saving & Investing: How to save and invest even when you're not earning a lot of money

    $50: Download of all three webinars from above

    $99: Everything at the $50 level, plus choose between:

    • Book on financial wellness by Suze Orman, my financial coaching hero OR
    • 30 minute one-on-one financial coaching phone session with Shay on any topic

    $249: Everything at the $50 level, plus: 

    • 90 minute in-person financial coaching session on any and all topics at my loft or if you are not local, then a Skype or telephone session of the same length. Receive a financial action plan prepared just for you.

    $495: Everything at the $50 level, plus:

    •  2 1/2-3 hour in-person financial coaching session, which includes a complete financial plan useful for the next 6 months - 1 year for an individual 

    $695: Same as the $495 level, but for a couple

    $1,500: Everything at the $50 level, plus:

    • 1 1/2 hour in-person workshop at your home or place of business for any size group and on any topic(s) you choose OR
    • 6 months of financial coaching via email (unlimited) and telephone (1 hr call per month) (does not include the initial financial plan)

    $2,500: Everything at the $50 level, plus:

    • One year of financial coaching via email (unlimited) and telephone (1 hour call per month, plus 4 in-person coaching sessions during the year). Does not include the initial financial plan.

    $5,000: Everything at the $50 level, plus:

    • 3 1/2 hour financial wellness workshop at an agreed-upon location for any size group on any topic(s) you choose

    What If I Don't Reach My Funding Goal?

    All funds will go towards helping get financial wellness services out to the public, regardless of the amount raised.

    What if I Exceed My Funding Goal?

    This will allow more funds to go towards branding, marketing and outreach, bringing the possibility of one-on-one financial coaching to as many Pittsburgh residents as possible!

    Personal Note

    I didn't grow up in the era of online funding campaigns. I grew up to believe that if people needed money to implement their creative or business ventures then they should save up and pay for it themselves! To be totally honest, I haven't even felt comfortable asking people for help on a personal level. I'm accustomed to being the one that offers the help, not the one receiving it. That's probably why I'm drawn to this work in the first place - I love to help people.

    It's definitely challenging to change the paradigms we live in, but over the years, I have seen how valuable crowdfunding has been in helping people realize goals and dreams that would most likely be out of reach otherwise. I have contributed to many campaigns in the past and it always felt good to be able to help out in some small way. 

    I believe in the work that I do, I believe in its transformative power, and I also believe that allowing people to participate in helping me to get this work out there will be transformative for us personally. It will connect us as friends and family, as a community, and as people who have shared values, like wanting other people to prosper in their financial lives.

    Final Thanks

    To all who are able to offer your financial support at this time, you are truly an angel and it's not an exaggeration when I say that you have my undying gratitude.

    If you are not able to contribute at this time, I honor that as well. After all, I'm a financial coach - I always want people to prioritize their own financial commitments first!

    There are other, non-monetary ways of supporting my efforts, whether by sharing my campaign with your friends and family or by spreading the word to a local business or community service provider who might want to offer financial wellness services to their employees. Even an email or text offering moral support would be welcome!

    Either way - a profound thank-you for any support you can offer and a hope that all people, everywhere, can eventually have access to this kind of financial assistance whenever they need it.

    With love,

    Shay

     

    *References: Pricewaterhouse Coopers. Employee Financial Wellness Survey: 2017 results. 2017. 2. Institute of Coaching http://www.instituteofcoaching.org/index.cfm?pa...
story_txt:
About Me
My name is Shay Port and I am a C.P.A., financial coach, financial counselor and educator. 
I often think about the fact that money impacts every area of our lives yet we often don't know the most useful ways to spend it, save it or even in some cases, earn it.
I’m so fortunate because my job is to help people with something so fundamental to their overall wellbeing - financial wellbeing. When people feel empowered in this area, it expands out into every area of their lives.
Why am I so passionate about this work?
Well - because I have been there!  When I was in my 30’s I got myself into $27,000 of credit card debt and had recently been laid off from a job. I didn't even realize that I was living paycheck to paycheck until this happened, and I had no idea how I was going to get out of this situation. Luckily, I found Suze Orman’s book “9 Steps to Financial Freedom” and it truly changed my life. Over the next 4 years, I not only paid off the entire $27,000 debt, but I also saved $15,000 in my 401k, all on a salary of $36,000 a year. 
This proved to me, it really doesn’t matter how much you earn, but rather where your focus is and how you apply the money you are earning.
After this experience, I knew I wanted to be able to help people in this way.
I started my financial wellness business in Los Angeles in 2010, and after helping hundreds of individuals move from envisioning a more abundant life to actually living one, I am now ready to expand this work in my hometown of Pittsburgh by bringing these services to businesses who want to offer this work as a valuable benefit to their employees.
Why Bring Financial Wellness to the Workplace?
More than half of all employees in the United States report that they are financially stressed, and nearly one in three employees reports being distracted by personal financial issues while at work.* Employees' productivity, health and relationships all can suffer from these stressors.
These statistics lead to the only conclusion possible - workers in our country, at every level, desperately need financial capabilities training and financial education. 
The workplace is an ideal location to offer both for the following reasons :

Employees don't have to hurdle barriers such as childcare, transportation or buy-in from a spouse/partner because they can receive these services at the company itself.
Confidentiality is assured by the company, a trusted source, and guaranteed by the third-party provider.
The workplace is a natural location for offering services that promote financial well-being and deal directly with issues and questions surrounding personal finances.

The one-on-one approach is so helpful because the focus is on identifying, setting and achieving the financial goals that are important to each employee individually. This is no cookie-cutter approach, but rather an approach that allows the employee to set their own goals as well as their own timeline. 
By supporting this campaign, you will be helping to increase the health, happiness and financial wellbeing of all workers, regardless of income, position or title. 
Where Your Funds Will Go
I'll be using the campaign funds to:

Train and hire additional financial coaches in order to expand our reach and work on larger commissions.
Increase marketing efforts through creating professional videos, brochures and branding that will generate more awareness of this work and its benefits to interested companies.
Pay for legal and other business costs that will cover contracts, tax and business compliance, insurance and general administrative costs.

After establishing this business model here in Pittsburgh, I plan on expanding to other cities across the U.S.
Creating a separate non-profit segment of the business is also in the works, the focus of which will be on offering these services to local community service organizations who serve people currently living in poverty who are working very hard to get out.
How You Can Help
3 BEST WAYS:

Purchasing a webinar or service for yourself or gifting one to your son, your daughter, niece, grandchild or anyone else you think might benefit.
Connecting me to a company who you think might be interested in offering these services to its employees. And of course, if it's the company you work for, you'll also be getting the benefit. Here's an awesome animated video you can share with your HR dept.:

                                 

 
   3. Sharing this campaign with your followers on FB, Instagram or Twitter.

The Perks
My goal is to offer something valuable at every level of contribution, and starting at the $99 level, you will be receiving personalized services in exchange for your contributions.
Rules for services are:

You may use any service for yourself OR you may gift the service to someone else. A personalized gift certificate will be sent to the recipient.
All services below the $1,500 level must be completed by February 15, 2019.
Any service at the $1,500 level and above must be completed by June 30, 2019, except the annual coaching plan.

THE BREAKDOWN (all reward levels receive the level $10 perks):

$10: Download of my amusing and useful Can I Afford This?  flow chart that you can print and keep nearby in case of over-spending emergencies. Plus you'll receive a personal thank-you and my undying gratitude.

No More Debt!: How to get out and stay out of debt

Book on financial wellness by Suze Orman, my financial coaching hero OR

30 minute one-on-one financial coaching phone session with Shay on any topic

90 minute in-person financial coaching session on any and all topics at my loft or if you are not local, then a Skype or telephone session of the same length. Receive a financial action plan prepared just for you.
$495: Everything at the $50 level, plus:
 2 1/2-3 hour in-person financial coaching session, which includes a complete financial plan useful for the next 6 months - 1 year for an individual 
$695: Same as the $495 level, but for a couple

story:
Español a continuación

Our Story

When Goshen lost its bookstore, the six of us, Brad Weirich, Jenny Frech, Kristin Saner, Veronica Berkey, Jeremy Friesen, and Mark Saner, sprang into action to secure the vibrancy of Goshen. Since March 2019, we have been working on securing a location, taking out loans, gathering and sorting book, and talking with our community about how we can build a new and improved bookshop.

Fables Books will open late summer 2019 in Goshen, Indiana. We believe that bookstores are the heart and soul of a city. Bookstores cultivate stories while reflecting the interests, passions, and desires of their community. Our mission is to connect Goshen through our shared stories. We will be a place where people can find books they love and find a welcoming community with events, readings, and story times.

Our shared gifts can make this new bookshop thrive. Brad Weirich brought the previous bookstore to Goshen. Veronica helped run and manage that bookstore for several years. Kristin Saner also helped manage for a few years. All three of them bring not only retail but bookstore experience to Fables. Jenny Frech started and manages Soapy Gnome. She brings startup and small business experience to our group. Jeremy Friesen, having helped Jenny start Soapy Gnome, brings his project management, technical, and writing skills. Mark Saner provides technical support, a sounding board, and overall moral support.

You can find out more about us at fablesbooks.com

What We Need & What You Get

We need $90,000 to open our doors. So far we have secured $50,000. We are asking you to help us raise the remaining $40,000. These funds will go towards our start-up costs including, signage,  marketing (materials and online), renovations, supplies, events, and most of all, inventory and merchandise. Some of the new inventory we are excited to offer includes IndieBound Best Sellers, new children’s books, stationery, literary gifts and accessories, and a larger Spanish Language section for both children and adults.

Even if we don’t reach our goal, any funds raised will still go towards our start-up costs. We may have a smaller inventory than originally planned, or need to take on a larger debt, but either way, we’re opening. Plan on enjoying Goshen’s truly independent bookshop late summer 2019! Whether you support at the $10 level or the $10,000 level, each pledge helps ensure the success of this venture. We appreciate each and every person who helps to make Fables a reality.

We are offering 13 different perk levels. Here are 3 examples. To see all the perks be sure to scroll through the sidebar on the right on pc or above on your phone. For a description and list of items included, click on the picture of the perk. 

The Joy Luck Club: Pledge $50 and become a Fables Book Club Member- Receive a special 16-month membership to Fables Book Club. Book Club members receive a  canvas tote bag plus 15% off all purchases every Tuesday. You'll also get a Fables button and vinyl sticker, along with a personalized thank you.

The Fables Badge of Courage: Pledge $250 and become a VIP. You'll receive an exclusive invitation to our VIP celebration. Plus have your name added to our Founder's Wall. In addition, you'll receive a thank you note, Fables vinyl sticker, button, Fables Book Club membership with a tote bag, and limited edition t-shirt.

Pride & Fables: Pledge $2,500 and showcase your pride in Goshen. Help name a non-fiction section by dedicating it to a business or individual of your choosing. Sections will contain a plaque engraved with the name and dedication. Plus receive a thank you, Fables vinyl sticker and button, Fables Book Club Membership with a canvas tote bag, limited edition t-shirt, invite to VIP party and your name on our Founder's Wall.

Be sure to check out all the other great perks on the sidebar to the right. 

For levels from 2,500- 10,000, we are giving naming rights. We will create a plaque (at least 8.5” x11”) acknowledging the backer as a founding supporter of the section of their choice. We’ll work with the backer on the specific language and acknowledgment. We will place the plate in a prominent location, striving to keep it close to or within the section founded. 

We are creating bookends to denote the start of a section. We will also add a smaller acknowledgment plate to the founder's section’s bookend.

Also, we will add these backers to our founders’ wall; Smaller contributions will have a smaller recognition, more substantial contributions will be more prominent.

The Impact

Fables Books is not just a place, it’s a people, where each story matters: yours, ours, Goshen’s, old, new, spoken, written. Our mission is to connect our community through these stories.

  • We believe in the value of each person and their story.
  • We believe in providing a safe space where all are welcome.
  • We believe in honest, wise and fair business practices.
  • We believe in being responsible community members.
  • We believe in laughter, smiles, and enjoying life.
  • We believe that reading can change the world.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help us out. Here are some great ways you can support Fables Books:

Donate Your Gently Used Books

Donations will be accepted at Fables Books (215 S Main Street) on Monday - Friday from 11 am - 4 pm and Saturday by appointment. Please use the back door so that we may better assist you in bringing your books inside.  We will be offering a $5 coupon for each copy paper size box donated. Coupons can be used once the store is open. See book donations page for what we will accept.

Collaborate with Us

We want to collaborate with our community in creative ways. Get in touch if you have an idea for collaboration. We'll get back with you as soon as we can.

  • Does your work require the ordering of books for book clubs, management teams, gifts? We’d be happy to help.
  • Do you love to run book clubs, writing groups, or children's reading hours? We’re looking to provide community space for this and more.
  • Are you an expert and would like to do a talk in our new space especially in the fields of writing, literacy, science, art, and history? Let us know.
  • Do you have a creative idea of how we can work together? Let us know, we’re eager to collaborate.

Volunteer for Work Days

It takes a village to get a bookstore running and we’re always looking for help. Sign-up on our mailing list at fablesbooks.com to get updates on how you can further help. We’ll also be posting our events on Facebook, so make sure to like our page.

GET EXCITED AND SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!

Share this campaign with everyone you know, and share often!  We have 28 days to raise $40,000 so help us spread the word.

Signup for our newsletter at fablesbooks.com so you can stay up to date.

Tell all of your friends! Tag them on Instagram. Invite them to like the Fables Books Facebook page. The more people you tell, the easier it will be for your bookshop to make it here in Goshen!

Español a continuación

Consideramos que las librerías son el corazón de un pueblo. Contienen las historias de cada uno de nosotros y reflejan los intereses, pasiones, y deseos de la comunidad. Por eso, abriremos la librería “Fables” (fábulas) a finales de este verano aquí en Goshen.  Nuestra misión es crear mayor unidad a través de nuestras historias compartidas. Con su apoyo, podemos crear un espacio común en donde todos nosotros podamos encontrar libros y conversaciones que nos inspiren. 

Una amplia selección de libros en español para chicos y grandes, papelería, y obsequios…Fables tendrá todo esto y más. Para hacer realidad este sueño, lanzamos esta campaña de recaudación de fondos. La meta total es 90,000 dólares y solo nos falta 40,000 .  ¡Necesitamos su ayuda! Ya sea con dinero, tiempo, o libros.  

Donación de libros en buena condición 
Se aceptan donaciones de libros en buena condición en la tienda Soapy Gnome (111 E. Washington Street) durante horas hábiles (lunes a viernes 10-5:15, sábado 10-3:45) hasta que abra la nueva librería. Le obsequiaremos un cupón con valor de $5 por cada caja de libros. Podrá usar su cupón una vez abierta la librería.  
Colabore con nosotros
Nos encanta colaborar con la comunidad en proyectos creativos. ¿Quiere leer a los niños en español? ¿Tiene ideas para una charla educativa? ¿Tiene un tiempito extra y quiere echar una mano en la tienda? ¡Comuniquese con nosotros!

¡PASE LA VOZ Y COMPARTA!
Comparta esta campaña con su familia y amigos. Visite la página de Fables Bookshop en Facebook y compártala. ¡Pase la voz! Esto nos ayudará a asegurar el éxito de esta librería comunitaria aquí en Goshen

Los beneficios

Nivel vecino ($10)

Incluye:

  • Carta de agradecimiento

Nivel amigo ($25)

Incluye:

  • Calcomanía de Fables
  • Prendedor con el logo de Fables
  • Carta de agradecimiento  

Nivel compadre ($50)

Incluye:

  • Calcomanía de Fables
  • Prendedor con el logo de Fables
  • Carta de agradecimiento
  • Descuento de 15% todos los martes durante 16 meses
  • Bolsón de lona con el logo de Fables

Nivel padrino ($100)

Incluye:

  • Calcomanía de Fables
  • Prendedor con el logo de Fables
  • Carta de agradecimiento
  • Descuento de 15% todos los martes durante 16 meses
  • Bolsón de lona con el logo de Fables
  • Camiseta de Fables, serie especial

Nivel patrocinador ($250 )

Incluye:

  • Calcomanía de Fables
  • Prendedor de Fables
  • Carta de agradecimiento  
  • Descuento de 15% todos los martes durante 16 meses
  • Bolsón de lona con el logo de Fables
  • Camiseta de Fables, serie especial
  • Invitación a una fiesta de lanzamiento VIP
  • Su nombre grabado en una placa en el Muro de fundadores

We believe in being responsible community members.
We believe in laughter, smiles, and enjoying life.
We believe that reading can change the world.
 Other Ways You Can Help
If you aren't able to contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help us out. Here are some great ways you can support Fables Books:
Donate Your Gently Used Books
Donations will be accepted at Fables Books (215 S Main Street) on Monday - Friday from 11 am - 4 pm and Saturday by appointment. Please use the back door so that we may better assist you in bringing your books inside.  We will be offering a $5 coupon for each copy paper size box donated. Coupons can be used once the store is open. See book donations page for what we will accept.
Collaborate with Us
We want to collaborate with our community in creative ways. Get in touch if you have an idea for collaboration. We'll get back with you as soon as we can.

Does your work require the ordering of books for book clubs, management teams, gifts? We’d be happy to help.
Do you love to run book clubs, writing groups, or children's reading hours? We’re looking to provide community space for this and more.
Are you an expert and would like to do a talk in our new space especially in the fields of writing, literacy, science, art, and history? Let us know.
Do you have a creative idea of how we can work together? Let us know, we’re eager to collaborate.

Volunteer for Work Days
It takes a village to get a bookstore running and we’re always looking for help. Sign-up on our mailing list at fablesbooks.com to get updates on how you can further help. We’ll also be posting our events on Facebook, so make sure to like our page.
GET EXCITED AND SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!
Share this campaign with everyone you know, and share often!  We have 28 days to raise $40,000 so help us spread the word.
Signup for our newsletter at fablesbooks.com so you can stay up to date.
Tell all of your friends! Tag them on Instagram. Invite them to like the Fables Books Facebook page. The more people you tell, the easier it will be for your bookshop to make it here in Goshen!
Español a continuación
Consideramos que las librerías son el corazón de un pueblo. Contienen las historias de cada uno de nosotros y reflejan los intereses, pasiones, y deseos de la comunidad. Por eso, abriremos la librería “Fables” (fábulas) a finales de este verano aquí en Goshen.  Nuestra misión es crear mayor unidad a través de nuestras historias compartidas. Con su apoyo, podemos crear un espacio común en donde todos nosotros podamos encontrar libros y conversaciones que nos inspiren. 
Una amplia selección de libros en español para chicos y grandes, papelería, y obsequios…Fables tendrá todo esto y más. Para hacer realidad este sueño, lanzamos esta campaña de recaudación de fondos. La meta total es 90,000 dólares y solo nos falta 40,000 .  ¡Necesitamos su ayuda! Ya sea con dinero, tiempo, o libros.  
Donación de libros en buena condición Se aceptan donaciones de libros en buena condición en la tienda Soapy Gnome (111 E. Washington Street) durante horas hábiles (lunes a viernes 10-5:15, sábado 10-3:45) hasta que abra la nueva librería. Le obsequiaremos un cupón con valor de $5 por cada caja de libros. Podrá usar su cupón una vez abierta la librería.  Colabore con nosotrosNos encanta colaborar con la comunidad en proyectos creativos. ¿Quiere leer a los niños en español? ¿Tiene ideas para una charla educativa? ¿Tiene un tiempito extra y quiere echar una mano en la tienda? ¡Comuniquese con nosotros!
¡PASE LA VOZ Y COMPARTA!Comparta esta campaña con su familia y amigos. Visite la página de Fables Bookshop en Facebook y compártala. ¡Pase la voz! Esto nos ayudará a asegurar el éxito de esta librería comunitaria aquí en Goshen
Los beneficios
Nivel vecino ($10)
Incluye:
Carta de agradecimiento
Nivel amigo ($25)
Incluye:

Calcomanía de Fables
Prendedor con el logo de Fables
Carta de agradecimiento

Calcomanía de Fables
Prendedor con el logo de Fables
Carta de agradecimiento
Descuento de 15% todos los martes durante 16 meses
Bolsón de lona con el logo de Fables

Nivel padrino ($100)

Calcomanía de Fables
Prendedor con el logo de Fables
Carta de agradecimiento
Descuento de 15% todos los martes durante 16 meses
Bolsón de lona con el logo de Fables
Camiseta de Fables, serie especial

Nivel patrocinador ($250 )
Incluye:

Calcomanía de Fables
Prendedor de Fables
Carta de agradecimiento  
Descuento de 15% todos los martes durante 16 meses
Bolsón de lona con el logo de Fables
Camiseta de Fables, serie especial
Invitación a una fiesta de lanzamiento VIP
Su nombre grabado en una placa en el Muro de fundadores

story:
The Lansing Made Story

Lansing Made has connected with individuals, consumers, and businesses. It has been a meandering journey. Our wings have spread. We are ready to soar. It is time for us to flourish! #LoveLansing #2019Dare2

Hello World. I'm Metro Melik. I'm a long-time resident by way of being an Air Force brat. Or as much of a brat as an Eagle Scout can be raised by a retired Air Force officer and a school teacher.

I've lived in the Lansing area long enough to have possibly pour your drinks as part of my extensive service industry career. I've performed on stage, in Lansing movies, on local / regional television and host / produce a live 'call-in' talk show for ten years.  It's safe to say, I'm "FROM" Lansing.
At some point we've all heard the constant murmur that there was "nothing to do in Lansing". Born from my desire and continued effort to change the dialogue, Lansing Made was born. I wanted to create a hub where people can see the places and faces of Metro Lansing. Oh and offer a cool set of homegrown logos to wear as well. Ben Graham, who is outstanding in his field, created the Lansing Made designs.    www.outstandinginhisfield.com

Why Metro Lansing.

What sets Lansing Made apart from other #LoveLansing entities is that we actively engage in promoting the positive about Metro Lansing. We showcase a cross section quality events, businesses, activities and people that make up our great region.  With your help we can build on that notion.

Let's get a little bit crazy about our region. Think about all the good you've experienced here. I've had countless positive experiences in the Lansing area because of the great things that are in and around Lansing. From community theater, to making music. From exploring cool classic Lansing haunts, to new hot spots. The fact that one can be right downtown and get lost in the woods in a short drive is a fantastic Lansing attribute. I want people inside the tri-county area, as well as the rest of world, to know that Metro Lansing is as cool as I.C.E. being that Lansing touches Ingham, Clinton, and Eaton counties. Lansing is diverse in it's natural resources, business and industry, as well as its people. We are the Capitol region surrounded by award winning schools, colleges, and universities. That is something to be celebrated. Metro Lansing has a great history and we have an even greater future. You can see it happening right now, because Lansing Has Grit. How many places are there that you can have a great dinner, enjoy beautiful scenery, watch a Broadway show, and be home in time for the  11:00 PM news? The world needs to know!
Money raised from this campaign will help building bridges between businesses and our community. When you see the Lansing Made logo connected to a Metro Lansing business, you'll know that they are some cool people involved.

We are a region where people stay, work, and play in different parts yet connected to the middle of it all, Lansing. Our tri-county area is linked in many ways. Simple put, Lansing Made promotes the people and places from Williamston to Grand Ledge, from Saint Johns to Mason and points in between. But Williamston Grand Ledge Saint Johns Mason Lansing & Lansing Township is difficult to get on a sticker. Besides there's Charlotte, Eaton Rapids, Wacousta, Waverly, Delta, East Lansing, Westphalia, Stockbridge, Dansville, Onondaga, Leslie... I digress.
Money raised from this campaign will go toward our continued promotional efforts about What's the Haps in Metro Lansing. Check out the Lansing Made YouTube channel to catch the latest videos. LINK: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChqzRRBmKkKHUR...

Why this campaign is important to me.

Metro Lansing has a multitude of positive attributes. We want to share those attributes with you by building a more robust video blog as a resource for information about Metro Lansing. With your continued effort we can show the world just how bad ass Metro Lansing is. I'd like to help push the positive message of what's good around town. From chicken wings at Gregory's Ice & Smoke, to chicken tenders and olive burgers at Olympic Broil, to Old Nation Brewing Co. in Williamston, to more than mint in Saint Johns, to the movie magic ledges in Grand Ledge [and that yummy popcorn at the Sun Theater], to the historic picturesque Mason. 
Money raised from this campaign will go toward travel expenses in order to connect to new places and create new content to share online.

Giving back to our community is important. That's why we are partnering with the Women's Center of Greater Lansing. Working closely with Cindie Alwood, executive director of the Women's Center of Greater Lansing together we raise close to $20,000 through the efforts of Lansing Made. I'm honored to be in the mix of great company.

Money raised from this campaign will go toward the promotion of Lansing Made as an entity so that more people will see those that we are helping to uplift.

We hope that you feel that this is a wonderful way to show your Metro Lansing pride by supporting an organization that supports you! Lansing Made is going into its fifth year of supporting and promoting events, business and the people of Metro Lansing. We've grown and we need your help to LETEMKNOW!

What your contribution will help Lansing Made achieve.

My goal for Lansing Made was to start combating the notion that there is nothing to do in Metro Lansing. Charlotte's Frontier Days have been going on for almost fifty years. Mason's Sundried Music Festival is young and it will celebrate its tenth year in 2019. The St. Johns Mint Festival will be celebrating its 35th year. The OhMi Organics Eat Health Eat Local Festival in St. Johns went from 0 to 100 m.p.h. its first year, 2017. Festivals are just the beginning. Food truck rallies, galas supporting area nonprofits, music at different venues dotted throughout the area, museums, parks, and numerous year around recreation activities are abundant.

 

What We Need & What You Get

How much funding Lansing Made needs and where it's going. 

Thank you for your continued interest / reading.
It's cliche, but every dollar does count. If you help Lansing Made raise $100 on this campaign, that's another month worth of rent. If you raise $400 on this campaign that would mostly cover a year's worth of software expenses. If you put up $1600 in this campaign Lansing Made can get its own editing computer and won't be limited to not only time of use, but it would increase the variety of videos that Lansing Made could produce to promote Metro Lansing. If you support the campaign enough to raise $10,000 Lansing Made could expand our services and outreach.  Lansing Made will be able to build more bridges with businesses as well as promote more activities and entities in the area. Throw another ten grand on top of that and we there would be a Lansing Made website that would rival others in the area. Working together we can percolate Metro Lansing Mania in the most positive of ways. Go ahead and visit www.lansingmade.com, then check out www.discoverkalamazoo.com. WOW! Website want indeed.


Lansing Made perks. Get excited!

Have you ever wanted to hang out with a few superheroes at your own party? The League of Enchantment can fulfill that fantasy. Or maybe you just want to show your love every where you go. You could do that with a Lansing Made window cling or t-shirt. There are perks for the individual, for business person or for a company. If you got five on it I have a perk for you!

What happens with the funds if Lansing Made does not reach the entire goal?

I stated it before, Every Dollar Counts. That is the reason why I chose flex funding. Every dollar counts is also the reason why I chose the Indiegogo platform. I wanted YOU to have something for your generous contribution to the cause. Other crowd sourcing sites did not offer a give back for your contribution. I didn't feel comfortable with that. The pricing is pretty much the same as if there was a Lansing Made store.
 

What happens with the funds if Lansing Made DOES reach the entire goal?

LANSING MADE WILL THROW A GIANT PARTY or two or three and we can celebrate together. 5/17/2019 is coming up quickly and it will be a weekend celebration of the Lansing Made 517 Day. We have plans to do more community wide celebrations highlighting cool places and faces of Metro Lansing.
The future of Metro Lansing is important to me. It is important to my family. I had love for Lansing before I had a Twitter handle. Way back when # meant number or pound[s].

The Impact

Know the difference your contribution will make:

  • Why this is valuable to the me and to the world.

Lansing Made is about community and collaboration. We have shown that with the numerous entities with whom we collaborated in some fashion. We started by sharing quick videos, to promoting why people Love Lansing, to hosting events. It's been a wild and fun journey. 

I have made a deliberate choice to stay, work, and play in Lansing. I have a family here. My kids will be raised here. I tell them that I am doing all I can to help them to be the best that they can be. I want them to share in my amazing Metro Lansing experiences. I want them to share new experiences and opportunities that will arise because of YOUR collaboration with me as they grow in our town.

Risks & Challenges

  • Overcoming hurdles.

Lansing Made is just over four years old. It has a good presence and a wonderful network of people. We are growing and expanding. If things don't progress exuberantly with this Indiegogo campaign I will not abandon what is Lansing Made. I guess we will just have to see how things go. 

  • Challenges.

Lansing Made has overcome many challenges over the years. It has helped that we keep listening to people to see what they are saying about our community. With the help of Paul Brogan of River Town Adventures, we created the first ever 517 area community celebration at the Lansing City Market with the inaugural Lansing Made 517 Day. Wow that was  great day. Forty plus vendors participated. 400 plus people participated. 2019 Lansing Made 517 Day is shaping up to be HUGE. With your support it will be a fantastic celebration of Metro Lansing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, it's okay if you can't contribute financial, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about the Love Lansing with Lansing Made crowd source fundraising campaign.
  • Use the convenient Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. Keep Fighting the Good Fight #KFtGF

YOU ARE A SUPER ROCK STAR IF YOU READ THIS ALL THE WAY THROUGH. MUCH THANKS TO YOU. #2019Dare2 #LoveLansing #LansingMade 


Again thank you for your consideration.

~Metro Melik of Lansing Made

story:
Short Summary

The idea started as a little seed planted in my head, after I managed to recover from long lasting severe lung disease by using (besides conventional medicines) a simple but almost forgotten local recipe.

Results, also tested on my relatives and friends and their relatives and friends who had more or less serious health problems, were so inspirational that my idea grew to the level of deep understanding of the recipe and high level of production technique. Finally, my work has been crowned: SPELTEX successfully passed complicated certification procedures (according EU legislative which Montenegro is conducting) and our small family local business Permakultura.me officially got approval for its production and distribution.

I am Aleksandrina. I am electrical engineer and high school computer science teacher. In my little household, in the biggest urban settlement in Montenegro (Podgorica, the capital), I am exploring the possibilities of urban space in the direction of sustainable life that meets both, the needs of the people and the limitations of the nature. My two sons are helping me and are my strongest support. Currently, we are on our way to establish small but very serious family super-food business, based on socially responsible entrepreneurship which meets both: the real diet needs of the population and its financial capacity. And we need help.

SPELTEX is the extract of the young spelt grass and can be considered either as raw functional food or as a food supplement. It is made of local wild cereal: spelt (latin: triticum spelta).  In order to maintain the immune system of the organism during and after highly aggressive conventional therapies, this  high potential product is dominantly consumed by individuals who have been diagnosed with cancer or leukemia.

Unfortunately, our small economy, based in 9m2 backyard facility,  has reached a point where production is significantly lower than demand. In order to raise our production we need to reconstruct (ceramic floor, windows, water and electricity supply) and equip (stainless steel five levels shelves, special trays, special lighting, air conditioning and ventilation) existing but currently unsuitable (according to legislative) facility (basement+ground floor, totally 90m2) and to by industrial special slow extractor for fibrous plants, totally at least around 20,000 US$. 

By increasing production capacity we could:

  • totally meet  local's demands for SPELTEX,
  • additionally reduce its price,
  • keep donating part of our production to the people without or with low income
  • start donating part of our production to the children oncology department of the Clinical Center of Montenegro.

The impact

The combination of alternative medicine with conventional, especially by making essential dietary change by using local super foods that correlate with the genetically accepted habits of the local population, has been worldwide shown to be high successful in treating even the most severe diseases.

In the situation where a small country of Montenegro, with only slightly more than half a million inhabitants with a low living standard, registers nearly 2,500 new cases of malignancies each year, an alternative method of preventing and dealing with illnesses by using affordable food supplements is usually the only one possible.

In addition, it is important to point out that our product is 100% made of the  locally produced organic seeds and plants and that our intention is to advocate preventive as the answer of the problem.

Risks & Challenges

Each production carries its own challenges. In our case, the most difficult challenge is just ahead of us: telling a person who is looking for a hope "I do not have".

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also support this campaign by donating the necessary building elements and the equipment, but also by sharing this link on social networks.
