start donating part of our production to the children oncology department of the Clinical Center of Montenegro.


The impact
The combination of alternative medicine with conventional, especially by making essential dietary change by using local super foods that correlate with the genetically accepted habits of the local population, has been worldwide shown to be high successful in treating even the most severe diseases.
In the situation where a small country of Montenegro, with only slightly more than half a million inhabitants with a low living standard, registers nearly 2,500 new cases of malignancies each year, an alternative method of preventing and dealing with illnesses by using affordable food supplements is usually the only one possible.
In addition, it is important to point out that our product is 100% made of the  locally produced organic seeds and plants and that our intention is to advocate preventive as the answer of the problem.

Risks & Challenges
Each production carries its own challenges. In our case, the most difficult challenge is just ahead of us: telling a person who is looking for a hope "I do not have".

Other Ways You Can Help
You can also support this campaign by donating the necessary building elements and the equipment, but also by sharing this link on social networks.

story:
* ENGLISH text is below.

 

The Sushi Artist (anciennement connu sous le nom d’Alex) est le créateur d'un menu des plus impressionnant au monde, avec la plus grande variété offerte : 60 sushis vegan et 40 sushis poisson.  «  HEIIINNN??! Il y a plus de sushis Vegan que de sushi au poisson? », ET OUI !

Maintenant que nous avons votre attention, c'est le temps d'aller droit au but.  

Nous avons besoin de votre support pour la survie de la “Souchi race". Nous devons absolument agrandir pour pouvoir rester sur le boulevard Monk. Présentement, notre emplacement est beaucoup trop petit pour notre achalandage, nous sommes victimes de notre succès ;-)

L’espace restreint nous empêche de nous développer et risque d’éteindre notre « race ».. Pour préserver “the Souchi race”, et nous donner l’opportunité de vous accueillir de la meilleure façon qu’il soit. Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour nous permettre d’investir dans un local plus grand.

Avec 22 000$, nous pourrons ouvrir à un nouvel emplacement prévu pour Mars 2019. Le nouveau restaurant sera au 6615 boulevard Monk, et il pourra accommoder 36 clients tout en ayant 2 cuisines indépendantes; une 100% végétale et l'autre pour les piscivores. Nous pensons qu'il ne devrait pas être difficile de profiter d'un bon repas entre amis et famille, c'est pour cela que nous travaillons fort pour créer le lieu idéal de rencontre gastronomique.  

Un plus grand local nous permettra de réduire l'attente en général, “faire le come-back” de nos sushis dessert, d’obtenir notre permis d’alcool, d’aménager notre restaurant de façon chaleureuse et spacieuse : 26 places aux tables, 10 places au bar. Celui-ci nous permettra d'acceuillir plus de clients pour nos soirées de Sushi Vegan à volonté les Mercredis et Dimanches soir.

Les sushis vegan & poisson seront tout de même disponibles à la carte du Jeudi au Samedi.

Si vous n’êtes pas dans la mesure de nous aider monétairement, vous pouvez grandement nous aider en partageant cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux et en parlant à votre entourage.

Un GROS MERCI de la part de toute l’équipe de la “Souchi race” & The Sushi Artist.

 

ENGLISH TEXT

The Sushi Artist (formerly known as Alex) is the creator of the most impressive & diverse sushi menu in the world, with over 60 vegan sushi & 40 piscivore sushi. I know this is what you must be thinking now.  "WAAAAAAAAAT.... you have more Vegan sushi than Fish sushi?"  

Now that we've got your attention time to get serious.

We need your support for the survival of the "Souchi race". We have to expand in order to survive on the Blvd. Monk. Our current location is getting too cramped and this is problematic because we can’t generate any more income out of this location because of the limitation. 

With 22,000$ the new spot should be ready in mid-March 2019. The new location at 6615 Blvd. Monk can accommodate 36 guests at a time and have enough space for 2 independent kitchens, one 100% Vegan and the other one for the preperation of fish based sushi. We believe that eating out with your friends and family should be easy. This is why we are working on creating the perfect hangout spot for everybody. 

With a larger location, we will reduce overall waiting time, bring back sushi desserts, get our liquor license, 26 table seating and 10 bar seating, making Wednesday and Sunday 100% vegan. Fish & Vegan sushi will also be available à la carte from Thursday to Saturday.

This will help us to be more efficient and allow more customers to enjoy their experience at Souchi bar.

Let's create a positive impact in the world because we will prove that having a sophisticated vegan and fish menu without compromise on flavors or taste is possible. We will be the only restaurant in the world to offer an Vegan sushi with 60 choices with the options for All you can Eat on Wednesday & Sunday. But don't worry we also serve Fish & Vegan sushi à la carte from Thursday to Saturday.

If you are unable to help us with money you can always help us by Sharing this Campaign via Social Media and talk about it to all your Friends. 

A big thank you from the team of the "Souchi race" and The Sushi Artist.

 

PERKS VERSION FRANÇAISE.

SUPA-VEGAN PERK 250$ | SUPA-VEGAN

Vous payez seulement 25$ au lieu du prix régulier de 30$ pour les Sushis Vegan à Volonté tous les mercredis et dimanches.

Vous avez aussi un crédit en magasin de 200$ pour tous achats.

* Le prix fixe de 25$/visite est seulement pour les mecredis et dimanches.
* Cette option est seulement disponible sur Indiegogo, c'est maintenant ou jamais!!!
* Pourboire et taxes ne sont pas inclus dans le crédit de 200$.

CACTUS PERK 100$ | CACTUS

Pour chaque don de 100$, nous allons ajouter un cactus à notre restaurant.

Obetenez 2 Billets pour les soirées Sushi Vegan à Volonté.

Vous allez pouvoir nommer votre cactus et vous en occuper ( arrosage mensuel ). En plus, vous avez un rabais de 10% tant et aussi longtemps que votre cactus est en vie.

Nous allons offrir un environnement favorable pour tous les cactus.

 

SUPA-FISH PERK 250$ | SUPA-POISSON

Vous avez un rabais de 10% à vie sur tous les achats.

Vous avez un crédit de 200$ en magasin.


* Pourboire & les taxes applicables ne sont pas inclus dans le crédit de 200$

ALL YOU CAN EAT VOUCHER 30$| A VOLONTÉ

Vous recevez un Crédit pour nos soirées à Volonté Sushi Vegan.

* Crédit utilisable les mercredis et dimanches.
* Réservation obligatoire. Veuillez mentionner le crédit de Indiegogo.
* Utilisation unique.

* Pourboire et taxes ne sont pas inclus.

WHERE'S My TABLE? 250$ | OU EST MA TABLE? ( reste que 3 disponibles )

Ton rêve est d'avoir une table à ton nom ?

Tu peux réaliser ton rêve, nous allons nommer une de nos tables en ton honneur.

Toi et tes amis avez un rabais de 10% à chaque fois que vous mangez sur votre table.

Lorsque tu veux reserver, nous te donnerons la priorité pour ta table.

Une plaque avec ton nom inscrit dessus, fait spécialement par The Sushi Artist.

I GOT THE BIG TABLE 500$ | J'AI LA GROSSE TABLE ( SOLD OUT )

Nous allons nommer la Grosse Table en ton honneur.

La table fait 10 pied de long et peut accommoder 10 personnes.

Toi et tes amis avez un rabais de 10% à chaque fois que vous mangerez sur votre table.

Lorsque tu veux reserver nous te donnons la priorité sur ta table.

Une plaque avec ton nom inscrit dessus fait spécialement par The Sushi Artist.

Tu as le contrôle sur la TV, PlayStation for Netflix, Crunchyroll & PS4 games.

 

1 YEAR OF FREE VEGAN SUSHI 1000$ | MANGE GRATUIT PENDANT 1 AN

Pour 1000$ tu manges les sushis végans gratuit pendant 1 an complet sur place seulement.

Les amis qui t'accompagnent, payerons seulement 25$ pour manger les sushis végans à volonté.

*Renouvelable à 1000$ par année.

* Pourboire et taxe applicables ne sont pas inclus.

* Breuvage et Alcool ne sont pas inclus.

* Aucun take-out

story:
"The most delicious vegan donair ever!"

- Tashauna  Robar, Facebook follower

About Veg Out

Veg Out is a vegan food service committed to offering delicious versions of the original messy foods people order on the streets, but ethically sourced, environmentally-friendly, and cruelty-free. We can guarantee quality and satisfaction for our customers because we hand make just about every component of our dishes ourselves and source our produce as locally as possible. Veg Out donates all food scraps to Wallflower Sanctuary, a local female-run animal sanctuary outside of Fredericton, to minimize food waste and commits to buying package free whenever possible. We strive to produce the best food while leaving the smallest carbon footprint. With our business platform, we involve ourselves with our community by running contests, pumpkin and toy drives, fundraisers, etc.

From the beginning of our journey, our Veg Out vision included a food truck. After a tremendous amount of hard work and several wrenches thrown our direction, we are excited to officially have the Veg Out truck rolling on Freddy streets this May! We will be cooking up some of our classics as well as showcasing some new must-try items. You will find us at breweries, festivals, and markets in and around the Fredericton area. We are ecstatic to see what this summer will have in store for Veg Out, but we first need the funding to make this dream a reality!

Setbacks

We are forever grateful for having made it to where we are today, but unfortunately, the journey has not been all sunshine and rainbows. There have been a lot of expensive speed-bumps that have hindered us from reaching our goals on time; approximately $9500 in total. This is the price of an entire new truck! Some of our setbacks included being sold a “lemon” truck in Ontario that broke down on our drive home, forcing us to pay for flights back to Fredericton, shipping costs on the truck and the subsequent repairs. For these reasons and several others, we have decided to reach out for help. We hope to gather funding from wherever possible to reach our goal of $10,000 to cover these costs and invest into our business.

About Pat & Shelby

Veg Out was an idea that came about one day at the regular plant-based community discussion groups that Patrick, 26, and Shelby, 22, regularly attended in their small town of Fredericton, New Brunswick. After being vegan for about a year and becoming increasingly aware of the lack of variety around plant-based options in the city, the two youth entrepreneurs took it upon themselves to solve this dilemma. Veg Out was created to shift the context surrounding the word vegan and introduce vegans, vegetarians, and omnivores a-like to plant-based food that can be equally, if not more, drool-worthy and satisfying than food containing animal products. They decided to begin their journey with a booth at one of the local markets in town, selling vegan versions of street-food classics; such as, Donairs, Shawarmas, Jackfruit “Chicken” Caesar Wraps, Sloppy Masala Joes, and a Breakfast Special Sandwich. Now, two years after their idea, they have gained crucial experience and a following on social media of over 2500 people. The community support to bring their dream to life has been incredible thus far and they are thrilled to watch their following of loyal customers grow on a daily basis; with this being said, their food truck vision is just out of reach and with your funding, they will make it reality.

How You Can Help

By you backing this campaign, you are doing your part in contributing to a safer, cleaner, and healthier Earth for all beings. If you are unable to contribute funding at this time, just a simple share of our Indiegogo page would make a world of difference (to us, and the world!). Spread our message to a friend, mention us to a colleague, share us in an email with a co-worker, yell our page from the rooftops! Every contribution counts equally in ours eyes and we appreciate every gesture, big or small.

Achievements

Registered Business

You’ve got that right! As of February 27th, 2019, we are a fully registered business in the province of New Brunswick.

Social Media

Our incredible following is the reason we have reached this point! Our dream would not be possible without our 2500 followers who support us every single day. Give us a follow on Facebook and Instagram @vegout.freddy !

Successful Market Stall

We decided to get our foot in the door, before diving head first into a food truck, by operating a stall at The Cultural Market in Fredericton. This market was a way for us to test the waters and see how our message would be received in our small town; we were more than satisfied with the results. We are proud to currently hold a 5-star review on Facebook based on the opinion of over 45 people.

Menu

Our original market menu was an absolute hit, consisting of a Donair, a Shawarma, a “Chicken” Caesar Wrap, and a Sloppy Masala.

We are firm believers in community and supporting local business, so we later decided to switch out the Sloppy Masala for a Breakfast Sandwich, to collaborate with a few local businesses; featuring, “Eggcitables,” a locally crafted egg alternative and “Scottage Cheeze,” a local vegan cheese substitute.

Our new and improved Veg Out food truck menu is as follows;

Off the Spit

Donair

Seasoned Seitan, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Coconut Donair Sauce, Pita

Shawarma

Seasoned Seitan, Lettuce, Pickled Radish Slaw, Tomato, Cucumber, Garlic Mayo, Pita

Souvlaki

Seasoned Seitan, Lettuce, Cucumber, Red Onion, Tomato, Cashew Tzatziki, Pita

Lunch Munch

Chicken Caesar Wrap

Whole Wheat Wrap, Jackfruit, Romaine, Parmesan, Tofu Bacon, Cashew Caesar Dressing

Korean Tacos (3)

Fried “Chick-wheat”, Kimchi, Napa cabbage, Korean BBQ, Corn Tortilla

On the Grill

Street Corn (Mexican Style, Homestyle)

Corn, Vegan Mayo, Cayenne Pepper, Chili Powder, Parmesan, or Vegan butter, Salt and Pepper

Jerk Kebabs (2)

Tofu, Pineapple, Pepper, Red Onion, Lime, Jerk Seasoning

Chili Cheese Carrot Dogs

Grilled Carrot Dog, Hotdog Bun, Quinoa Chili, Cheeze spread

Top it off

Nice Cream Crumble in a Cone

Frozen Banana, Coconut Milk, Homemade Apple Pear Crumble

Good Boy!

Puppy Slaw

Shredded Apple, Shredded Carrot, Peanut Butter, Applesauce

Thirsty?

Beverages

East Coast Soda (Charlottetown) – 2 Flavours

Tea of Life Kombucha (St.Stephen) – 3 Flavours

In the Morning:

If our funding goals are reached, we would like to remain at our current market as an indoor vendor to honour where we got our start. In addition to this commitment, we will still operate out of the food truck at another local market on Saturdays. If this becomes possible, we will offer a breakfast menu unique to the Cultural Market which would be presented as follows:

The Breakfast Special

Chickpea Egg, Spinach, Tomato, Smoked Gouda, Garlic Mayo, English Muffin

Pancakes/Waffles (Gluten Friendly)

Gluten-free batter, fried and drizzled with locally sourced maple syrup

Big Breakfast

Maple Baked Beans, Toast, Pancakes, Fried Eggcitables and Seitan Bacon

Omelet Roll-Up

Chickpea Egg, Mushrooms, Onions, Spinach, Smoked Gouda, Seitan Bacon, Fried Potatoes, Garlic Sauce

Summer Schedule

We are in the process of scheduling events for this food truck season. The food truck will be in business from ~May 1st to November 1st ; however, Veg Out will operate year-round as an indoor vendor at the Cultural Market. A list of events lined up thus far include a Science Fair for over 850 people, Vegan Connexion, Happy Hour Club, The Garrison Night Market, , and The Cultural Market to name a few. There are several other events in which we intend to be vendors; including Beer on the Bridge, Down East Brew Fest, The Boyce Farmers’ Market, Harvest Jazz and Blues, Highland Games, and several others. In order to keep our costs low for our first year of business, we will be primarily parked outside of breweries such as Graystone, Grimross, York County Cider, Maybee's, and Trailway (Fredericton is the brewing capital of the Maritimes!). Veg Out will be available to cater weddings and parties in addition to the many events listed above. We have decided to hold off on vending at the majority of local festivals this year to keep our schedule standard and easy to follow while we are still gaining customers and followers through our first year.

Funding

All of the funding to date has been out of pocket. We have invested upwards of $30,000 of saved money into our vision and we are thrilled to see the success of our business continue to grow. With our dream so handy, we wouldn’t want to fall short this far into our journey; which is why we are hoping this Indiegogo campaign will gain us the funds needed to achieve our goal. After being approached by several Veg Out fans willing to donate to further the success of our business, we figured this would be a great platform to promote funding.

Risks and Challenges

With veganism becoming a popular trend within millennials, plant-based restaurants are popping up more often in cities around the world. Veg Out however, would supply the first fully vegan menu to the city of Fredericton. With this menu being mobile, we are also able to reach different demographics across the city and surrounding areas.

There has already been tremendous support surrounding Veg Out since having launched in October of 2018 at a small local market. Every single dollar made to date in the twenty-five Saturday markets has been invested into the production of our truck. All of our endless hours of labour and planning have gone unpaid. Our challenge will be to hold our constant traffic when we shift from being open only one day a week, to five or more days a week.

Veg Out will be in direct competition with other food trucks and food vendors at markets in the area. We, however, will be the only vendor able to ensure a meal completely free of possible cross contamination of meat, dairy, or egg products; a very desirable attribute to vegans. People with dietary restrictions will be welcomed by our menu, finding a plethora of options catering to their specific needs. The best part of all of this? This means our food is edible to everyone, including the biggest meat eater you know.

Featured On

Find our article with Huddle here:

https://huddle.today/vegans-lacking-food-options-take-matters-into-their-own-hands-with-veg-out/

We are proud to currently hold a 5-star review on Facebook based on the opinion of over 45 people.MenuOur original market menu was an absolute hit, consisting of a Donair, a Shawarma, a “Chicken” Caesar Wrap, and a Sloppy Masala.We are firm believers in community and supporting local business, so we later decided to switch out the Sloppy Masala for a Breakfast Sandwich, to collaborate with a few local businesses; featuring, “Eggcitables,” a locally crafted egg alternative and “Scottage Cheeze,” a local vegan cheese substitute.Our new and improved Veg Out food truck menu is as follows;Off the SpitDonair Seasoned Seitan, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Coconut Donair Sauce, PitaShawarmaSeasoned Seitan, Lettuce, Pickled Radish Slaw, Tomato, Cucumber, Garlic Mayo, PitaSouvlakiSeasoned Seitan, Lettuce, Cucumber, Red Onion, Tomato, Cashew Tzatziki, PitaLunch MunchChicken Caesar WrapWhole Wheat Wrap, Jackfruit, Romaine, Parmesan, Tofu Bacon, Cashew Caesar DressingKorean Tacos (3)Fried “Chick-wheat”, Kimchi, Napa cabbage, Korean BBQ, Corn TortillaOn the GrillStreet Corn (Mexican Style, Homestyle) Corn, Vegan Mayo, Cayenne Pepper, Chili Powder, Parmesan, or Vegan butter, Salt and PepperJerk Kebabs (2)Tofu, Pineapple, Pepper, Red Onion, Lime, Jerk SeasoningChili Cheese Carrot DogsGrilled Carrot Dog, Hotdog Bun, Quinoa Chili, Cheeze spreadTop it offNice Cream Crumble in a ConeFrozen Banana, Coconut Milk, Homemade Apple Pear CrumbleGood Boy!Puppy SlawShredded Apple, Shredded Carrot, Peanut Butter, ApplesauceThirsty?BeveragesEast Coast Soda (Charlottetown) – 2 FlavoursTea of Life Kombucha (St.Stephen) – 3 FlavoursIn the Morning:If our funding goals are reached, we would like to remain at our current market as an indoor vendor to honour where we got our start. In addition to this commitment, we will still operate out of the food truck at another local market on Saturdays. If this becomes possible, we will offer a breakfast menu unique to the Cultural Market which would be presented as follows:The Breakfast SpecialChickpea Egg, Spinach, Tomato, Smoked Gouda, Garlic Mayo, English MuffinPancakes/Waffles (Gluten Friendly)Gluten-free batter, fried and drizzled with locally sourced maple syrupBig BreakfastMaple Baked Beans, Toast, Pancakes, Fried Eggcitables and Seitan BaconOmelet Roll-UpChickpea Egg, Mushrooms, Onions, Spinach, Smoked Gouda, Seitan Bacon, Fried Potatoes, Garlic SauceSummer ScheduleWe are in the process of scheduling events for this food truck season. The food truck will be in business from ~May 1st to November 1st ; however, Veg Out will operate year-round as an indoor vendor at the Cultural Market. A list of events lined up thus far include a Science Fair for over 850 people, Vegan Connexion, Happy Hour Club, The Garrison Night Market, , and The Cultural Market to name a few. There are several other events in which we intend to be vendors; including Beer on the Bridge, Down East Brew Fest, The Boyce Farmers’ Market, Harvest Jazz and Blues, Highland Games, and several others. In order to keep our costs low for our first year of business, we will be primarily parked outside of breweries such as Graystone, Grimross, York County Cider, Maybee's, and Trailway (Fredericton is the brewing capital of the Maritimes!). Veg Out will be available to cater weddings and parties in addition to the many events listed above. We have decided to hold off on vending at the majority of local festivals this year to keep our schedule standard and easy to follow while we are still gaining customers and followers through our first year.FundingAll of the funding to date has been out of pocket. We have invested upwards of $30,000 of saved money into our vision and we are thrilled to see the success of our business continue to grow. With our dream so handy, we wouldn’t want to fall short this far into our journey; which is why we are hoping this Indiegogo campaign will gain us the funds needed to achieve our goal. After being approached by several Veg Out fans willing to donate to further the success of our business, we figured this would be a great platform to promote funding.Risks and ChallengesWith veganism becoming a popular trend within millennials, plant-based restaurants are popping up more often in cities around the world. Veg Out however, would supply the first fully vegan menu to the city of Fredericton. With this menu being mobile, we are also able to reach different demographics across the city and surrounding areas.There has already been tremendous support surrounding Veg Out since having launched in October of 2018 at a small local market. Every single dollar made to date in the twenty-five Saturday markets has been invested into the production of our truck. All of our endless hours of labour and planning have gone unpaid. Our challenge will be to hold our constant traffic when we shift from being open only one day a week, to five or more days a week.Veg Out will be in direct competition with other food trucks and food vendors at markets in the area. We, however, will be the only vendor able to ensure a meal completely free of possible cross contamination of meat, dairy, or egg products; a very desirable attribute to vegans. People with dietary restrictions will be welcomed by our menu, finding a plethora of options catering to their specific needs. The best part of all of this? This means our food is edible to everyone, including the biggest meat eater you know.Featured OnFind our article with Huddle here:https://huddle.today/vegans-lacking-food-options-take-matters-into-their-own-hands-with-veg-out/

story:
Hi, my name is Kevin Kuwahara, also known as Kuwy, or Coach Kuwy.

I fell in love with 10th Planet Jiu Jitsu 5 years ago and it has been my life ever since.

In middle school I was lazy, unfocused, and unambitious. I started training with the wrestling team in high school so I wouldn't get beat up by upperclassmen at Damien High. I tried it, and hated it. I got crushed at practice and at every tournament. I would ditch practice to avoid the pushups, sit ups, and hard wrestling.

When the next season started up, I wasn't interested. I didn't want to stay an extra 3 hours after school. I didn't want to get beat up all the time. And I certainly didn't want to sacrifice my time to play World of Warcraft. No way did I want to come back to wrestling.

However, my Mom forced me to go back to practice. She said "Once you start something, you don't quit." She never let me quit anything easily I was apart of the team, even though I sucked, even though I hated it. I didn't have a choice.

When I went back to practice, to my surprise, I wasn't getting beat  up so bad, I was still getting beat up, but I was also succeeding against new kids who just started. That gave me confidence. It showed me with practice I could get good. After a few practices I realized "I can do this, and it's a lot of fun to be good at it." I started training more and more. I went from shy, lazy, and fat. To more outgoing, hard working, and in great shape. I eventually got recognition from Coach Angel and Abad. They were my mentors, and they instilled confidence and drive in me. My Mom and my coaches were my saving grace. I was developing into a confident young man through the sport.

After High School Wrestling I had to find an outlet for my competitive spirit. I started training MMA at a local gym. I loved watching MMA and the UFC. Somehow I heard that Joe Rogan would be doing a Live podcast on ustream. I had to check it out. I saw the first few episodes with Redban, Duncan Trussell, Joey Diaz, and best of all Eddie Bravo. I looked up all of Eddies Youtube instructional videos and funny videos with Renato Laranja. I was hooked on 10P.

I spent a few years going to college, traveled a bit, hung out with the wrong crowd, and made a ton of mistakes. I was trying to find myself. I entered a local Jiu Jitsu tournament in Northern California where I was going to school and dominated everyone at the tournament. I knew I was wasting time going to college just to party and wanted to commit myself to getting better at Jiu Jitsu. I knew from watching Joe Rogan that if I dedicated myself and knew the way broadly I could see it in all things. So I packed my bags and moved back to LA to train with Eddie Bravo at 10th Planet HQ. Hopefully by dedicating myself to Jiu Jitsu I could figure out my life.

My first time at 10th Planet HQ was magical. I got to meet Eddie Bravo, I got to take a class with one of my biggest hero's. I had 5-6 years of grappling experience and I was getting beat by guys with 6 months of 10P training. At my old gym I was the top dog in class, I was feared. At HQ I felt like a beginner, a fish out of water. The level of technique and instruction was levels beyond anything I had ever done at regular martial arts gyms. 10th Planet pushed my mind and body like nothing else. I knew I had to go all in with 10P if I wanted to be the best I could be.

I dove in head first. I was training at HQ 5 days a week, 3-4 hours a day. I was evolving faster than I ever could have imagined. I was obsessed with improving my own game, and I also loved helping others. During my free time I would introduce Jiu Jitsu to my friends from school.

I started a Garage Jiu Jitsu Club. It was called Philia Jiu Jitsu. Philia is the greek word for brotherly love or family love. The foundation of the Jiu Jitsu club was to highlight the importance of community and building a family atmosphere. The club was free and open to anyone. Back then I had absolutely no interest in being a gym owner. It looked like a huge headache, and the gym owners I knew were just scraping by. It seemed like a failing business model. I just liked to show people what I know and hopefully they could benefit. I truly enjoyed coaching more than anything. I love teaching people martial arts because it gives them confidence in themselves, it gives them confidence in their ability to practice, dedicate, and improve on whatever they set their minds to. It was fulfilling. 

6 months into garage training, the garage was filling up. We only had 2 car widths of mat space to work with for 15 people. We even prepared for tournaments, and took home some gold. It was madness at times. Oh the glory days of getting taken down right next to a sharp metal corner. I was bringing on a lot of people, and I knew it wasn't sustainable in my garage. My family was tired of me bringing random people over, and so was I. The Club was unsustainable and losing traction.

The problem was I was making no money. I was taking just 1 class a semester at Citrus College and spent all my free time going to Jiu Jitsu, and had no plan for my future. Don't get me wrong, I was ambitious, I had a lot of ideas, but nothing stuck. I wasn't excited about anything, and I wasn't good at anything other than wrestling and Jiu Jitsu. But I needed money, I was desperate to provide for my family and girlfriend. I hated feeling like a broke loser. That day I applied to every job I could find, Starbucks, McDonalds, Uber, you name it. My garage Jiu Jitsu club was failing, people stopped showing up, and I was on the verge of terminating the program to focus on getting work. As a last resort I called a crossfit gym to see if they would be interested in starting a Jiu Jitsu program. To my surprise I got a call back.

While most of my garage students died off, I was able to bring over a few into the new crossfit location. Still only 400 sqft of space, but at least in an actual gym. Training at the Crossfit gym was great, but after 3-4  months, once again, we needed to expand. 400 sqft of space just wasn't enough. If we wanted to be a successful 10th Planet we would need a lot more space. So I began looking for other locations to take my small team.

We took a break for a month to build our current location. The barf colored brown carpet and the hot pink walls were god awful. But with the help of our small Jiu Jitsu family we pulled the carpet, painted the walls, layed down tile, and set up mats. We turned the Jackson Hewitt Tax Service into a functional Jiu Jitsu Gym. 

Since moving into the latest location we have been able to make big impacts on peoples lives. People love being apart of the 10th Planet Covina Family.

-Megan M

"I have been training at 10th planet for 7 months now. I have tried other martial art forms and honesty became bored. After attending a trial class at 10th Planet, I fell in love. Over the course of these 7 months, my self-discipline has sky rocketed; my focus and drive are part of my day to day routine. The curriculum is very rigorous, which makes for a fast-paced learning environment. Coaches are thorough and very informed on the intricacies of each move, ensuring quality instruction. Classmates are all very welcoming and supportive. With these coaches and classmates, I am aware of the very supportive community that is always present on and off the mats. I love seeing myself, my classmates, and this local business flourish! If you're thinking of training anywhere, it should definitely be at 10th Planet Covina."

 

-Matt L

"Throughout my experience at 10th Planet Covina, I have been impressed with all of the coaches. They have an exceptional work ethic and are genuinely passionate about what they do. This is definitely an awesome place to workout and learn jujitsu. Whether it's an in-depth wrestling based seminar or an in-gym tournament, there's never a dull moment here. Coach Kuwy and Coach Richard are very creative and mindful. They are going to push you to be better every time you step on the mat. In my case it was two months after a shoulder surgery, both the coaches and students worked with me, and helped me progress mentally and physically. Regardless, of an injury or set back you can still train, learn, and study with the best. If you can do jujitsu you can deal with the instability and the unknowns of life!

P.S. A very friendly & humble environment filled with tons of talented individuals."

 

-Andrew B

"Hands down the best place to train Jiu jitsu. I've always contemplated starting but I was always afraid. Finally took the leap and tried it and I'll never regret it. From my first class ever to now, every single coach in this gym has treated me like family, like they've known me forever. Everyone who attends is awesome and has nothing but a positive attitude. Literally everyone wants to help you get better. I truly believe there's no better place to train than 10th planet Covina. This place isn't just my gym but it's become my home, with each and every individual who attends being like my family to me. If you're looking to train Jiu jitsu look no further, I promise you won't regret it."

These are just a few of many testimonials we wanted to highlight. Check out our Yelp page and see for yourself what kind of impact we are making.

We've come a long way. But we're not stopping here. I received my brown belt from Eddie Bravo this past August and I've never been more excited to grow as a Martial Artist, a coach, and gym owner. Our goal is to move into the large building next to Yoga and Kaos Records. It's roughly 4000 sqft in total.

Our challenge is that the new space is raw. It's going to take a lot of work to get it operational. We have to build the bathrooms and showers from scratch as well as buy new mats.

This is an ambitious goal but I know we have a very supportive family oriented community that can help us with this build, if we all do a small part we might be able to pull this off.

Here's a few of the many things we will be raising money for

-Brand new high quality Fuji or Zebra Jiu Jitsu mats

-Heavy Bags

-Comfortable showers and clean bathrooms

-Private training room dedicated for working out and private lessons

-Traditional Japanese Style Ambiance and Samurai Artwork 

-New Flooring, Ceiling, and walls.

We are doing everything we can to cut our costs to afford this upgrade. However, it could be a while before we are ready to move. But not if we get some help. Our Goal is to raise at least $10k in the next 3 months. 10k should be just enough for us to get operational. Nothing fancy at first, just a ton more mat space, and showers. Hopefully, we can grow a lot from there and build the gym of our dreams. 

Thank you! We are eternally grateful.

-Coach Kuwy

ALSO! We are implementing a reward system to encourage people to donate to our evolution. I know you're not donating so you can get stuff However, we'd like to show you our appreciation and give you some rewards in return for your generosity.  Let us know if you have any other cool reward ideas. Hope you enjoy!

10% Off Membership Price if you pay in full for 6 months

20% Off Membership Price if you pay in full for 1 year

story:
Share the Love

Help us help others in this time of need. Share the love with an Hair Essentials kit for essential employees - 911 dispatchers. All proceeds will benefit the Salon 46 Relief Fund which supports our wonderful staff while they are unable to work.

How it Works

Every purchased Hair Essentials kit will be donated directly to 911 dispatchers serving the Alexandria/Arlington area. Kits are $50 each. Any donation amount is appreciated.

Hair Essentials kits includes shampoo, conditioner and a styling product from one of our product sponsors: Bumble and bumble, Oribe, and Redken.

For purchasing a Hair Essentials kit, you will receive a free gift of exclusive samples (we will send your free gift once we are open for business)!

Which 911 Dispatchers and Why?

Alexandria/Arlington-based 911 dispatchers.

  • These behind-the-scenes voices work tirelessly to connect first responders to those in need. 911 dispatchers are there for us in life’s worst moments and we may never get to know who they are!
  • The mother of one of our stylists is a 911 dispatchers in the Alexandria/Arlington area and we would like to show her and her co-workers some love!

 

Spread the Love

If you aren’t able to contribute at this time please share this event on social media.

Follow @Salon46 on Instagram

Follow Salon46 on Facebook

Thank you for helping us care for others in this time of need. We are very grateful for each of you!

story:
We are still Learning Indiegogo and Fund Raising so this is Our Second Attempt to Raise Needed Funds.

The Inaugural Pumpkin Mash Dash

Keep Colleyville Beautiful (http://www.keepcolleyvillebeautiful.com/) is a community based non-profit organization focused on bettering the lives of Colleyville residents. Colleyville’s current recycling program is a reflection of KCB members’ efforts. Additionally, KCB administers Colleyville’s Adopt-A-Street program and participates in the annual city wide Clean Sweep event. KCB would like to expand its efforts to include such things as a community garden and more community events. To help achieve this goal KCB has decided to start a new tradition in Colleyville, with the inaugural Pumpkin Mash Dash on November 7th, 2015 at the Pleasant Run Soccer Complex, 6700 Pleasant Run, Colleyville, Texas.

The Pumpkin Mash Dash will be an annual late-afternoon fun run/walk and timed 5K/10K race along the beautiful Cotton Belt Trail in Colleyville, Texas. Additionally, after the race there will be a community Lighted Bicycle Parade for all ages. The hope is that this event will help raise money for KCB, raise community awareness of KCB, and be a chance for people to come together and enjoy Colleyville’s portion of the Cotton Belt Trail with a run and a unique parade. At the event KCB also hopes to educate the public on recycling, litter control, beautification, the environment and health.

Why Indiegogo for fundraising?

Through Indiegogo as a non-profit, all donations will be tax deductible. Additionally, by having our fundraising effort on Indiegogo, supporters can pay by credit card. We can also reach a large group of supporters we may not even know. KCB is a volunteer, non-profit organization which only receives funding from grants and donations. A race has lots of expenses, and we expect the Pumpkin Mash Dash at a minimum to cost $4000 at a minimum to put on. This will drain a large portion of our limited funding. With 300-400 runners and their associated registration fees, the Pumpkin Mash Dash is expected to just break even. Since this is the first time KCB has put on such an event there is a great unknown around how many participants there will be and a chance for unplanned expenses. We have teamed with a great race organizer, PlayTri, who has donated their skills and expertise to help us put on the Pumpkin Mash Dash. We have also consulted with other non-profit groups who put on races. We feel prepared, but there still are risks. By raising funds through Indiegogo, these risks can be offset and more of the registration fees can be used by KCB for its efforts. All the funds raised here will go directly to putting on the Pumpkin Mash Dash and Lighted Bicycle Parade. If we exceed our goals, those proceeds will go to making the race and parade even better next year.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk and challenge is Keep Colleyville Beautiful has never done an event like this before. Even with the help we are receiving from PlayTri and other non-profits, something could happen we haven’t planned for.

Where can I register for the race?

www.playtri.com/pumpkinmashdash

What is a Lighted Bicycle Parade?

The Lighted Bicycle Parade is a community event where participants will ride their bicycles on a short course around the Colleyville Pleasant Run Soccer Complex. At a minimum bicycles will need headlights, but riders are encouraged to decorate their bicycles as brightly and colorfully as they can. Registration for the parade is free and open to all ages who can operate a bike by headlight, at dusk, at slow speeds, safely. Bike-pulled trailers will be allowed as long as they are securely attached to the bicycle and have a breakaway cable/device. Open flames and throwing items from bicycles such as candy isprohibited due to insurance reasons.

Where can I register for the Lighted Bicycle Parade?

www.playtri.com/pumpkinmashdash

What happens if you don’t meet your fundraising goal?

The race and parade will still go on. Every dollar we raise will help us, but if we come up short in fundraising, it will make it extremely difficult to do all the things KCB currently does and would like to do in the future.

Can the race be cancelled?

The race would only be cancelled due to extreme weather or other catastrophe. A cancelled race will not be rescheduled. Registration for runners is non-refundable. Runners will still get a race shirt, and Indiegogo supporters will get their rewards. “Get A Booth” supporters will get refunds if they desire. If you have further questions please contact this campaign’s organizer before donating.

I have a question I can’t find an answer for?

Please contact the campaign organizer with any questions. We’ll as quickly as possible address your question because… we are sure others have the same question.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways other than donating where you can help. A race and parade like this need lots of volunteers before, during, after and the day after the event. If you are interested, please contact this campaign’s organizer. Additionally, please tell everyone you know to register for the race or donate. The more people who hear about the Pumpkin Mash Dash and this fundraising campaign, the more likely Keep Colleyville Beautiful is to have a successful race and meet our fundraising goal.

Please follow us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/KeepColleyvilleBeautiful/
story_txt: We are still Learning Indiegogo and Fund Raising so this is Our Second Attempt to Raise Needed Funds.The Inaugural Pumpkin Mash DashKeep Colleyville Beautiful (http://www.keepcolleyvillebeautiful.com/) is a community based non-profit organization focused on bettering the lives of Colleyville residents. Colleyville’s current recycling program is a reflection of KCB members’ efforts. Additionally, KCB administers Colleyville’s Adopt-A-Street program and participates in the annual city wide Clean Sweep event. KCB would like to expand its efforts to include such things as a community garden and more community events. To help achieve this goal KCB has decided to start a new tradition in Colleyville, with the inaugural Pumpkin Mash Dash on November 7th, 2015 at the Pleasant Run Soccer Complex, 6700 Pleasant Run, Colleyville, Texas.The Pumpkin Mash Dash will be an annual late-afternoon fun run/walk and timed 5K/10K race along the beautiful Cotton Belt Trail in Colleyville, Texas. Additionally, after the race there will be a community Lighted Bicycle Parade for all ages. The hope is that this event will help raise money for KCB, raise community awareness of KCB, and be a chance for people to come together and enjoy Colleyville’s portion of the Cotton Belt Trail with a run and a unique parade. At the event KCB also hopes to educate the public on recycling, litter control, beautification, the environment and health.Why Indiegogo for fundraising?Through Indiegogo as a non-profit, all donations will be tax deductible. story:
What is Brothers Ale House?

Brothers Ale House is Guelph’s newest craft beer destination, opening spring 2016 at 15 Wyndham Street North in Guelph’s historic Petrie Building. The facility will include a fully functioning brewery, bar and retail store. Our aim is to provide Guelph residents a local source for innovative and North American style craft beer, along with a unique place to gather and enjoy them. The bar will have 12 taps which will pour a wide selection of core brands, seasonals, one-offs, multi-brewery collaborations, and guest taps from some of the best craft breweries in the province. Our goal is to breathe new life into the historic structure which has loomed the sky line since the late 1800’s, and make it a focal point for local activity. We plan to work with as many local providers as possible to bring a diverse selection of entertainment and activity into the space. Examples include acoustic bands, open-mic nights, brewery yoga, community beer events, beer-dinners, beer runs, and tandem bike races. We will utilize local providers when sourcing ingredients, packaging design, advertising and merchandise. Guelph has a lot to offer, we want to showcase that through beer.

Where are we now?

Our brewing equipment has been ordered and renovations have begun. We have spent our savings, sold some organs, and acquired loans to afford the basics. We are now seeking assistance to make the interior of the bar area as kick-ass as possible. We intend on keeping the historic feel of the building and transform the ground floor back into a space that matches its past…but with a hip brewpub twist.

How can you help?

To start, you can help us in achieving our pledge goal. Indiegogo works by allowing supporters to pledge money (in return for tiered prizes) towards our funding goal. The campaign is timed and pledges are only accepted for the duration of the campaign. Pledges are accepted and prizes are given regardless of whether the pledge goal is reached.

Steps:

• Select a reward or enter an amount you wish to donate.

• Enter your email or log on with your Facebook account.

• Pay by credit card or Paypal.

• Wait anxiously for your favorite brewpub to open

• Repeat

It’s that simple.

What are our plans for the pledge money?

All the funds from this campaign are going to be put towards the construction and renovation of the bar area. This means the more money pledged, the cooler we can make the space, and the more you can enjoy it. Below are pictures of the space now, followed by a 3D rendering of what we want it to look like. Feel free to share your comments or suggestions in the comment section of the campaign.

Who are we?

Brothers Brewing Company was started by twin brothers, Asa and Colton Proveau, in the spring of 2014. It is the culmination of a long-term plan they devised in their senior year of high school to one day open their own microbrewery. To ensure their success, Asa earned a degree from the Brewmaster and Brewery Management program at Niagara College and Colton in Business Administration from Brock University. They gained valuable hands on experience working in some of the top craft breweries in the province, including Sleeman Breweries Ltd., Muskoka Brewery, Sawdust City Brewing Company and NC Teaching Brewery. After almost six years of preparation they decided they had enough experience to launch a brewery of their own and Brothers Brewing Company became a reality.

While contract brewing a batch of their beer at the Niagara College Teaching Brewery, the brothers met Michael Bevan, then a student in the Brewmaster and Brewery Management Program. Michael had just retired from a 20 year career with RBC Dominion Securities and was looking for a change of pace. He enrolled in the program to learn about beer-making/ brewery operations and hopefully, in combination with his business experience, join a venture and help bring a small brewery to the next level. After numerous meetings and discussions the partnership with Asa and Colton was forged. 


Watch Pumpkin Video Below!
https://youtu.be/lD3hf2jeKuo

Why Guelph!?

While working as a seasonal relief brewer at Sleeman Breweries Ltd, Asa was introduced to Guelph and most importantly, the Petrie building. With its towering, dark, Victorian façade, the building caught Asa’s eye on the first trip he made downtown. With ideas of opening a brewery in the future, every cool building seen was sized up for its brewpub or brewery potential. The Petrie building seemed perfect for Brother's Alehouse. Realizing the size and cost of the project, the idea remained an unrealistic dream. When learning of its potential demolition, and joining a petition/Facebook group dedicated to saving the building, the brothers kept a watchful eye on the building. The day the building was purchased by the Tyrcathlen Group, a shot-in-the-dark email was sent that sparked a series of meetings, and a chance was given to turn that unrealistic dream into a reality. Knowing they would need someone to help them make the dream of Brother's Ale House a reality, another quick email, a few beers, and a lot of signed documents later, Michael became the adopted brother. This was the last piece in an extremely fortunate series of events that has led to Brothers Ale House coming to downtown Guelph.

                                                                  - Perks -

Sticker


 T-Shirts 

Prints

Tanks

Mug Club

       

Your Own Brew!

      <====== This Could Be You!!

story:
is proud to present our first annual:

But what is "Fall Festival"?

"Fall Festival" is an event where we raise funds and awareness towards diabetes, and the research that is going towards it in order to bring the disease to an end. By purchasing a ticket today you are taking a stand against Diabetes.

What is "Diabetes"?

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC),

"Diabetes is the condition in which the body does not properly process food for use as energy. Most of the food we eat is turned into glucose, or sugar, for our bodies to use for energy. The pancreas, an organ that lies near the stomach, makes a hormone called insulin to help glucose get into the cells of our bodies. When you have diabetes, your body either doesn't make enough insulin or can't use its own insulin as well as it should. This causes sugars to build up in your blood. This is why many people refer to diabetes as “sugar.” Diabetes can cause serious health complications including heart disease, blindness, kidney failure, and lower-extremity amputations. Diabetes is the seventh leading cause of death in the United States."

How will my donation today be used to fight diabetes?

All proceeds raised by this event will be donated to two leading organizations in the diabetic community, the American Diabetes Association (ADA), and the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF).

Where and When?

"Fall Festival" will be taking place at Maggie O'Neill's Irish Pub & Restaurant located at 1062 Pontiac Rd., Drexel Hill, PA, 19026 on Saturday, October 10, 2015, at 07:00 PM ET and will be going until 10:00 PM ET.

What to expect at "Fall Festival"?

This event is a charitable beef and beer for all ages. Come out for food, music, our generous vendor tables, a photo booth, and more! All ages may enter, however you must be 21 years of age or older in order to purchase, and consume alcohol.

*Note: This is not an internet exclusive event. Online tickets are available for purchase in order to give us a head count for the event.

story:
Problem

Is this your scenario? You have a taste for gumbo and the only place to get a bowl is either downtown in a sit down restaurant or far out in the suburbs, or you have to wait once or twice a year for a family member to make some, or you JUST can’t find good gumbo!

Solution

Cynthia’s Gumbo Express Inc. is here!  We specialize in seafood, chicken, turkey and vegetable gumbo! Yes, I said vegetable! We have just added a vegan gumbo that has also gotten rave reviews! What do I know about making gumbo….? I know you’re wondering…. if we’re from Louisiana , BUT no we’re true Chicagoans. We have lived here all of our lives!  But the love and flavor that's put into every bowl or gallon makes you taste Louisiana.

Festivals

Hyde Park Jazz Fest ,  Sept. 26-27, 2015

Farmer’s Markets

We have been selling our gumbo at farmer’s markets since 2014, in the loop, north and south Chicago and south suburbs ; hot on the spot or cold to go.

What we need

Our plan is to bring Cynthia’s Gumbo Express to the streets of Chicago via a mobile food truck. Now this is where you come in, with your help, we can make this happen!

We need the truck to bring it to the streets and “wrap” it with the graphics to command attention. Picture a purple, green and gold truck- the  signature colors for Mardi Gras- driving around bringing Louisiana cuisine to the city of Chicago.

TO CUSTOMIZE THE TRUCK we need a refrigerator-freezer, a  3 compartment sink, hand washing sink, steam tables, counter top/prep table, 3 commercial table top fryers, wiring, storage cabinets, water tanks, heaters/air conditioning for summer months, etc.  We need to hire someone to install all of the equipment to meet the city’s standards and to get the final licenses to cook on the truck.

What we’ve done

We have our food service sanitation license, shared kitchen user’s license, and liability insurance. We have the kitchen supplies to make all this happen.

I’m a graduate from C.H.I.C. (Cooking and Hospitality Institute of Chicago) now known as Le Cordon Bleu. I have been catering full entre meals, desserts, and soups for over 20 years. I retired January 2013 from the postal service after 34 years and as I was committed to the postal service, I’m committed full time in growing the business. My husband will be retiring soon so we both will be working on the truck, along with hiring additional help.

What our colors mean

What those colors mean and represent for Cynthia’s Gumbo Express:  Purple means Justice - It’s just us… the husband and myself! Green represents Faith- You can have faith that your bowl or gallon of gumbo is delicious, fresh and consistent every time. Gold represents Power- the power is what’s behind our brand.  Being able to deliver by our slogan “We are the best!”  We use fresh vegetables and ensure our seasoning and ingredients do not contain MSG. We only use vegetable oil and fresh herbs. Once you taste one bowl, you’re hooked! We guarantee it!  

        

What’s our Future Plans

We plan to expand our menu. We’ve already added beignets to our menu at farmer’s markets and we plan on adding po’ boy sandwiches. Louisiana cuisine on wheels! Help us bring this to the streets of Chicago.

WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

How to find us

You can find us on twitter, face book, and our website. Twitter @gumboexpress  -  Facebook.com/cynthia’sgumboexpress -  www.cynthiasgumboexpress.com

story:
What am I doing?

I want to provide a safe and empowering workplace for Autistic individuals where their struggles are accommodated and their strengths are maximized and fully utilized.

Why am I doing it?

Autistic individuals face an estimated 80-85% unemployment or underemployment. When you consider there are 4,700,000 million Autistic individuals (1 in 68 according to the US Centers for Disease Control), it is clear why there is an estimated yearly cost of $236 billion to U.S. taxpayers (equal to over 35% of the entire U.S. defense budget in 2011).

But I have a much more personal reason. I myself was diagnosed with Asperger’s in 2012, at age 33, after a lifetime of frustrations, questions, and struggles. Finally finding answers not only transformed my own life, but also showed me how I can use my experiences to improve the lives of so many others who struggle like I have. Among them, I have personally encountered the difficult and sometimes debilitating challenges that Autistic people face in traditional workplaces. The reasons are many and vary from individual to individual, but can be broadly categorized as sensory overload, social stigmas, political pressures, and executive dysfunction struggles.

Yet Autistic people have tremendous capabilities, and many are aptly suited for high-tech careers. Platinum Bay provides successful career opportunities in software technology and engineering.

What is my action plan?

Platinum Bay is a software company founded with the mission to make a large-scale, impactful difference in the Autism community. To do that requires whole new ways of thinking about hiring, workplace accommodation, business models, partnerships, and every other facet of our vision.

For the past fifteen months, I've been working tirelessly with scores of advisors, and I have bootstrapped all efforts with my own time, money, research, networking, and plenty of sweat and tears. Our For-Purpose company has been incorporated, the strategy is comprehensive and sustainable, our trademark is registered, and I have personally assembled a dedicated leadership team – all initially volunteering their time and skills as a labor of love and belief in our mission.

With that mission and my 16 years of experience as a software engineer, I created Platinum Bay Technologies, a first-of-its-kind workplace for Autistic individuals that will support their individual needs and highlight their many strengths. We will do this by providing an environment where our team can:

  • Work remotely from home, anywhere in the United States.
  • Work on a flexible schedule because many Autistics have unconventional body clocks.
  • Receive full market salaries plus benefits, not a disability wage.
  • Work in a text-based environment with clear and consistent written direction, enabling us to consider candidates who are non-verbal, as well as account for auditory processing issues and more.
  • Be supported by Autism-friendly managers and a team that is part of the Autism community and cares deeply about creating successful opportunities for our people.

Our Business Model

Platinum Bay is also unique in our business model as a first-of-its-kind For-Purpose company designed for maximum impact. We have combined for-profit operations to hire top talent and do aggressive sales and marketing, and a non-profit financial model coupled with public, transparent accountability and reporting designed to achieve maximum impact for the Autistic community. Our projections estimate that by year five, we will employ 120 Autistic individuals, with 77.9% of gross revenue going to salaries and benefits for Autistic individuals and the Foundation.

A portion of net profit is set aside to create and endow the Platinum Bay Foundation, our planned corporate non-operating (grant writing) foundation to help fill the many gaps in the Autism support ecosystem and empower even more Autistic individuals to find their own individual success.

What We Need & What You Get

I also struggle with various aspects of my Autism and in order to get this company off the ground, I need to bring on a team with strengths in areas I am not strong in. This campaign is my avenue to raise the necessary money to do just that – provide the support system, through a talented and capable leadership team, this vision needs to reach its potential. The money we raise will also help to cover business expenses including CPA, HR, payroll, legal, and our co-employment relationship.

Stretch Goals

$150,000 – Software Engineering Skills Training Program

Our first stretch goal of $150,000 will enable us to start building a skills training program, especially for Autistic individuals, with our potential technical training partners. Our specialized technical skills training program curriculum will be available online, on-demand, with individualized guidance and support from our technical volunteers. While geared towards high school students and older, there will also be some resources for younger folks as well, as it is never too early to begin discovering the fun, challenges, and community that are part of a career in software development.

Rewards

Individual Rewards

We’re a social mission and not a product. As a result, every dollar we are able to raise goes directly to our mission. As a result, we have simplified individual rewards as a token of our appreciation for your support.

Note: Our business model is designed for maximum impact, thus there is no tax deduction for contributions.

Corporate Rewards

For our corporate backers, you get Platinum Bay services equal to the dollars you spend ($5,000+), plus 20% additional work, a listing on the crowdfunding page on our website, and a shout out. Not only do you get top quality solutions from some of the top minds in the industry, but you also help employ a highly capable yet highly disadvantaged segment of our population in the process.

Contact us today to discuss your needs and our capabilities!    

Risks & Challenges

No one wants to see a great idea poorly executed, especially one that can genuinely benefit so many deserving individuals. Neither do I, and we have worked extremely hard to make these plans rock solid. Here are what I see as potential risks we have worked proactively to resolve:

  • Customers: Because I recognize, like many others in the Autistic Spectrum, that sales is not one of my main strengths, I have brought on Jim Traynham as Director of Customer Success. Jim has a great big heart and exceptional talent with 25 years’ experience in technology, sales, and different needs employment.
  • Technical Staff: We are establishing partnerships with numerous training companies, therapists, and an overall community referral pipeline. We have a short list of developers ready to begin work yesterday. And we are already seeing significant and growing interest in employment at Platinum Bay.
  • Reward fulfillment: Sometimes things go awry that can’t be planned for. To help overcome those risks, are working with reputable fulfillment programs to ensure you get your rewards.

Other Ways You Can Support Us

As I have worked to create Platinum Bay over the past 16 months, I have received overwhelmingly positive support from across the Autistic community. There is nothing like what I am building, and there is tremendous need.

Each and every backer brings us one step closer to actualizing our goal. If you can, please support us financially. You can also support Platinum Bay’s mission by sharing our page and spreading the word. Every little bit makes a difference. Together, we can bring much needed resources to the Autistic community and the world at large.

There are 4,700,000 people are on the Autism Spectrum, and they can change the way we do business. Please support my campaign!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
story_txt:
What am I doing?

        I want to provide a safe and empowering workplace for Autistic individuals where their struggles are accommodated and their strengths are maximized and fully utilized.
    
Why am I doing it?



        Autistic individuals face an estimated 80-85% unemployment or underemployment.
        When you consider there are 4,700,000 million Autistic individuals (1 in 68 according to the US Centers for Disease Control), it is clear why there is an estimated yearly cost of $236 billion to U.S. taxpayers (equal to over 35% of the entire U.S. defense budget in 2011).
    

        But I have a much more personal reason.
        I myself was diagnosed with Asperger’s in 2012, at age 33, after a lifetime of frustrations, questions, and struggles.
        Finally finding answers not only transformed my own life, but also showed me how I can use my experiences to improve the lives of so many others who struggle like I have.
        Among them, I have personally encountered the difficult and sometimes debilitating challenges that Autistic people face in traditional workplaces.
        The reasons are many and vary from individual to individual, but can be broadly categorized as sensory overload, social stigmas, political pressures, and executive dysfunction struggles.
    



        Yet Autistic people have tremendous capabilities, and many are aptly suited for high-tech careers. Platinum Bay provides successful career opportunities in software technology and engineering.
    
What is my action plan?

        Platinum Bay is a software company founded with the mission to make a large-scale, impactful difference in the Autism community.
        To do that requires whole new ways of thinking about hiring, workplace accommodation, business models, partnerships, and every other facet of our vision.
    

        For the past fifteen months, I've been working tirelessly with scores of advisors, and I have bootstrapped all efforts with my own time, money, research, networking, and plenty of sweat and tears.

story:
Our Pitch

Nothing we can do is more powerful than changing a life and giving back to others. There are many ways to serve people in need and on a daily basis I try to do small acts of kindness for those I encounter. But I now feel I'm being called to do something bigger.

In November I'll be traveling to Israel with my good friend Carolyn Eastman to volunteer with the organization Go Eco. I'll be working with two different programs.

1. I'll be participating in workshops that provide adults with special needs with training and employment according to each individual’s abilities and needs. The ultimate goal is to prepare the clients for employment and integration in the community. I'll also be assisting the staff in whatever capacity they need. 

2. I'll be volunteering in an animal shelter cleaning out cages, walking dogs and caring for the animals. Tel Aviv has an extremely large stray animal population and as we all know I'm obsessed with my dog Murphy and can't stand the thought of animals not having a good home. So this program is perfect for me!


Short Summary

The goal is to make a small difference in Israel, but also to show people how to volunteer in a responsible way. We've unfortunately experienced first hand how unethical the voluntourism industry can be and we want to encourage those considering to volunteer to do so in the most impactful way. 

Carolyn and I will be documenting my experience on camera to inspire others to give back. By donating to our trip, you will be helping us have a positive impact on a community in need and motivating others to volunteer as well.  

What We Need 

Here's the breakdown of where your money is going

1. Airfare: Heather's flight from Los Angeles to Tel Aviv is $880 (amazing price BTW)
Carolyn's flight from Denver to Tel Aviv is $1023

2. Program Fee: $500 which includes a safety orientation and tour of Jerusalem

**Since Carolyn can't have the same volunteering experience I will because she'll be shooting and editing throughout the trip, her program fee has been waived.  

3. Accommodations: $850.00 The program offers a shared hostel for volunteers to stay in, however, since we will have expensive camera equipment to shoot our pieces with we're going to do Air B n B.  

4. Food: $600 We plan on buying groceries and eating in as much as possible to cut down on costs

5. Transportation: $500 We will need to take cabs to and from our volunteer assignment. I might rent a car for the time we're there, but I'm nervous about driving in another country. Yeah I know I'm lame!! The volunteer program doesn't offer transportation or meals other than a light breakfast so this is an expense we must cover ourselves. 

**We plan on taking a day trip to Petra, which we will pay for ourselves. We're only asking for donations to help with the volunteering costs . 

What You Get

We're so appreciative of your support and donations that we'd like to do something for you!

$5-$50
A postcard from Israel

$51-$100
A magnet from Israel (I'm obsessed with collecting magnets from places I've traveled)

$101-$250
A magnet and a key chain (another thing I'm obsessed with collecting)

$251-$400
A t-shirt or hat. Your choice. Please send me your size

$401-$500
A cool item from Jerusalem. I have no idea what it will be yet, but I'll find you something good!

$501-$749
An executive producing credit and special thanks on our vlogs

$750 or more
An executive producing credit and special thanks on our vlogs AND you will be my guest at a cool Hollywood event. I'll keep you updated on events I have coming up.

story:
Short Summary

Founded in 1910, NICRO - the National Institute for Crime prevention and the Reintegration of Offenders remains the only South African national organization which provides comprehensive crime prevention services focused on the rehabilitation and the reintegration of offenders.

NICRO has for century provided world class services throughout South Africa Criminal Justice system. 

Many of our services are the only of their kind in the country, and provide a lifeline not only to those who they serve directly, but also to their families and affected communities. NICRO’s services, which have had their success conclusively demonstrated, include:

  • Diversion: Allows for some offenders to be dealt with in an ‘out of court’ way. Diversion involves a powerful, life-changing experience, especially for children and young people caught up in crime who need support inspiration and opportunities to turn their backs on crime, transform their lives and realize their full potential.
  • Offender reintegration/Ithuba: focused on reform, the termination of offending behavior and the facilitation of successful reintegration into society as a law-abiding citizen
  • Non-custodial sentencing offering a wide range of psycho-educational, therapeutic and rehabilitative programs for those who commit less serious and non-violent crimes.

The Impact

NICRO offers innovative developmental and therapeutic interventions for juvenile and adult offenders, their families and the community, which involve life-changing programmes that have a significant and measurable impact on crime reduction. 

Through our 3 main services: Diversion, Offender Reintegration and Non-Custodial Sentencing, we annually touch the lives of well in excess of 50,000 beneficiaries who constitute some of South Africa’s most vulnerable and dis-empowered individuals:

  • Victims of crime and violence, more especially abused women and survivors of domestic violence;
  • School children in most high risk communities
  • Youth at risk of committing crime and coming into conflict with the law;
  • Incarcerated persons, released prisoners and their families;
  • And marginalised, vulnerable communities affected by crime and poverty.

With more than 90% success rate within our diversion programme, NICRO is indeed making a positive impact in South Africa.

Other Ways You Can Help

Supporting the work that NICRO does has never been so easy, at NICRO we have designed and partnered with various business and organisation to help us help you make your donation to NICRO as easy and transparency as possible.

1.  Visit our website and donate online

a.  www.nicro.org.za/donate

2.  Visit our Social media pages to get daily updates on NICRO

  • www.facebook.com/nicro2  
  • www.twitter.com/nicro_

story:
Hi there! 

OK...so maybe Flip won't be on the ballot, but he would be incredible!!!
When I gave up looking for what I loved and just started "DOING" life...I FOUND IT!
Two years ago while at dinner in a place that uses butcher paper as a table cloth and gives you a bucket of crayons to doodle with I held a crayon in my hand. I'm not new to art, but it had been then almost 7 years since I created anything. Seven years ago while in the middle of painting a wall mural in my home my mother suffered a devastating stroke. I would never finish the painting. My whole life changed and I made a decision then I needed to find my happiness. It took me a couple years and many friends and family would visit and ask, "When are you going to complete that?!" In my heart I knew that I would never finish it, that life was over. Two years later I would end my marriage of 15 years and the last thing I did was go into the garage and grab a gallon of paint and wipe that off the wall. 
So, there I was with a crayon in my hand and memories of shooting pains ran through my hands. I spent at least 6 hours a day for months on that mural. It was very hard for me to begin again something that reminded me of such a painful moment in my life, but the fire in me and drive to create art was much stronger and it won. 
Through that process, I created two characters and tons of art. My art represents how I feel and see life. My message comes through my drawings of Silly Stiks and Flip de Bird. 
Most of the best things in life we stumble upon and I just keep falling. 
I originally drew Silly Stiks while trying to learn how to verbalize my feelings, it was easier for me to do this through my art. 



Silly represented at first myself and very quickly she became many ladies little fan. She is every girl, we all have horns, halo and wings. The horns to me are the brattiness we all have on occasion, the halo is our sweetness and for me the wings represent what we always had and just needed to find. I love finding the secrets within myself.
Flip de Bird came about on accident. A wonderful friend asked me if I could draw Silly "flipping the bird!" Yikes! Ummmmm....considering her audience I had to come up with a bratty way to show this. So I drew Silly Stiks with a bird flipping around her arm and tada!!!!! Flip de Bird was born.


Flip is Silly's best friend, he's her hero. He suggests at times things Silly can't say and he redirects and shows her things she needs to learn. He is lovable, yet has a bit of sarcastic humor.
So! Where do we go from here? Silly and Flip have so much to do! 
Yes! my art started as an accident, but where I'm at today is no accident. I have spent most of my days off and all evenings building what I have now. I recently received an award and my art was chosen for this year's theme in Portland at the Festival of Nations. This drawing below is that art piece.

I will be displaying my art at a local Panera Bread Restaurant and this February I have an art exhibit that runs the entire month. 
What continually stops my momentum is a lack of funds. Everything I built has been mostly hard work and my time and pay as I go. I want to take Silly Business to the next level. I want to create an inventory of my art products and begin stocking  businesses with my creations and with your help I can do this.
With the funds I raise I will first deliver to you all your perks in time for you to even give as gifts this holiday. Next, I will print and frame all my art for my art show in February. I need to print and frame 15-20 art pieces for display and sale. This will cost me between $1200-$1500. Many of the pieces on display will sell and I'm very excited to be able to quickly replace the pieces as they sell, but I can only do that in a timely way by having the money to pre-print them all. Next, I will create an inventory of my greeting cards and be able to sell them in businesses. I have many requests for coffee mugs, stationary and t-shirt prints that I will be able to create and make available. 
If this campaign super exceeds what I'm hoping for then it will allow me to purchase equipment and technology to even further develop Silly Business. 
Here are the details on the current perks I am offering. I will update as they sell out.
 
$5 Post cards. Thank you and signed and mailed to YOU! 



$25~ My Silly Flip-book

20 pages filled with my most popular art and messages. This is an awesome collectible piece. There will only be 100 available. I will sign and number each one. 

$50~ Limited Edition Signed Print
"Hearts A Mess" 8 x 10 

Only 25 of these prints are available. 

Printed on Hahnemuhle fine art paper with archival inks. 

COA, Certificate of Authenticity included.


$100~ Silly Bundle, includes two 8 X 10 prints. "Flip Who" and "I'mPossible".

Printed on Hahnemuhle fine art paper with archival inks. 

COA, Certificate of Authenticity included for both prints.



$175~ "Paint Your World" Plexiglass Print

11 x 14  Very limited signed edition print.

Only 10 available. "Unique" print.

Printed on Hahnemuhle fine art paper with archival inks. 

The "sandwich" combination of front and back mounting has the look of a floating frameless presentation. Plexiglass on the front, print in the middle, and the back is mounted to Dibond. Lastly, a backing cleat is attached in order to hang the piece for a modern and sleek display. 

Only 10 available.

Printed on Hahnemuhle fine art pearl paper with archival inks.

COA, Certificate of Authenticity included.


COA, Certficate of Authenticity included. 

Please don't forget I am offering FREE to everyone that shares my campaign a digital piece of my art to use as a screensaver or wallpaper for any of your phones, laptops or tablets. Please email me at sillystiks@gmail.com, put in the subject line "screensaver" and at the end of my campaign I will send you a downloadable version. Super thanks to you all!!!
