story:
THE NERDER STORY:

We are a non profit dedicated to raising awareness and funds for charity while providing fandom events for our communities. Nerder Mysteries was formed in early 2015 by the dynamic duo Katie Aiani and Isaac Pierce and is now run by a team of ten volunteer staff members and a variety of volunteer actors and event staff.


WHAT'S INCLUDED IN OUR SHOWS?:


  • A Fun Filled Fandom Themed Environment
  • A New and Unique Live Interactive Mystery Theater Show
  • Fandom Themed Food
  • Silent Charity Auction With Fandom Themed Items
  • A Raffle with Great Prizes
  • Prizes for the guest or team with the winning mystery guess!
  • Costume Contests with MORE PRIZES!
  • Safe Family Friendly Environments
  • Learn About and Donate to Great Charities
  • Make new friends and connections in the fandom communities you love!


    • WHERE DOES YOUR CONTRIBUTION GO?:

    Your knuts, sickles, and galleons will go a long way towards assisting our magical non profit in getting up and running. Every galleon donated will allow us to host bigger and more fantastic events, including our next big show, Nerder Mysteries and the Great Hall Detectives. We hope that you will join the light side with us in our goal of supporting charities and bringing entertainment to fandoms of all sizes, shapes, and factions. So come one, come all! Whether you're a Jedi, a Time Lord, a wizard, or a super hero without a cape, you won't want to miss this!  


    WE NEED YOU!:

    We cannot continue to put on our shows without funding! All start up businesses are expensive to begin, and we produced our first show directly from your ticket sales, donations and loans from our own pockets, and of course the time and energy of our epic volunteer staff.
    Please help us to continue our efforts!


    Your donation will help us with:

    - Hosting our next great show, Nerder Mysteries and the Great Hall Detectives along with future shows

    - Reimbursing our hardworking staff and actors on their show donations

    - Reimbursing our investors from registering as a non-profit in the State of CA

    - Promoting & marketing Nerder Mysteries and our next big event

    - Providing our guests and patrons with sweet swag





    5 STAR REVIEWS:



    • "A fun and immersive experience! Isaac and Katie did an EXCELLENT job making sure the guests had fun, and felt immersed into the show!"
      -Jake Houlihan
    • "Wonderful show! Great performers! Can't wait to do it again!"
      -Amanda Ann
    • "Had an amazing time!! Actors were amazing! Thank you so much!!!"
      -Lori Bender
    • "Amazing performers, wonderful cause. 10/10 would buy again!"
      -Lindsay Ruppert
    • "5 stars! Keep up the good work! Great Show! "
      -Christopher Seeling
    • "Great company to work with! Highly Recommended 5 stars!"
      -Lissa McGrath



    WHATS NEXT?:


    SHOW NAME: Nerder Mysteries and The Great Hall Detectives
    DATE:TWO SHOWS on December 19th 11am & 6pm
    LOCATION: Whimsic Alley, Los Angeles, CA

    HOW TO ATTEND: For show admission, donate using the perks on the right and receive your entry ticket from us in your email.
    Take part in solving this all new magical holiday mystery inside the walls of the Great Hall! Join the rest of your fellow wizard students at the four house tables to feast on whimsical themed treats, interact with the professors you know and love, and spend time with family, friends and fellow fans of this magical series. Come dressed in your house colors, costumes, or robes, win great prizes, and donate to LUMOS through our Silent Charity Auction.


    HURRY! This show WILL sell out!




    MORE SHOWS:

    Our goal is to bring you at least two themed fandom events each year! We want to bring you fandom themes that you want to see most! Help us by giving us suggestions, or volunteer with us! We are always looking to add to our talented volunteer staff for all positions. If you have questions, or have an interest in volunteering, or just want to chat about nerdy things, please email us at nerdermysteries@gmail.com


    WHAT IS LUMOS?:


    Lumos works to help the millions of children in institutions worldwide regain their right to a family.

    8 million children worldwide are living in institutions because they are poor, disabled or from an ethnic minority. This is a serious problem, on a massive scale, but there is a solution. Lumos works in partnership with governments, professionals and carers, communities, families and children, to transform outdated systems that drive families apart. Together with their partners they replace institutions with community based services that provide children with access to health, education and social care tailored to their individual needs. This supports families to provide the loving care their children need to develop to their full potential and build a positive future for themselves.



    DID YOU KNOW:


    Nerder Mysteries donates 100% of all Silent Auction profits directly to Lumos!
    The person with the winning bid on each silent auction item will be asked to donate their paper bid directly to the LUMOS website. When each guest shows us their Lumos donation confirmation we hand over the auction item.
    OR Donate Today Directly To LUMOS






    RISKS & CHALLENGES:

    With any new company there are always challenges! Will our tickets sell? Will we have interest in our shows?

    We are proud to report that through the various challenges and hurdles we have faced we are still going strong. Our first Show back in May 2015, aboard the Queen Mary, was an overwhelming Success!

    Our Doctor Who-Dunnit show sold out faster than we ever expected and we were unable to accommodate many more guests who we wished could also attend. Our plan is to produce more shows, more often, at a price you can afford.




    WHO WE ARE:

     
    Isaac Pierce is widely known for his passions of theater, his child like enthusiasm, dedication to charitable causes, and his ever so popular 10th Doctor cosplay. Isaac is a seasoned playwright, and a theatrical director who has produced and performed in a variety of stage shows.

     
    Katie Aiani, works non-stop between Nerder Mysteries, and as a professional Graphic & Web Designer in Southern CA. She is widely known for her determination, passion for helping others, and ability to be in many places at once.
    ( We suspect a time turner or a TARDIS is being used here. ) Katie is dedicated to a variety of fandoms, technology, cosplay, and fitness communities.



    MORE WAYS TO HELP

    Maybe you're not able to donate right now?
    You can still help:

    • Spread the word about LUMOS!
    • Share our campaign link on social media & any website you know people will see it. (Please use the indiegogo share tools on this page.)
    • Donate to a children's toy drive this holiday season
    • Donate to LUMOS at any time through their website if you do have the funds later


      • Not able to attend our next show? Don't worry! We have more future shows already being planned. Keep an eye on our social media to follow along on the latest news and updates.


    THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME!
    And remember! A little Nostalgia, Never killed Anyone!
story_txt:
THE NERDER STORY:

We are a non profit dedicated to raising awareness and funds for charity while providing fandom events for our communities. Nerder Mysteries was formed in early 2015 by the dynamic duo Katie Aiani and Isaac Pierce and is now run by a team of ten volunteer staff members and a variety of volunteer actors and event staff. 


WHAT'S INCLUDED IN OUR SHOWS?:

A Fun Filled Fandom Themed Environment
A New and Unique Live Interactive Mystery Theater Show
Fandom Themed Food
Silent Charity Auction With Fandom Themed Items
A Raffle with Great Prizes
Prizes for the guest or team with the winning mystery guess!
Costume Contests with MORE PRIZES!
Safe Family Friendly Environments
Learn About and Donate to Great Charities
Make new friends and connections in the fandom communities you love!





WHERE DOES YOUR CONTRIBUTION GO?:


Your knuts, sickles, and galleons will go a long way towards assisting our magical non profit in getting up and running. Every galleon donated will allow us to host bigger and more fantastic events, including our next big show, Nerder Mysteries and the Great Hall Detectives. We hope that you will join the light side with us in our goal of supporting charities and bringing entertainment to fandoms of all sizes, shapes, and factions. So come one, come all! Whether you're a Jedi, a Time Lord, a wizard, or a super hero without a cape, you won't want to miss this!  

WE NEED YOU!:
We cannot continue to put on our shows without funding! All start up businesses are expensive to begin, and we produced our first show directly from your ticket sales, donations and loans from our own pockets, and of course the time and energy of our epic volunteer staff.
Please help us to continue our efforts!

Your donation will help us with:
- Hosting our next great show, Nerder Mysteries and the Great Hall Detectives along with future shows
- Reimbursing our hardworking staff and actors on their show donations
- Reimbursing our investors from registering as a non-profit in the State of CA
- Promoting & marketing Nerder Mysteries and our next big event
- Providing our guests and patrons with sweet swag





5 STAR REVIEWS:





"A fun and immersive experience! Isaac and Katie did an EXCELLENT job making sure the guests had fun, and felt immersed into the show!"-Jake Houlihan
"Wonderful show! Great performers! Can't wait to do it again!" -Amanda Ann
"Had an amazing time!! Actors were amazing! Thank you so much!!!" -Lori Bender
"Amazing performers, wonderful cause. 10/10 would buy again!" -Lindsay Ruppert 
"5 stars! Keep up the good work! Great Show! " -Christopher Seeling 
"Great company to work with! Highly Recommended 5 stars!" -Lissa McGrath 




WHATS NEXT?:

SHOW NAME: Nerder Mysteries and The Great Hall Detectives
DATE:TWO SHOWS on December 19th 11am & 6pm
LOCATION: Whimsic Alley, Los Angeles, CA
HOW TO ATTEND: For show admission, donate using the perks on the right and receive your entry ticket from us in your email. 
Take part in solving this all new magical holiday mystery inside the walls of the Great Hall! Join the rest of your fellow wizard students at the four house tables to feast on whimsical themed treats, interact with the professors you know and love, and spend time with family, friends and fellow fans of this magical series. Come dressed in your house colors, costumes, or robes, win great prizes, and donate to LUMOS through our Silent Charity Auction.


HURRY! This show WILL sell out!



MORE SHOWS:

Our goal is to bring you at least two themed fandom events each year! We want to bring you fandom themes that you want to see most! Help us by giving us suggestions, or volunteer with us! We are always looking to add to our talented volunteer staff for all positions. If you have questions, or have an interest in volunteering, or just want to chat about nerdy things, please email us at nerdermysteries@gmail.com




WHAT IS LUMOS?:
 
Lumos works to help the millions of children in institutions worldwide regain their right to a family.

8 million children worldwide are living in institutions because they are poor, disabled or from an ethnic minority. This is a serious problem, on a massive scale, but there is a solution.  Lumos works in partnership with governments, professionals and carers, communities, families and children, to transform outdated systems that drive families apart.  Together with their partners they replace institutions with community based services that provide children with access to health, education and social care tailored to their individual needs.  This supports families to provide the loving care their children need to develop to their full potential and build a positive future for themselves.

DID YOU KNOW:

Nerder Mysteries donates 100% of all Silent Auction profits directly to Lumos!

The person with the winning bid on each silent auction item will be asked to donate their paper bid directly to the LUMOS website. When each guest shows us their Lumos donation confirmation we hand over the auction item.
OR Donate Today Directly To LUMOS



 



RISKS & CHALLENGES:  
With any new company there are always challenges!
Will our tickets sell? Will we have interest in our shows?

We are proud to report that through the various challenges and hurdles we have faced we are still going strong. Our first Show back in May 2015, aboard the Queen Mary, was an overwhelming Success! 

Our Doctor Who-Dunnit show sold out faster than we ever expected and we were unable to accommodate many more guests who we wished could also attend. Our plan is to produce more shows, more often, at a price you can afford. 

 


WHO WE ARE:
 

Isaac Pierce is widely known for his passions of theater, his child like enthusiasm, dedication to charitable causes, and his ever so popular 10th Doctor cosplay. Isaac is a seasoned playwright, and a theatrical director who has produced and performed in a variety of stage shows.

 

Katie Aiani, works non-stop between Nerder Mysteries, and as a professional Graphic & Web Designer in Southern CA. She is widely known for her determination, passion for helping others, and ability to be in many places at once. ( We suspect a time turner or a TARDIS is being used here. ) Katie is dedicated to a variety of fandoms, technology, cosplay, and fitness communities.



MORE WAYS TO HELP 
Maybe you're not able to donate right now?

You can still help:


Spread the word about LUMOS!
Share our campaign link on social media & any website you know people will see it. (Please use the indiegogo share tools on this page.)
Donate to a children's toy drive this holiday season
 Donate to LUMOS at any time through their website if you do have the funds later

Not able to attend our next show?
Don't worry! We have more future shows already being planned.
Keep an eye on our social media to follow along on the latest news and updates.



 THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME!
And remember! A little Nostalgia, Never killed Anyone!

story:
Welcome to Mtn. Roots Revival™ – Come Play in Your Own, Hand-Carved Dough Bowl!  We have a new certificate plan. Now, you can afford a one-of-a-kind heirloom, too! Learn the dough-bowl-biscuit method and pass it on! Scroll for info!

New: $69 or $92 Discount Certificate "Perks" to COMMISSION Bowl for Christmas ... Complete Bowl Payment Over Time, Throughout 2016, at Your Pace! Scroll down to see "perks" in right-hand column. Bowl carving starts in January, 2016...wrap certificate 12/10/15! :)

"Referral Rewards" – Get Your Bowl for $100 Total! How? USING Indiegogo's social media tools (left of film), while logged in to your Indiegogo account, motivate $1,000 in contributions for our bowls/perks.* See "Referral Rewards" at bottom for terms.*


Hey Dough-Bowl-Biscuits & Old-Ways Fans! Be sure to watch our campaign film up top...y'all will enjoy the garden-cooking footage. :) Then...for those who've said you'd like to have Mama's films on DVD, this is where you get them...also certificates to commission your own dough bowl or patchwork bear. See the "perk" list in the right-hand column and scroll down to see all! :) Give the certificates for Christmas too! Commission your dough bowl with a $69 or $92 "perk" certificate. 

Bowl carving starts in January, 2016! Films will be shipped in early December and make great gifts too! :) Thanks y'all! – Mtn. Roots Revival™



Looking for a truly special Christmas, Wedding, Mother's Day or other holiday gift this year...one made in America...by hand? Check out the photos, below, and read about the gifts we have if you decide to come along. 


BELOW, SEE DETAILS ON HOW THESE CERTIFICATES AND THE BOWL-MAKING PROCESS WILL WORK.


~ First ...

Here's Mama's Original Dough-Bowl Biscuit Film...Shared 28,000 Times So Far...Thank You All So Much! "Shared" from "Mtn. Roots Revival" on Facebook...visit us there too! Thank you!

Perk: Two Films to Choose from on DVD:  

Film Option #1:  If you choose Mama's Dough-Bowl Biscuits film on DVD, as a perk, expect a much-EXPANDED version...about 25 minutes. ~ Dough-Bowl Biscuits, Tenderloin and Skillet-Creamed Gravy, with added mountain tales, too...more footage in the dough bowl, plus Mama's country, skillet gravy from start to finish...all filmed during the original biscuit recording in 2010.



Film Option #2:  Mama's Cooking From the Garden, Dumplings, More...cutting and skillet-creaming some fresh, field corn...frying okra, chicken tenders and cooking a pot of country-style, fresh green beans...a stove-top, chocolate pie with meringue for dessert...chicken n' dumplings too!



Perk: Membership in the "Mtn. Roots Revial-Sweet-Treat-of-the-Month Club" – One, Three and Six-Month Trials. Delivering Whole Pound Cakes & More to Your Door (Anywhere in Continental U.S.)...Coming to You From Mtn. Roots Revival's Forthcoming, Inspected, Mountain Kitchen & Bakery.


Each Month, We'll Choose a Sweet Treat of the Month...Choosing From an Assortment of Whole Pound Cakes...Full, Sheet Cake-Sized Pans of our Mississippi Mud-Like, Made-From-Scratch, Chocolate Cake (with Marshmallows and Stove-Top, Cooked Chocolate Icing on Top)...Large Tin of Hand-Rolled & Dipped Peanut Butter Balls...Possibly Even Some Handmade, Fried Apple Pies (shipped frozen so you can fry them in your iron skillet). Maybe, Some Months, We'll Choose a Few Jars of Our Own Jelly or Pear Preserves. Will we ship chocolate pies too? Not sure...only if we can get them to you in good condition...hopefully we can ship them too! :)



Perk: Certificate Toward Commissioning Your Own, Hand-Carved, Wood, Dough Bowl! Certificate Makes Great Christmas Gift Too. :) Carving begins January, 2016! 

This bowl has been modeled after the dough bowl that Grandpa made for all of us...an octagonal, hand-carved dough bowl. We love it and believe you will too! Your bowl will be carved in homes, right here in Appalachia...made from Maple or other hardwoods.

  

TAKE NOTE Y'ALL:  There are multiple, wood-bowl-related CERTIFICATES to choose from in the "perk" section at right...scroll down to find the one you'd like. NOTE THIS TOO:  The price of the bowl, itself, has been reduced...after two initial, related "perks" were posted. The initial perks, which cite the original price of the bowl, before reduction, cannot be removed, per Indiegogo rules, as they have been selected by contributors. The $69 and $92 bowl "perk" certificates reflect the newly-reduced price of the bowl (price at purchase...when the discount certificate is applied). The $185 perk will still cover 50% (and come with additional items, too), but know that the price of the related bowl has been reduced, also. We cannot edit the "perk" to reflect the reduction of the price of the bowl, itself, due to Indiegogo rules. Here's a breakdown to explain the bowl perks and how they work. :)


1st ~ $69 PERK: AFFORDABLE, BUDGET-FRIENDLY WAY TO GET YOUR BOWL CARVED: After this perk is redeemed, the balance of the down payment on the bowl can be paid over time, throughout 2016, at a flexible rate you choose! Read below for balance/details. THIS PERK ALSO INCLUDES ONE SET OF FILMS (2 DVDs): ~

How the $69 Bowl Certificate will Work:  The certificate will act as a "discount voucher" of sorts...entitling the holder to a 25% discount on the purchase of the bowl, once it's complete. The discount will be applied to the price of the bowl, which is $275. If you give this certificate as a gift this Christmas, when the recipient redeems it (by emailing us that he/she would like to begin making contributions to complete the bowl down payment) – the bowl will have been formally commissioned. IMPORTANT: With this perk certificate, the holder is eligible to contribute toward the full, bowl down payment throughout 2016, at a frequency and amount preferred (i.e. $25 set each month, likely through automatic PayPal® debit, or flexible...$10 one month, $30 another, skip a month...however preferred). With THIS bowl certificate, the bowl will be added to our "to-carve" list once 75% of the bowl's total cost has been paid. We'll ship the bowl once it's been carved/completed, if 100% + shipping has been paid. Bowl price: $275...minus the 25% discount covered by the perk certificate...so $206.25 to be paid over course of 2016, at rate preferred but prior to shipping. Shipping costs are separate and determined by shipping location. 


2nd ~ $92 PERK: AFFORDABLE, BUDGET-FRIENDLY WAY TO GET YOUR BOWL CARVED: After this perk is redeemed, the balance of the down payment on the bowl can be paid over time, throughout 2016, at a flexible rate you choose! Read, below, for balance/details. THIS PERK ALSO INCLUDES ONE SET OF FILMS (2 DVDs): ~


How the $92 Bowl Certificate will Work:  The certificate will act as a "discount voucher" of sorts...entitling the holder to a 33.33% discount on the purchase of the bowl, once it's complete. The discount will be applied to the price of the bowl, which is $275. If you give this certificate as a gift this Christmas, when the recipient redeems it (by emailing us that he/she would like to begin making contributions to complete the bowl down payment) – the bowl will have been formally commissioned. IMPORTANT: With this perk certificate, the holder is eligible to contribute toward the full, bowl down payment throughout 2016, at a frequency and amount preferred (i.e. $25 set each month, likely through automatic PayPal® debit, or flexible...$10 one month, $30 another, skip a month...however preferred). With THIS bowl certificate, the bowl will be added to our "to-carve" list once 75% of the bowl's total cost has been paid. We'll ship the bowl once it's been carved/completed, if 100% + shipping has been paid. Bowl price: $275...minus the 33.33% discount covered by the perk certificate...so $183.31 to be paid over course of 2016, at rate preferred but prior to shipping. Shipping costs are separate and determined by shipping location. 


Note: The $95 "perk" in the right-hand column cannot be deleted, per Indiegogo rules, as it has been selected by a contributor. However, the new $92 "perk" reflects the reduced price of the bowl at purchase and the increased discount percentage (from 25% to 33.33%). If you inadvertently choose the $95 bowl perk, know that the reduced bowl price will be honored for it, as well, as will the increased discount percentage (from 25% to 33.33%). So, no need to stress or worry! :) 


3rd: ~ $185 PERK: THIS PERK INCLUDES TWO SETS OF FILMS (4 DVDs) AND SWEET-TREAT CLUB TOO:  If you choose the $185 wood bowl certificate as your perk, know that it will also come with two full sets of both of Mama's films (so four DVDs). Plus, it will include a one-month membership in the "Mtn. Roots Revival Sweet-Treat-of-the-Month-Club".  Included perks will be shipped, separately, as completed. Shipping costs for bowls and treats are separate. The price of the bowl, itself, at purchase (to which the discount certificate is applied) – that price has been reduced from the $370 cited in the "perk" box for this certificate to $275. We cannot edit the bowl price cited in the $185 perk certificate box, per Indiegogo rules, as the perk has been selected by a contributor. However, if you choose this perk, know that the final cost of the bowl, itself, will be less than the price cited in the box. Read, below, for balance/details.

How the $185 Certificate will Work: The certificate will act as a "discount voucher" of sorts...entitling the holder to a 50% discount on the purchase of the bowl, once it's complete. Remember, this certificate comes with two sets of both films (four DVDs) and one month in our sweet treat club, too.  If you give this certificate as a gift this Christmas, when the recipient redeems it (by emailing us that he/she would like to begin stage I of the bowl's production) – the bowl will have been formally commissioned. Your bowl will be added to the "to-carve" list, and carving will begin in January, 2016. At the time of redemption/commissioning, no additional payment will be required. Once the bowl has been completed, we'll notify the holder, who will have 30 days to complete the purchase (by paying the cost of the bowl, set at $275...minus the 50% discount guaranteed by the perk certificate...so $137.50 for the account balance). Shipping separate and determined by shipping location. 

We'll then sign the bowl with the recipient's name...date, number and ship it. If the holder needs additional time to purchase, we'll notify the next commissioning customer and move the first party's name farther back on the list...making stage II of the purchase more budget convenient. Terms and conditions will apply. How long will it take for your bowl to be completed? It's difficult to say...depends upon the number who would like a bowl. Each will be handmade...no factories for sure! Each will be different and unique, too...wood markings will vary, as will other aspects of the bowls.  It could take up to a year to complete all orders, depending upon the number...possibly somewhat longer? We just can't say for sure. We can say, though, that we believe it will be a gift you will cherish for years...all made from hard woods...likely Maple, like the bowl in this photograph...all made right here in America! 


Perk: Certificates Toward an Appalachian-Stitched, Patchwork Bears...Made Especially for You or Your Loved One from Baby Clothes, Blankets, Grandpa's Jeans & Shirts...or Other Clothing Sentimental to You. We Can Provide Fabric Too. We Hope You'll Wrap Up a Certificate as a Christmas or Other Gift This Year! :)

Your "Mtn. Roots Revival Patchwork Bear" will be modeled after this bear, which my Granny Gilreath made for me...and other grandchildren, too. We'll make your bear from a special fabric...one we'll create from small blocks of fabrics sentimental to you, which you'll send to us. We'll be stitching your squares together to create a cherished, decorative family heirloom...one perfect to adorn a nursery, out of reach of a child...one ideal to adorn an adult's room, too. Our bears will NOT be child-safe bears for play, y'all; so, please do keep them out of reach of children! We can provide fabrics if you choose, too! :) You can put a pair of overalls on your bear, if you like. Whether you outfit your bear or not, we know you'll treasure it for years to come, as we have always treasured ours. Over time, we hope to put lots of Appalachians to work, stitching bears in their mountain-area homes. 

INCLUDES FILMS and SWEET TREAT TOO:  If you choose the bear certificate perk, know that it will also come with two full sets of both of Mama's films (so four DVDs). Plus, it will include a one-month membership in the "Mtn. Roots Revival Sweet Treat of the Month Club".  Included perks will be shipped, separately, as completed. Shipping costs for bears and treats are separate.

Patchwork Bears are a Two-Stage Process: 

How the Certificate Will Work: The certificate will act as a "discount voucher" of sorts...entitling the holder to a 50% discount on the purchase of the bear, once it's completed. If you give this certificate as a gift this Christmas, when the recipient redeems it (by emailing us that he/she would like to begin stage I of the bear's production) – then, the bear will have formally been commissioned. Your bear will be added to the "to-stitch" list, and we'll start piecing bears by February, 2016.  At the time of redemption/commissioning, no additional payment will be required. Once the bear has been completed, we'll notify the holder, who will have 30 days to complete the purchase (by paying the cost of the bear, set at $195...minus the 50% discount guaranteed by the perk certificate...so $97.50 for the account balance). Shipping is separate and determined by shipping location. 


Online Magazine Content Submissions: 

Once funded, we will obtain legal advice to develop submission guidelines. If you are interested in submitting content for our online, video-based magazine, email us at this address and write "Submission Info" in the subject line: MountainRootsRevival.News@gmail.com. If you would like to suggest a video-based feature of someone in your area, who practices the old-ways, way of life, email us and tell us about the individual...even if this individual does not reside in the Southeast. We hope to feature folks throughout the United States. 


* "Referral Rewards" – Get Your Bowl for $100!

* Referral Rewards: Get Your Bowl for $100 Total! This program will reward you for others' contributions to our campaign – IF those contributions are generated, directly, via your Indiegogo-tracked referral links. IMPORTANT: In order for contributions generated by your referrals to be tracked by Indiegogo and to count toward this referral reward program, you MUST be logged in to YOUR Indiegogo account and you MUST be using I

ndiegogo's social media tools to share our campaign with others. Indiegogo's social media tools are located to the left of our campaign film, up top. Y

ou will have created an Indiegogo account during the process of making your own contribution to the campaign.

If you are logged in to your account, and if you use Indiegogo's tools to share this campaign with friends through Twitter®, Facebook®, email, links, etc., then both you and Mtn. Roots Revival will be able to access Indiegogo's tracking screen and determine the dollar amount of contributions generated through your referrals links. If your Indiegogo tracked referrals motivate $1,000 in contributions for our perks...our bowl certificates, bear certificates, DVDs, etc., then your total bowl purchase price will be reduced to $100. If your Indiegogo-tracked referral contributions to our campaign reach the $1,000 threshold – and you had previously selected the $92 or $95 bowl certificate – which also comes with films, then your bowl will be considered paid in full. We'll even cover your shipping within the continental U.S. If you had selected the $69 bowl certificate and your Indiegogo-tracked referral contributions reach this threshold, your remaining bowl balance will be reduced to $31, plus shipping. If you had previously selected the 50% bowl certificate at $185, and your Indiegogo-tracked referral contributions meet this threshold, then Mtn. Roots Revival will consider your bowl paid in full, as well, and will offer you a second bowl for $100, with an additional set of films at no cost, too. Must be at least 18 years of age and a resident of the United States to participate. Void where prohibited by law. Read about Indiegogo's referral tracking here:  https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...?

1st ~ $69 PERK: AFFORDABLE, BUDGET-FRIENDLY WAY TO GET YOUR BOWL CARVED: After this perk is redeemed, the balance of the down payment on the bowl can be paid over time, throughout 2016, at a flexible rate you choose! Read below for balance/details. THIS PERK ALSO INCLUDES ONE SET OF FILMS (2 DVDs): ~
How the $69 Bowl Certificate will Work:  The certificate will act as a "discount voucher" of sorts...entitling the holder to a 25% discount on the purchase of the bowl, once it's complete. The discount will be applied to the price of the bowl, which is $275. If you give this certificate as a gift this Christmas, when the recipient redeems it (by emailing us that he/she would like to begin making contributions to complete the bowl down payment) – the bowl will have been formally commissioned. IMPORTANT: With this perk certificate, the holder is eligible to contribute toward the full, bowl down payment throughout 2016, at a frequency and amount preferred (i.e. $25 set each month, likely through automatic PayPal® debit, or flexible...$10 one month, $30 another, skip a month...however preferred). With THIS bowl certificate, the bowl will be added to our "to-carve" list once 75% of the bowl's total cost has been paid. We'll ship the bowl once it's been carved/completed, if 100% + shipping has been paid. Bowl price: $275...minus the 25% discount covered by the perk certificate...so $206.25 to be paid over course of 2016, at rate preferred but prior to shipping. Shipping costs are separate and determined by shipping location. 



2nd ~ $92 PERK: AFFORDABLE, BUDGET-FRIENDLY WAY TO GET YOUR BOWL CARVED: After this perk is redeemed, the balance of the down payment on the bowl can be paid over time, throughout 2016, at a flexible rate you choose! Read, below, for balance/details. THIS PERK ALSO INCLUDES ONE SET OF FILMS (2 DVDs): ~


How the $92 Bowl Certificate will Work:  The certificate will act as a "discount voucher" of sorts...entitling the holder to a 33.33% discount on the purchase of the bowl, once it's complete. The discount will be applied to the price of the bowl, which is $275. If you give this certificate as a gift this Christmas, when the recipient redeems it (by emailing us that he/she would like to begin making contributions to complete the bowl down payment) – the bowl will have been formally commissioned. IMPORTANT: With this perk certificate, the holder is eligible to contribute toward the full, bowl down payment throughout 2016, at a frequency and amount preferred (i.e. $25 set each month, likely through automatic PayPal® debit, or flexible...$10 one month, $30 another, skip a month...however preferred). With THIS bowl certificate, the bowl will be added to our "to-carve" list once 75% of the bowl's total cost has been paid. We'll ship the bowl once it's been carved/completed, if 100% + shipping has been paid. Bowl price: $275...minus the 33.33% discount covered by the perk certificate...so $183.31 to be paid over course of 2016, at rate preferred but prior to shipping. Shipping costs are separate and determined by shipping location. 

Note: The $95 "perk" in the right-hand column cannot be deleted, per Indiegogo rules, as it has been selected by a contributor. However, the new $92 "perk" reflects the reduced price of the bowl at purchase and the increased discount percentage (from 25% to 33.33%). If you inadvertently choose the $95 bowl perk, know that the reduced bowl price will be honored for it, as well, as will the increased discount percentage (from 25% to 33.33%). So, no need to stress or worry! :) 


3rd: ~ $185 PERK: THIS PERK INCLUDES TWO SETS OF FILMS (4 DVDs) AND SWEET-TREAT CLUB TOO:  If you choose the $185 wood bowl certificate as your perk, know that it will also come with two full sets of both of Mama's films (so four DVDs). Plus, it will include a one-month membership in the "Mtn. Roots Revival Sweet-Treat-of-the-Month-Club".  Included perks will be shipped, separately, as completed. Shipping costs for bowls and treats are separate. The price of the bowl, itself, at purchase (to which the discount certificate is applied) – that price has been reduced from the $370 cited in the "perk" box for this certificate to $275. We cannot edit the bowl price cited in the $185 perk certificate box, per Indiegogo rules, as the perk has been selected by a contributor. However, if you choose this perk, know that the final cost of the bowl, itself, will be less than the price cited in the box. Read, below, for balance/details.


How the $185 Certificate will Work: The certificate will act as a "discount voucher" of sorts...entitling the holder to a 50% discount on the purchase of the bowl, once it's complete. Remember, this certificate comes with two sets of both films (four DVDs) and one month in our sweet treat club, too.  If you give this certificate as a gift this Christmas, when the recipient redeems it (by emailing us that he/she would like to begin stage I of the bowl's production) – the bowl will have been formally commissioned. Your bowl will be added to the "to-carve" list, and carving will begin in January, 2016. At the time of redemption/commissioning, no additional payment will be required. Once the bowl has been completed, we'll notify the holder, who will have 30 days to complete the purchase (by paying the cost of the bowl, set at $275...minus the 50% discount guaranteed by the perk certificate...so $137.50 for the account balance). Shipping separate and determined by shipping location. 
We'll then sign the bowl with the recipient's name...date, number and ship it. If the holder needs additional time to purchase, we'll notify the next commissioning customer and move the first party's name farther back on the list...making stage II of the purchase more budget convenient. Terms and conditions will apply. How long will it take for your bowl to be completed? It's difficult to say...depends upon the number who would like a bowl. Each will be handmade...no factories for sure! Each will be different and unique, too...wood markings will vary, as will other aspects of the bowls.  It could take up to a year to complete all orders, depending upon the number...possibly somewhat longer? We just can't say for sure. We can say, though, that we believe it will be a gift you will cherish for years...all made from hard woods...likely Maple, like the bowl in this photograph...all made right here in America! 


Perk: Certificates Toward an Appalachian-Stitched, Patchwork Bears...Made Especially for You or Your Loved One from Baby Clothes, Blankets, Grandpa's Jeans & Shirts...or Other Clothing Sentimental to You. We Can Provide Fabric Too. We Hope You'll Wrap Up a Certificate as a Christmas or Other Gift This Year! :)






Your "Mtn. Roots Revival Patchwork Bear" will be modeled after this bear, which my Granny Gilreath made for me...and other grandchildren, too. We'll make your bear from a special fabric...one we'll create from small blocks of fabrics sentimental to you, which you'll send to us. We'll be stitching your squares together to create a cherished, decorative family heirloom...one perfect to adorn a nursery, out of reach of a child...one ideal to adorn an adult's room, too. Our bears will NOT be child-safe bears for play, y'all; so, please do keep them out of reach of children! We can provide fabrics if you choose, too! :) You can put a pair of overalls on your bear, if you like. Whether you outfit your bear or not, we know you'll treasure it for years to come, as we have always treasured ours. Over time, we hope to put lots of Appalachians to work, stitching bears in their mountain-area homes. 

INCLUDES FILMS and SWEET TREAT TOO:  If you choose the bear certificate perk, know that it will also come with two full sets of both of Mama's films (so four DVDs). Plus, it will include a one-month membership in the "Mtn. Roots Revival Sweet Treat of the Month Club".  Included perks will be shipped, separately, as completed. Shipping costs for bears and treats are separate.

Patchwork Bears are a Two-Stage Process: 
How the Certificate Will Work: The certificate will act as a "discount voucher" of sorts...entitling the holder to a 50% discount on the purchase of the bear, once it's completed. If you give this certificate as a gift this Christmas, when the recipient redeems it (by emailing us that he/she would like to begin stage I of the bear's production) – then, the bear will have formally been commissioned. Your bear will be added to the "to-stitch" list, and we'll start piecing bears by February, 2016.  At the time of redemption/commissioning, no additional payment will be required. Once the bear has been completed, we'll notify the holder, who will have 30 days to complete the purchase (by paying the cost of the bear, set at $195...minus the 50% discount guaranteed by the perk certificate...so $97.50 for the account balance). Shipping is separate and determined by shipping location. 

Online Magazine Content Submissions: 
Once funded, we will obtain legal advice to develop submission guidelines. If you are interested in submitting content for our online, video-based magazine, email us at this address and write "Submission Info" in the subject line: MountainRootsRevival.News@gmail.com. If you would like to suggest a video-based feature of someone in your area, who practices the old-ways, way of life, email us and tell us about the individual...even if this individual does not reside in the Southeast. We hope to feature folks throughout the United States. 

* "Referral Rewards" – Get Your Bowl for $100!

* Referral Rewards: Get Your Bowl for $100 Total! This program will reward you for others' contributions to our campaign – IF those contributions are generated, directly, via your Indiegogo-tracked referral links. IMPORTANT: In order for contributions generated by your referrals to be tracked by Indiegogo and to count toward this referral reward program, you MUST be logged in to YOUR Indiegogo account and you MUST be using Indiegogo's social media tools to share our campaign with others. Indiegogo's social media tools are located to the left of our campaign film, up top. You will have created an Indiegogo account during the process of making your own contribution to the campaign. If you are logged in to your account, and if you use Indiegogo's tools to share this campaign with friends through Twitter®, Facebook®, email, links, etc., then both you and Mtn. Roots Revival will be able to access Indiegogo's tracking screen and determine the dollar amount of contributions generated through your referrals links. If your Indiegogo tracked referrals motivate $1,000 in contributions for our perks...our bowl certificates, bear certificates, DVDs, etc., then your total bowl purchase price will be reduced to $100. If your Indiegogo-tracked referral contributions to our campaign reach the $1,000 threshold – and you had previously selected the $92 or $95 bowl certificate – which also comes with films, then your bowl will be considered paid in full. We'll even cover your shipping within the continental U.S. If you had selected the $69 bowl certificate and your Indiegogo-tracked referral contributions reach this threshold, your remaining bowl balance will be reduced to $31, plus shipping. If you had previously selected the 50% bowl certificate at $185, and your Indiegogo-tracked referral contributions meet this threshold, then Mtn. Roots Revival will consider your bowl paid in full, as well, and will offer you a second bowl for $100, with an additional set of films at no cost, too. Must be at least 18 years of age and a resident of the United States to participate. Void where prohibited by law. Read about Indiegogo's referral tracking here:  https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...?

story:
Our Story

We got tired of looking for the "X" button to skip ads. We have found a better system that is more palatable to both customers and vendors. This system is optimized for apps, small businesses, vendors, and social crowdfunding campaigns.  Quick and easy commercials ideal for mobile platforms.  Get the word out and assist in bringing us to market so we can in turn be an asset to your business.

For anyone who has a small business, Indiegogo, Kickstarter, or startup we can be an optimal place to advertise your business or project. 
Contributions to our campaign are actually a purchase of future services, so consider it a down payment on future marketing when we go full scale which development should start soon as that portion is already funded!  For apps we are another revenue stream that pays out at reasonable rates which is rare in mobile advertising.


The Mobile Advertising Video System (MAD VidS) plays application embedded short videos which are pre-cached and API mesh networked from within all participating applications on a mobile device. MAD VidS is different from traditional marketing technologies as we focus both on the human factors and technology required to create the best marketing experience for vendors and consumers alike. Recent backlash against consumer profiling has rocked marketing campaigns back on their heels. MADVidS does not target based on individuals, but correlates application demographics to provide relevant, genre-specific content in the right way. Our service downloads and manages native content on mobile devices so that content can be played instantly with no loading time. This also allows us to both guarantee and regulate content exposure to keep content fresh.

Get the right message, to the right consumer, at the right time. 



Co-founder Ben Henderson Story of MAD VidS



www.RDEverywhere.com/madvids


Our Goal

Our goal is to raise money to get from our prototype development to a fully developed architecture to take to market. UPDATE: The development is getting privately funded so contributions for marketing services!  This system will revamp the mobile ad market to be more accomodating to users and vendors alike. This is about making advertising more palatable to us all and providing apps with a revenue stream that actually makes developers money with the appropriate turnover that vendors desire.


Why contribute to us?

If you are an app owner, developer, IoT developer, Kickstarter, Indiegogo project, or a company that wants to advertise on mobile devices then we are a service you will benefit from. We offer a better venue that will not drive consumers to away. When consumers backlashed against being tracked we changed to app demographics, when asked for less intrusive, we did loading time display, with backlash against popups we do quick videos, and when asked for assured views we did 3-6 second ads so skipping was not an option.


Our Product: Mobile advertising videos (MAD VidS)
Short commercials that play while apps are loading, and during other periods of loading/syncing. Below is the over simplied diagram, with meta data tracking and demographics on the back end processes in order to not burden the mobile or IOT device processing. 

MAD Vids enables the display of video, or any data-intensive content, onto any mobile device instantly. We specialize in “Picomercials,” short (3-6 second) videos that can be any size. They can be displayed as a full screen or partial screen advertisement over loading screens or at any point in the user experience with no lag time. This is done by implementing the MAD Vids API with a staging area on the local device that synchronizes with a central web server and associated database. Host devices can be anything from computers, mobile devices such as phones and tablets, to emerging internet of things (IOT)-enabled devices. 


Where MAD VidS Fits in the Market

Current mobile advertising and marketing are mostly pop ups, streaming video ads, RTB processes, and programatic viewing. These are not nearly what customers are used to which are TV commercials. Mobile video is the next TV commercial or mobile "picomercial". These do not have to be streamed and are short enough to not have viewers scrambling for the skip or "X" button. 

The market is screaming for mobile ads to be done right.




MAD VidS is not going to replace the market, but can be integrated into almost every part of the market.




Our Niche

The MAD Vids niche combines the best marketing and ad tech into one full end-to-end solution. MAD Vids fuses the desired consumer interest of short video of Vine size/length for marketing and the best solution for ad tech of implanting the commercials into an in application. We do this through a pre-cached application mesh network that can be implemented on mobile devices while being synced with a robust backend database that pairs vendor content with application demographics to display the right content to the right consumer at the right time. 

What we are offering the world (besides better, more palatable commercials)


- Niche - 3-6 sec ads - more venue and repeatability options (more places that an ad can be placed)

- This is about creating a new genre of marketing through mobile ads that are less intrusive to user 

- Guaranteed 5 views per sync instead of 1 constant or rotating - persistence of marketing for each ad

- Better more in-depth impression per customer, but not overwhelming 

- Less bandwidth for swap out as less rotation

- Mesh network allows for less swap as multiple applying apps allows for more views per customers in multiple venues

- Application-based demographics or device profiling (as opposed to consumer profiling)

- Guaranteed views (unable and no need to skip due to short length)

- 3-5 ads cached with the install of the service. Allows for the mesh network function so ads behind one app can be played from another

- Increasing variety and seamless integration

Sample Custom Picomercials





Risks and challenges

Our most difficult test will be winning the first sales and the challenges that come with commercial integration with a diaspora of applications and advertising content. The gifts offered here allow us to build from an initial base platform. 


We have completed a prototype and will need to round out the final stages of development to make this product commercial ready. Full development is being funded so contributions are for services and architecture support. 


We are looking to integrate into larger corporate structures and supplement current advertising mediums -- not supplant them. 


We have a small team consisting of a software developer, two program management subject matter experts, and a sales/marketing coordinator. MADVids has also engaged with external software developers to help round out the team and complete the product.


Limited Resources Assistance to MAD Vids:
If you like the idea but cannot assist financially, please feel free to share our IndieGoGo link on social media.


http://igg.me/at/madvids

story:
A Growing Culture (AGC) is a global coalition that connects farmers to each other and to the resources they need to create an ecologically sound food system and prosperous planet. We are building the world’s first digital, open-access platform powered by farmers, for farmers. The Library for Food Sovereignty will make it possible for farmers to connect directly with each other for the first time, to compare ideas and approaches, and to join together to build a global food system that works for everyone without harming our planet.

We’ve already raised 2/3 of the money we need to create the Library; reaching our crowdfunding goal will enable us to finalize and perfect the basic model. We need your help to get there. Any donations above our goal will go towards the creation of more advanced functions.

Who We Are

You’ve seen the pictures: Animals confined in cages; vast swaths of land planted with a single crop; chemical fertilizers streaming from airplanes. That’s our modern agriculture system. It’s not pretty, and it’s not healthy--for people or for the planet. The good news is, all around the world, small farmers are coming up with innovative, sustainable ways to fight these corporate practices and feed the world. But they can’t do this important work alone.

AGC was founded in 2010 to reframe the narrative of the role agrarians play across the globe. On a quest for the innovations that have allowed societies to feed themselves without the use of harmful chemicals for countless generations, AGC has visited and worked with 3,000 farms all over the world, including in the Himalaya, the Mekong Delta, and the Great Rift Valley. From a Thai monk  who concocted an insect repellent using plants that are naturally resistant to pests to a Kenyan woman who can determine the sex of an egg by measuring the shape of its curve, these farmers are changing the face of modern agriculture one crop at a time.

With direct input from farmers and farmer-led groups around the world, we are creating a farmer-friendly, Internet-based platform that can host these innovations so farmers can share and learn from each other. AGC is learning how farmers choose to share their innovations, how they choose to access the innovations of others regardless of language barriers, and how, even with limited bandwidth, they will choose to rely upon their local farmer-led organizations to stay current.

The Library for Food Sovereignty: A Closer Look


The global food system is at a tipping point: change nothing and face increasing soil and water pollution, corporate control, deteriorating democracy, and climate change; or transform the current system and start to improve soil and water quality, reverse climate change, increase biodiversity, improve the relationship between humans and nature, promote gender equality, and so much more. We can no longer afford to waste time with false solutions. We must expand on what works: farmer-led ecological agriculture.

The Library for Food Sovereignty (LFS) is the first platform in the world dedicated to connecting farmers to catalyze ecological agricultural innovation. By supporting farmers and farmer groups to share their innovations in an accessible, multimedia, “living” database with advanced translation capabilities, the Library will enable farmers to learn from each other’s successes and failures. The resulting unprecedented free exchange of information will not only increase the reach of each farmer’s innovations, it will also cultivate new ones.  

To ensure that the Library infrastructure is fully responsive to farmers, it will be co-designed with their help. Our many farmer-led organizational partners--locally, regionally, and globally--are already positioned to be the critical conduit for those farmers who do not have access to the Internet.  These partners and collaborators will also enable us to ensure that farmer innovations captured online will be accessible and new field innovations can find their way into the Library. Indeed, online and on-the-ground knowledge will be mutually reinforcing.   

After spending years meeting with and listening to farmers, learning about their farming practices, their innovations, and their views on how others can best support them, A Growing Culture is now ready to build the tool they need. 

Key Partners

        

      

Connecting Farmers, Cultivating Innovation - Three examples

In Vietnam, Nhu Trang Pham developed techniques to ferment locally-available absorbent materials such as wood chips, bamboo dust, and straw to use as bedding for hog production. She inoculates the bedding with indigenous microorganisms and lactobacillus, making it active and alive, in turn making it able to break down hog waste--enormously beneficial to the health of both the hogs and the planet. 

Thousands of miles away, an Indian couple purchased an abandoned pebble mine to farm, requiring them to build their own soil using only on-site resources. They filled the beds with wood chips, charcoal, and silt from seasonal ponds, which they then inoculated with microorganisms. Next they began turning a carefully selected mixture of crops back into the soil before they fully matured. This process created enough soil to begin planting vegetables within the first year. 

These two examples are using similar techniques of microorganism inoculation for two totally different purposes. What if farmers could discover these techniques for free--without ever having to leave their farm--and re-purpose them to suit their farm's needs?

Our prototype library, Notes from the Field, has demonstrated that this kind of tangible change is possible. Dan Kiprop Kibet, a Kenyan farmer, is the perfect example. He adapted a fertilization technique that uses raw milk developed by  North Carolina farmer Worth Kimmel and was able to increase his crop yields and strengthened the quality of his land. But our prototype lacks the functionality needed to realize its full transformative potential. For this, we need your support. Your donation will help ensure the success of the Library for Food Sovereignty and, most importantly, the success of farmers around the world.

What They're Saying 


How You Can Help

We are all impacted by a broken food system. We eat 3 meals a day, 21 meals a week, 1092 meals a year. That averages out to over 81,000 meals in our lifetimes. It's time to change the way we farm and inspire a new culture of growers. Donate today and be part of the change.

Every contribution, no matter how big or small, will help create a stronger and better-connected community of sustainable farmers. Donations will help us partner not only with the farmers of the world, but also with like-minded software engineers to create a platform that can address the diverse needs of the world’s farmers. Donations toward our main goal will ensure that the Library has a strong foundation--a database and a resource portal--and other elements necessary for its core functionality, including capabilities for multimedia entries, translation, searching and categorization, and crowdsourcing content creation.

A Breakdown of the Costs of Building The Library:


Donations beyond our main goal will create a platform with advanced features that make it easier for a wider variety of farmers to access, easier for farmers to collectively govern, and easier for partners to build off of. This much needed support will also go towards cameras and audio-visual equipment to enable better farmer documentation.

Additionally, you can help by:

  • Directing others to our Indiegogo page and sharing the campaign on your personal social media accounts.

  • Spreading AGC’s message. Follow us on Facebook (A Growing Culture), Twitter (@agcconnect), and Instagram (@agrowingculture).

  • Donating your unwanted cameras and audio-visual equipment. To learn how and where to donate, contact communications@agrowingculture.org.

Contributor Perks 

Our Team

Meet our team! We are scientists, librarians, nutritionists, IT professionals, teachers, writers, designers, environmentalists, and (of course) farmers.

Who We AreYou’ve seen the pictures: Animals confined in cages; vast swaths of land planted with a single crop; chemical fertilizers streaming from airplanes. That’s our modern agriculture system. It’s not pretty, and it’s not healthy--for people or for the planet. The good news is, all around the world, small farmers are coming up with innovative, sustainable ways to fight these corporate practices and feed the world. But they can’t do this important work alone.AGC was founded in 2010 to reframe the narrative of the role agrarians play across the globe. On a quest for the innovations that have allowed societies to feed themselves without the use of harmful chemicals for countless generations, AGC has visited and worked with 3,000 farms all over the world, including in the Himalaya, the Mekong Delta, and the Great Rift Valley. From a Thai monk  who concocted an insect repellent using plants that are naturally resistant to pests to a Kenyan woman who can determine the sex of an egg by measuring the shape of its curve, these farmers are changing the face of modern agriculture one crop at a time.With direct input from farmers and farmer-led groups around the world, we are creating a farmer-friendly, Internet-based platform that can host these innovations so farmers can share and learn from each other. AGC is learning how farmers choose to share their innovations, how they choose to access the innovations of others regardless of language barriers, and how, even with limited bandwidth, they will choose to rely upon their local farmer-led organizations to stay current.The Library for Food Sovereignty: A Closer LookThe global food system is at a tipping point: change nothing and face increasing soil and water pollution, corporate control, deteriorating democracy, and climate change; or transform the current system and start to improve soil and water quality, reverse climate change, increase biodiversity, improve the relationship between humans and nature, promote gender equality, and so much more. We can no longer afford to waste time with false solutions. We must expand on what works: farmer-led ecological agriculture.The Library for Food Sovereignty (LFS) is the first platform in the world dedicated to connecting farmers to catalyze ecological agricultural innovation. By supporting farmers and farmer groups to share their innovations in an accessible, multimedia, “living” database with advanced translation capabilities, the Library will enable farmers to learn from each other’s successes and failures. The resulting unprecedented free exchange of information will not only increase the reach of each farmer’s innovations, it will also cultivate new ones.  To ensure that the Library infrastructure is fully responsive to farmers, it will be co-designed with their help. Our many farmer-led organizational partners--locally, regionally, and globally--are already positioned to be the critical conduit for those farmers who do not have access to the Internet.  These partners and collaborators will also enable us to ensure that farmer innovations captured online will be accessible and new field innovations can find their way into the Library. Indeed, online and on-the-ground knowledge will be mutually reinforcing.   After spending years meeting with and listening to farmers, learning about their farming practices, their innovations, and their views on how others can best support them, A Growing Culture is now ready to build the tool they need. Key Partners
        
      
Connecting Farmers, Cultivating Innovation - Three examplesIn Vietnam, Nhu Trang Pham developed techniques to ferment locally-available absorbent materials such as wood chips, bamboo dust, and straw to use as bedding for hog production. She inoculates the bedding with indigenous microorganisms and lactobacillus, making it active and alive, in turn making it able to break down hog waste--enormously beneficial to the health of both the hogs and the planet. Thousands of miles away, an Indian couple purchased an abandoned pebble mine to farm, requiring them to build their own soil using only on-site resources. They filled the beds with wood chips, charcoal, and silt from seasonal ponds, which they then inoculated with microorganisms. Next they began turning a carefully selected mixture of crops back into the soil before they fully matured. This process created enough soil to begin planting vegetables within the first year. These two examples are using similar techniques of microorganism inoculation for two totally different purposes. What if farmers could discover these techniques for free--without ever having to leave their farm--and re-purpose them to suit their farm's needs?Our prototype library, Notes from the Field, has demonstrated that this kind of tangible change is possible. Dan Kiprop Kibet, a Kenyan farmer, is the perfect example. He adapted a fertilization technique that uses raw milk developed by  North Carolina farmer Worth Kimmel and was able to increase his crop yields and strengthened the quality of his land. But our prototype lacks the functionality needed to realize its full transformative potential. For this, we need your support. Your donation will help ensure the success of the Library for Food Sovereignty and, most importantly, the success of farmers around the world.
What They're Saying 

How You Can Help

We are all impacted by a broken food system. We eat 3 meals a day, 21 meals a week, 1092 meals a year. That averages out to over 81,000 meals in our lifetimes. It's time to change the way we farm and inspire a new culture of growers. Donate today and be part of the change.
Every contribution, no matter how big or small, will help create a stronger and better-connected community of sustainable farmers. Donations will help us partner not only with the farmers of the world, but also with like-minded software engineers to create a platform that can address the diverse needs of the world’s farmers. Donations toward our main goal will ensure that the Library has a strong foundation--a database and a resource portal--and other elements necessary for its core functionality, including capabilities for multimedia entries, translation, searching and categorization, and crowdsourcing content creation.
A Breakdown of the Costs of Building The Library:


Donations beyond our main goal will create a platform with advanced features that make it easier for a wider variety of farmers to access, easier for farmers to collectively govern, and easier for partners to build off of. This much needed support will also go towards cameras and audio-visual equipment to enable better farmer documentation.
Additionally, you can help by:

Directing others to our Indiegogo page and sharing the campaign on your personal social media accounts.
Spreading AGC’s message. Follow us on Facebook (A Growing Culture), Twitter (@agcconnect), and Instagram (@agrowingculture).
Donating your unwanted cameras and audio-visual equipment. To learn how and where to donate, contact communications@agrowingculture.org.




Contributor Perks 













Our Team
Meet our team! We are scientists, librarians, nutritionists, IT professionals, teachers, writers, designers, environmentalists, and (of course) farmers.

story:
Our Story

Battle Zone NERF was built on the love of NERF and first-person shooter video games. What better way to enjoy what you love than to start-up a business where kids, and adults alike can have exhilarating, pain-free fun in an arena made for NERF battles. We started as a mobile event service, travelling to customers' houses and community parks to set up the arena and let the kids and party guests have a BLAST! We are now ready to move into a permanent location in Lakewood inside the old Slammer's baseball location and we need the support of the NERF community!!!!

The Impact

Our young generation has become one where the kids value their cell phones and tablets more than their bicycles and baseballs; they enjoy the avatars in their video games over their friend down the block. And the one thing that can put that all together and actually get them up, out with their friends, and moving full speed in a healthy yet fun way-is a NERF WAR!

Battle Zone NERF provides the place for families to come and let it all out on the battle field. No more worries of the pain and mess of paintball or airsoft, and no more worries about getting the kids active. They enjoy coming to Battle Zone NERF and spending time doing what they love doing the most-being a crazy kid! And this is all the same for the stressed out adult-you can come in and let out all that workplace tension in a place where it's not only okay to shout and jump about, but it's also necessary to stay "alive".

There are not many businesses like this in the United States, in Colorado, in Denver, and definitely not in your neighborhood. You can have an impact by getting this location up and running and starting a new craze in the family entertainment and as an early adopter you will be greatly rewarded. Our success will surely result in many more NERF arenas popping up around the country and around the world. And we welcome the competition because the love of NERF and physical activity is all that matters to us in the end!


What We Need & What You Get

Battle Zone NERF has cost a considerable amount to get up and running. We need to cover building renovation costs, furnishing, additional equipment purchases, and finishing touches on the 9,000 square foot arena near Wadsworth and Jewell in Lakewood, CO. We need your support to reach our mark and get this exciting business off the ground by pre-purchasing admission tickets and booking your parties now.

As an amazing supporter we will offer you perks that will suit any Jr. NERFer, wonderful Mother dearest, World's Coolest Dad, or the best Nana Ever!!!! 


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is not being able to market well enough to reach the public. NERF battle centers are very uncommon and we understand that most people don't even know they  exist. This business has a novelty which will need to be exposed and high awareness will need to raised to get the people interested enough to stop in. We are confident that once they play the first time-they'll be hooked for life. Our business plan for expanding into this store front location allocates funds for a sufficient marketing budget. This will be the primary challenge and focus of our start-up strategy.

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest way you can help is by spreading the word. As we said, "The love of NERF is all that matters in the end!" We need you to share the idea and let your soccer mom friend know there a new place she can take the kids for fun; let the football coach know there is a new place they can have the football banquet this year; let the youth pastor know we can take the group for an awesome NERF war on Wednesday nights; let you neighbors know they can take their kids to Battle Zone NERF (and hopefully no more NERF darts will fly over the fence into their yard); bring your kids, bring your kids' friends, bring your kid's friend's cousin from out of town; share the word at your next PTA meeting; tell your mom over your next Saturday morning cup of coffee. Basically help us get the Battle Zone NERF business out there in the wild, and we'll take care of the rest. And if you've read this far...Thank you! Because we know you're a true NERFer at heart!

story:
First Night Funds are Stuck in Springfield!

The State of Illinois has been without a budget since July and is unlikely to have one soon. This means that funding for arts organizations such as First Night Evanston is either on hold or may be withdrawn completely. Although ticket sales cover most of our costs after the event is done, a large chunk of our regular funding from state sources such as the Illinois Arts Council and others goes toward advance planning.  Without these crucial funds, we can neither reserve the talent and venues nor market and promote this event.

Without making up the funding deficit we won't be able to make this event happen. We need your help.

If you've ever enjoyed First Night, or even if you just like the idea, please consider making a donation. We've got some nifty ways to show our gratitude for your support to keep this great community celebration alive.

We've got some outstanding perks for you as a way of saying thanks!

In addition to the warm fuzzy feeling you'll get immediately from helping make this beloved event possible, you can also reward yourself with some unique thank-you gifts, including the opportunity to have not one but two Grammy-award winning artists perform in your home!

We've got lots of other ways to say thanks, too:
  • T-shirts, hoodies, mugs, and other stuff featuring the Owls of First NIght
  • Art prints of the famous First NIght Owls, suitable for framing
  • First Night Owl coffee mugs
  • Cozy and sweet plush owls, perfect for smaller First Night fans
  • Season tickets to Bluegrass concerts at the Evanston American Legion Hall
  • Dinner with friends at some of Evanston's favorite restaurants

But the main thing you'll get at any level of participation will be the deep satisfaction that comes from being a part of a unique community celebration.
Simply said, we need your help. We can't do it without your participation- please lend us a hand!
