interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral
program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!
If you have thoughts or would like to discuss
a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel
free to contact us at info@caddystopper.com

story:
Short Summary

 Omari is 35 years and lives in the village of Mida in Kilifi County, Kenya. He is a happy user of Marathoner Beacon Solar lamps. He has used a kerosene lamp to light up his home for as long as he can remember. Now a father of four children, Omar first heard about the Marathoner Beacon solar lamps in October 2014 when his wife returned from a community meeting where someone had come to educate women on income generating activities they can engage in. When Omari heard the news, he first thought of how he needed the lamp to provide adequate lighting for his children as they did their homework in the evening. Omari later caled the  lady who came to educate the women wanting to learn more about the solar lamps. After seeing the features of the lamp, and getting additional information from someone he knew, he bought it.  Since then, his children no longer use the dim kerosene lamps that used to affect their eyes and produced fumes that hurt their lungs.   For Omari he no longer requires the services of a mobile phone charging agent at the market.  He is even using the lamp to light up his chicken house.

. 

His family’s life has changed ;  he no longer has to buy kerosene for his children so they can read after school and they now have longer evenings with his family. And he has enough light for his hen house to light overnight.’


As the CEO and Co-Founder of Skynotch Energy Africa, Patrick Kimathi  is happy to have brought transformational change to Omari’s home. This is his passion and would like to light-up at least 6000 homes in Kenya in the next two years.  Being a committed proponent of clean lighting solutions for off-grid indoor lighting, Patrick envisions a Africa where everyone has a day that goes beyond the fall of darkness. My goal is to create a solar generation in Kenya over the next 5 years.


For the last one-and-a-half years Skynotch Energy Africa in partnership with the Kenya Climate Innovation Center, Kiva Zip, The Youth Banner and Kenya Girl Guide Association, has been able to successfully demonstrate that a sustainable distribution network is feasible.  We have four distribution outlets today with 12 agents, who are financed through the Kiva interest free loans.  3 Girl Guide clubs are already educating their communities on switching to clean lighting.  We need to increase the number of distribution outlets to 8 and train 5 more Girl Guide clubs on how to spread the clean lighting message.

The Solar Generation Ambassadors ( The Kenya Girl Guides)

Kenya Climate Innovation Centre, a World Bank- InfoDev initiative and Crowdfunding Capital Advisors (The CCA group) believed in our vision and supported the preparation of this campaign. Your Support will enable more households to access the clean lighting technology.


This Technology can change Lives 

  We need your support to raise $ 50,000 to increase the distribution network and set up 3 distribution centres.

The Money raised will be used to:-

·  $25,000: Buy more solar lamps 

·  $10,000: For training entrepreneurs and recruiting Girl Guide clubs

·  $7,500: To develop information and education materials

.  $7,500: For administration 

The Impact

Contributing to this project means creating equal opportunities for children who read with poor lighting, so that they can compete with their peers in areas with electricity. At Skynotch Energy Africa, we believe that in the 21st Century no one should be using outdated lighting technology. This is your opportunity to bring change to many others like Omari in Kenya. The United Nations has declared 2015 the International Year of Light (IYL 2015) which will be launched on 19-20 January in Paris. By making a contribution to this campaign, you are contributing to IYL 2015 and enhancing sustainable energy access for all.  

Clean lighting means saving household money used to buy kerosene, brighter light, improved livelihoods because indoor pollution is eliminated and a cleaner environment as carbon dioxide emissions are reduced. This is your contribution towards mitigating the negative effects of climate change! We all will reduce the CO2 emission and here is your chance to be part of Climate Change Mitigation. 


  

Your Contribution will Change this 

Life can be better and brighter with your support

Rewards 

As you join us to change lives we recognize your efforts and contribution. and have various reward for our supporters. 

Risks & Challenges

We have demonstrated that the model of distribution can increase the number of solar lanterns users.We need to scale up to reach more people and recruit more Girl Guides clubs.  With the growing number of customers and the Girl Guides interested with the Clean energy clubs, we need more funds. 
Other Ways You Can Support 

You can promote the campaign to your family, partners and friends by telling them about it, sharing campaign materials and social media activity. This will go a long way to ensure more lives are touched !!!

Find This Campaign On

Facebook Twitter YouTube Website

 

Help Make it Happen  

to Light up Kenya

story:
Our story

We are a bunch of entrepreneurs who are passionate about technology and photography.
Our story dates back a couple of years ago, when our CEO, Ernesto, went on a trip to Cusco with some friends. The trip was great and when back at home, Ernesto wanted to organize his pictures together with those of his friends to create a super album of the trip. However, contacting his friends and getting all the pictures everyone has taken to group them and organize them was really complicated and took very long time. He, then, looked for some software to simplify the process but never found any so he had to do it manually. The fact that he realized this was a problem millions of people faced ended up in the birth of the idea of Socialpicz.
This is SocialPicz, a way to preserve, organize and share automatically our most important moments through a collective creation process. We won't need to create albums mannually any more. Through this innovation, we just have to take the pictures since the App organizes everything for us in terms of events (parties, birthdays, concerts, trips, conferences, and every single kind of event).
We started this adventure last year and in order to finally make it happen and launch this global solution which will benefit millions of people in the world, we need your support.
Why is your support so important?
We need USD 25,000 to cover the development costs and advertising for the launching of the app. Competing in this IT market is vital for us and the funds we get will be used intellingently for this purpose. Additionally, this will allow us to reach more countries and develop new versions for you all.

We are thankful!

We have come up with a set of perks for you. First of all, a moral reward: Thanking you for trusting us. Secondly, financial rewards to be used with the app. Thirdly, a cutting-edge IT device. Finally, a relaxing trip to Peru (2 round-trip tickets)
We know the challenge is relevant but we also believe the IT aspect we have done is really important. We have a very solid, reliable and capable team to meet our objective.
Some other ways to give us a hand

i) Spread the word about our campaign through our social networks.

ii) Be part of our group of beta testers or early adopters.

iii) Join our Ambassadors team, who will continue spreading the word about our proposal in their countries. Email us: ambassadors@socialpicz.com

For more information go to the Gallery.

story:
Hi my name is Joe and I have been working in the floor cleaning industry for over 30 years. In those years I have been introduced to just about every stain you can imagine. 

"I believe in deep cleaning with my Miracle Magic Cleaner and a good vacuuming and not steaming. "


Competition:

Other companies and processes like to use hot water with chemicals then extract the excess water. 

We all know it stays wet for hours and even days. In my years I have created and formulated Miracle Magic Cleaner.



Miracle Magic Cleaner = No chemicals:

Miracle Magic Cleaner is water based, non-toxic, non-hazardous and non-flammable.  We have not added any solvents of any kind and no unpleasant chemicals.  The Miracle Magic Cleaner solution is also Chlorofluorocarbon (CFC) and Petroleum free.  


Most importantly our Miracle Magic Cleaner is safe for children and pets and will not attract dirt back to the cleaned area.


Results:

Miracle Magic Cleaner is a multi cleaning solution.  Used for residential or commercial purposes.  Miracle Magic Cleaner can be used to clean carpets, oriental rugs, all types of fabrics, upholstery, apparel, shoes, furniture, car upholstery, pet stains, pet urine and much more.


Miracle Magic Cleaner is developed to remove most every type of cleaning situation you may encounter or just about every surface type.  

Bottom line Miracle Magic Cleaner is an amazing cleaning product that truly works!!


Checkout some real results. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $25,000 to help bring Miracle Magic Cleaner to market. We have worked hard on getting the solution just right, making it safe, working on the packaging and patents. We are passionate in cleaning spots, saving stained rugs and apparel and most importantly doing it right and keeping children and pets safe. There is nothing harmful in our solution and we want everyone who has a stain remove it safely.

We want to spread the news and here is how we are going to do it.

$1.00 will get you a thank you and shout out on our social media pages, it’s not much but for us it means so much.

$7.00 will get you 2-ounce bottle of solution which can is more than enough to clean up stubborn spots. This comes to $3.50 per ounce.

$15.00 will get you 6 ounces bottle of Miracle Magic Cleaner and keep your surroundings looking brand new. This comes to $2.50 per ounce.

$20.00 will get you 10 ounces bottle of Miracle Magic Cleaner and let the housekeeper take some days off. This comes to $2.00 per ounce.

$25 will get you 24oz bottle. Wow you will never see spots again in your rugs, apparel, cloth seats in your car and so much more. This is the best deal per pledge, it comes to $1.04 per ounce.


All our pledges include shipping in US. If International address outside of US, we will have to charge additional costs. 

We are really passionate in removing stains, it’s not just our career but our mission. There are truly no tricks in cleaning stains, you can steam it, soak it and vacuum it or do it the right way with Miracle Magic Cleaner. Let us teach you what we have learned in 30 years.

We named our solution Miracle Magic Cleaner that might state it can remove anything from praying or abracadabra poof its gone. We stand behind our solution and what it can remove.  One of the things we teach you is to aggressively vacuum the area where the spot is.

Here are the steps with Miracle Magic Cleaner

1. Vacuum, Vacuum, Vacuum 


2. Lightly mist spot with your Miracle Magic Cleaner then scrub area with a brush to work it in then rub with white terrycloth towel till clean. 


3. Vacuum again. 

We really want to get our cleaner our there to all the homes because we know you will love Miracle Magic Cleaner as much as we do. Investing in Miracle Magic Cleaner can save you much more money than replacing the carpet. Did we mention you can use Miracle Magic Cleaner on car upholstery and even apparel. If you have a food grease stain on your favorite shirt, spray the area and throw in the wash.

We need all the help we can get, we are looking to raise the funds and get the message out there. If you can’t pledge $1.00 or more, please share our message. We truly believe we can help that eye sore in your living room or den.

Thanks so much.

story:
Hello, everybody!  My name is Pres, the Managing Maker of DeJunk Genies – an artist collective celebrating makers of decorative creations while also promoting and educating on the concept of economic freedom through pop-up  events. DeJunk Genies artisans take used furniture and artifacts and remake them to give fresh life, currently offering up those creations at a storefront bazaar.  As we enter into a new phase with this collective, we have a fresh, innovative vision--going mobile.  That is why we are launching our new campaign for a vintage RV, so that DeJunk Genies can be on the move! What we call, "Living the Pop Life "!

We’re calling the RV, Pop Life, inspired by the work and passing of the late, great, Prince--"His Royal Badness"--who has been an inspiration in my own life and work. We also call it Pop Life to reference the pop-ups we've held and future ones planned--maybe even one near you!

Developing as a nonprofit with limited resources, it is difficult for any organization in it's early stages to sustain the overhead of a storefront.  Going mobile will not only keep operational costs far lower, but will give us more freedom to take our work to the people; will afford us to serve a much wider area, and most of all, will pave a way for our sustainability.  With DeJunk Genies On The Move, we can bring the bazaars and promotions to various sections of town.

A little about me….I’ve always had a love affair with the arts. From a thespian in high school, creative costuming,  to performing in productions, writing poetry, building sets, and working for not for profits where art was a central part of the development project. Recently, I admitted my love for remaking--being constantly fascinated with tossed things remade by artisans.  Then a couple of years ago, I went to an estate sale of the Hurt Mansion and left with a butt load of discarded and used materials. It was there, the journey of Dejunk Genies truly began!

Since then, the artist collective developed and has continued to grow while meeting challenges any new concept faces.  We need your support to raise $3,800 to allow DeJunk Genies to continue to grow and prosper. Your support will not only allow us to acquire the RV and clear the way for our organization’s flexibility and sustainability, but also provide more opportunities for artists, makers as well as community folks to engage with each other and promote economic freedom.

Meeting our goal of $3,800 will allow us to remake DeJunk Genies from a "been there, done that" shop to a fresh mobile pop-up.  This allows us to bring bazaars to more communities to  promote the artists & economic freedom. So join the Pop Life and, who knows, you may even remake your world!
 
For those who can not make a financial contribution, please share on your friends'  pages and help us get more friend requests on Facebook--DeJunk Genies.  Thank you!

What we call, "Living the Pop Life "! We’re calling the RV, Pop Life, inspired by the work and passing of the late, great, Prince--"His Royal Badness"--who has been an inspiration in my own life and work. We also call it Pop Life to reference the pop-ups we've held and future ones planned--maybe even one near you!Developing as a nonprofit with limited resources, it is difficult for any organization in it's early stages to sustain the overhead of a storefront.  Going mobile will not only keep operational costs far lower, but will give us more freedom to take our work to the people; will afford us to serve a much wider area, and most of all, will pave a way for our sustainability.  With DeJunk Genies On The Move, we can bring the bazaars and promotions to various sections of town.
A little about me….I’ve always had a love affair with the arts. From a thespian
in high school, creative costuming,  to performing in productions, writing poetry, building sets, and working for not for profits where art was a central part of the development
project. Recently, I admitted my love for remaking--being constantly
fascinated with tossed things remade by artisans.  Then a couple of years ago, I
went to an estate sale of the Hurt Mansion and left with a butt load of discarded and used materials. It was there, the journey of Dejunk Genies truly began!
Since
then, the artist collective developed and has continued to grow while meeting challenges
any new concept faces.  We need your support to raise $3,800 to allow DeJunk Genies to continue to grow
and prosper. Your support will not only allow us to acquire the RV and clear
the way for our organization’s flexibility and sustainability, but also provide
more opportunities for artists, makers as well as community folks to engage with each other and promote economic freedom.
Meeting our goal of $3,800 will allow us to remake DeJunk Genies from a "been there, done that" shop to a fresh mobile pop-up.  This allows us to bring bazaars to more communities to  promote the artists & economic freedom. So join the Pop Life and, who knows, you may even remake your world!
 
For those who can not make a financial contribution, please share on your friends'  pages and help us get more friend requests on Facebook--DeJunk Genies.  Thank you!

story:
Classic Car Gaming gives classic car enthusiasts, and online gamers the ability to place fantasy bets on the outcomes of classic car auction sales, without the controversy of "Daily Fantasy Sports". Classic Car Gaming provides all the same luxuries as a fantasy sports website, like joining leagues, multiple betting options, and tournaments.

For the past 3 years our team has been working out of a small office room, in the front of a classic car restoration garage in Santa Ana, CA that is fully equipped with no air conditioning, and the smell of differential oil.  We've been hard at work developing a database from the blood, sweat, and gears of the industry, just to bring online fantasy gamers something special. This innovative website is now in the very last stage of development, and seeks Indiegogo crowd funding to finish. The main goals of this venture are to bring people something fresh and exciting to have fun with, to create jobs and to inspire young entrepreneurs.

PLACING BETS
Members can place over 30 different kinds of bets on thousands of vehicles from auctions around the world.

SOCIAL
Chat with friends or with other members following an auction. Chat groups also exist for people with common interests. Custom profile pages will also show member photo galleries and interests.

LEAGUES
Starting or joining an existing league is the ultimate classic car competition! Go head-to-head and show who has the ultimate knowledge and skill.

The two kinds of leagues (Draft and Performance) give you two completely different ways to play, both with a champion crowned at the end of the season. Season length is determined by the managing member, and could be a day, a week, 2 months, or even a year.

The money raised will go towards finishing development of ClassicCarGaming.com, the advancements in our user interface to make sure our players are having the best experience possible, and towards the development of our mobile app.

Once the website launches, anyone will be able to sign-up for free and play with Free Coins, which are given to members each day they login. Our backers will receive packages with a range of different rewards including: 

  • Fantasy Dollars that extend game play, and allow you to join fantasy leagues and be entered to win additional prizes.
  • Free Elite Player Membership status that allows you to purchase Fantasy Dollars at a discount, and qualifies you to enter special tournaments. 
  • Classic Car Gaming t-shirt.

This idea came to fruition over 3 years ago, and along the way we have encountered many obstacles - one of which is finding sufficient funding to keep the project moving forward. Since the beginning we have always found a way, and now we’re asking for your assistance to help us reach the finish line. Indiegogo is the perfect opportunity! We feel the best people to fund a project are those who believe in the idea, and want to see it become reality.

This Indiegogo campaign is an exciting milestone, as it’s the first time this new gaming concept is being shown to the world. Combining classic cars and fantasy gaming into a social, exciting website is something we are all passionate about, and we look forward to sharing this new experience with all of you.

Join us, and we’ll bring classic cars and fantasy gaming to a whole new level.

Before bets are placed, members will have access to a database containing thousands of past vehicle sales.

CLASSIC CAR ENTHUSIASTS
This is the ultimate game for those who live and breathe classic cars. Test your knowledge, follow the auctions, and join in the excitement that is Classic Car Gaming.

FANTASY SPORTS FANS
If you love fantasy sports, and have an interest in cars, you’re going to do backflips over Classic Car Gaming.

SOCIAL GAMERS
For those who enjoy playing games online, Classic Car Gaming brings a new gaming experience to the masses.

CLASSIC CAR CLUBS
Create a team building event or just compete for bragging rights within your car club.

 

Mark Boice and Phil Shuyler have always loved cars. They’ve worked in the automotive industry for years, both with new cars as well as classics. One day Mark found out about a group of people that made wagers on what classic cars would sell for at auctions. This got him thinking…what if something like this could be accessible for everyone to play? Mark and Phil quickly joined forces, and brought on Joseph Vournazos. After extensive research and dedication, Classic Car Gaming was born. 

Development Timeline
Our exact timeline for development will depend on the amount of support we receive, and the speed of our developers. We are working every day on the site, and we will continue this schedule once funded. 

With more funding, we will hire additional developers to speed up the path to completion. The exact timeline is unknown, however we are adamant on getting the site live as quickly as possible.

Vehicle Accuracy
The information we receive for the vehicles we feature on the site is provided by the vehicle owners and the auctions. Some of the information provided may have some inaccuracies, however we will always try to catch any discrepancies that may exist.

Follow us on social media and sign up on our website for exclusive news and updates!

  • Website: http://www.classiccargaming.com
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/AuctionGaming
  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ClassicCarGaming/
  • YouTube: https://youtu.be/u-Qo9RnTZgg

story:
About

I remember when I was growing up, all the children in my neighbourhood would come over to my house every day after school. They wanted to hangout with me, because I would help them with their homework, and put on pageants where they would get to dress-up and pretend they were on the runway. It was their time to be in the spotlight! 

Not much has changed for me, as I am still very passionate about helping other women entrepreneurs get visible, get known and build an iconic brand that stands out.

This is why I am launching the Kharisma Magazine which is part of a bigger platform for iconic entrepreneurs who are daring greatly & making an impact in the world.

It gives me the opportunity to provide you, the woman entrepreneur a one-stop resource for guidance, training, tools and inspiration to empower you to build your brand, business and live your best life. 

When I first started out on the entrepreneurial journey, there was no support like what we are building with the Kharisma Magazine and online hub platform for entrepreneurs like yourself. I had to learn everything on my own and I am still learning, as you never arrive at a place where you stop learning. As I learn new things to take my business to the next level, I want you to accompany me on that journey too! 


About

Hi, my name is Kharisma Aro, Founder of the Dare to Be Iconic Academy, Publisher of the forthcoming, Kharisma Magazine. As a Visibility Coach and Iconic Brand Strategist, I help conscious entrepreneurs get visible, get known and build an iconic brand that stands out, to give them the income, impact and freedom lifestyle they desire. 

As Host and Producer of my own online show, The Kharisma Show (Podcast), a 5-day a week business and lifestyle podcast, I interview today's inspiring and successful Lifestyle Entrepreneurs, thought leaders and bestselling authors who share their stories, strategies and tips. I have been featured on various media interviews such as CP24, CHCH TV, and the Barbados Nation newspaper.


Short Summary

 Mission & Positioning 

~ Founder's Statement 

With this magazine and online hub, we have an opportunity to make a real impact in the lives of women entrepreneurs. We want to inspire and empower them to be iconic in business and life.


Positioning Statement 

The Kharisma Magazine is a catalyst for confident, bold and purpose-driven women entrepreneurs who want to make a difference in the lives of others and live their best life. With an emphasis on personal growth, lifestyle and business development, it engages and speaks to every aspect of a woman's life, Body, Mind & Spirit. 

Most magazines feature and highlight well-known influencers and thought leaders who already have impact and influence in the marketplace. 

The Kharisma Magazine stands to be different, as it is a platform that showcases and highlights rising icons, change-makers and thought leaders in the sphere of entrepreneurship.

The Kharisma Magazine is a one-stop resource for guidance, training, tools and inspiration to empower women entrepreneurs to build their brand, business and live their best life. 

Brand Promise 

As a global bi-monthly lifestyle and business digital glossy, Kharisma Magazine provides inspiration and actionable advice for coaches, consultants and experts looking to become known, share their message, transform lives through their products and services while expanding their income, influence and impact.

Movement

Our digital magazine is part of a movement.  A movement that dares women entrepreneurs to be iconic in business and life,
A movement that inspires and empowers women entrepreneurs who are ready to share their message and have an impact in the world to get known and visible through the platform, where they will find actionable advice and tools to help them take their life and business to next level.

                

The Platform
The Kharisma Magazine is also apart of a platform which includes the online Iconic Entrepreneur VIP Club,  the Documentary Show Series Pilot, Destined to be An Entrepreneur and supports our selected cause for the launch, It Girl International.  

 The Editorial Mix

    



What We Need & What You Get

We are kicking off the launch of our magazine to help raise funds to support 10 emerging women entrepreneurs get the skills and support they need to launch their own businesses, plus to fund the software, marketing, production & design for a total of $25,000 USD.

   

   


Here is the break-down of what we need and how it will be spent, followed by what you will get in exchange for your support.

LAUNCH GOAL $5000 - Produce premier issue (design and content production) - Support 2 emerging entrepreneurs through It Girl International.

STRETCH GOALS 

#1 $5000 - Develop magazine app for the Apple Store - Support 2 more emerging entrepreneurs through It Girl International.

#2 $5000 - Develop the Iconic Entrepreneur Club Online Platform - Develop the online version of the magazine for the Iconic Entrepreneur Club members - Support 2 more emerging entrepreneurs through It Girl International.

#3 $10,000 - Produce the pilot episode of the Destined to be an Entrepreneur Documentary Series - Support 4 more emerging entrepreneurs through It Girl International.

TOTAL GOAL $25,000 

           


           


           


The Team

~ Founder & Publisher  


~ Design & Production Team


~ Contributors & Writers


The Impact

Giving back through Cause Marketing

We are executing a cause marketing campaign to launch, promote and market our magazine where we will commit part of our revenue from the promotion to a cause or charity by using Purchase-triggered donations. Purchase-triggered donations are promotions during which our company donates a portion of its revenue whenever a customer purchases a magazine subscription. 

Selected Cause ~ It Girl International 

 

                 


Jessica Nazarali is the Creator and Founder of It Girl Entrepreneur, a company dedicated to providing coaches and online entrepreneurs with the tools they need to create a meaningful career, while living out their best life. She is also the Founder of It Girl International, a not for profit program which helps women in developing countries learn how to become Freelancers and Virtual Assistants to support themselves and their families. Jessica is an Australian, who is working and travelling the world with her husband. 

Our Campaign Goal for It Girl International - Support 10 Emerging Women Entrepreneurs in the Philippines.


Risks & Challenges

We're working hard to publish the magazine bi-monthly, however we recognize that it's possible to experience unforeseen delays with any project.

The delivery date listed on the project is when our app will go live, and is simply an estimate: the creative process of creating a magazine is very fluid and can easily lead to delays.

The good news is that the Kharisma  Magazine is a digital project with only a print edition once per year —we won't have manufacturing delays or supply issues. However, because we're an app, there are some things we can't control, like the approval process or technology barriers.

We've built a buffer into our expected delivery date just in case we run into any such issues.

Please be assured that we're doing our very best to ensure we deliver the project on time, including the anniversary print edition.

I will be keeping open and honest communication with all of our backers. Thank you for believing in us!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share on social media!

story:
Our Mission

Second Chances is committed to providing those with convictions resources to establish structure for optimal community outcomes upon reentry. Our services will support those in need with employment placement & growth opportunities with prudent supervision to establish consistency, and empowerment in order to finalize the reform intended.

Why is this needed, & who does this help?

The Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) is a federal legislation across the United States that promotes accuracy, fairness and privacy for data used by consumer reporting agencies, and employment background checks. KY is known as a lifelong state. This means that though a conviction may be 10, 20, 30+ years old without further incidence, a resident of the state can still be denied employment, though this is one of many prudent conditions of probation & parole means not reoffending or technical violation.

The intent of FCRA is fairness in background checks, further supported by EEOC. However, FCRA laws can vary from one state to the next dramatically. For this reason, 2nd chances is working to aid where deficiencies continue to hurt the state of KY in its advancement; greatly in part because the act is not used as a tool of fairness, fraught with stigma and lack of general knowledge around the varying conviction classifications and associated crimes.

Many states no longer allow lifelong checks such as this, addtionally further support the intent of reform by allowing the consideration of low level felony expungement for nonviolent, non abusive crimes for eligibility of expungment; with review & sign off by the court. Those states have adopted this approach with the understanding not all felonies are created alike, and are classified by severity, in the case of KY Class A-D.

Those states in which checks are restricted to 7 or 10 years, or allow consideration for expungment have subsequently reduced serious deficits & inefficiencies costing tax payers & members of the community. This has been additionally successful in aiding those with convictions to truly aspire toward reformed, productive lives which is the intent. Reformed citizens regain a sense of pride and empowerment, supporting their families, and are significantly lower risk to recidivism, public aid, and cycle through generations.

Lowered recidivism decreases prison overcrowding, further risk to inmates & prison staff; lowered state costs, increased state revenue, application of academic & trade skills supported while incarcerated toward a career upon release in a community that understands this, all while fulfilling the need of employers in the community. Organizations also benefit from the Work Opportunity Tax Credit per person employed, & acting socially responsible for the betterment of the community.

How are we going to get there?

2nd Chances Filed as a Non-Profit Corporation, in the process of applying for IRS status. We are aspiring to work with a fiscal agent to accept donations on our behalf, while working toward our goal. Initial seed funds are needed to support legal process, & operations for start up costs. Will work with other similar non-profits where reentry resources are in place, as we focus on employment placement services, supporting the community in tandem.

Funds are needed for initial assistance in order to continue to support efforts. Short term funds needed:

Initial goal:

o  VOIP phone $50

o  Custom Email $50

o  Domain $100

o  Meeting materials $400

o  Business cards $20

o  Thank you notes $50

o  Planning and forecasting software $240

o  Corp filing, IRS filing $750

o  Legal agreements, Fiscal Agent etc $500

o  Initial fundraising costs $2000

$4,160 total

one state to the next dramatically. For this reason, 2nd chances is

advancement; greatly in part because the act is not used as a tool of fairness,
fraught with stigma and lack of general knowledge around the varying conviction
classifications and associated crimes. 
Many states no longer allow lifelong
checks such as this, addtionally further support the intent of reform by allowing the
consideration of low level felony expungement for nonviolent, non abusive crimes
for eligibility of expungment; with review & sign off by the court. Those
states have adopted this approach with the understanding not all felonies are
created alike, and are classified by severity, in the case of KY Class A-D.
Those states in which checks are
restricted to 7 or 10 years, or allow consideration for expungment have
subsequently reduced serious deficits & inefficiencies costing tax payers & members of the community. This has been
additionally successful in aiding those with convictions to truly
aspire toward reformed, productive lives which is the intent. Reformed
citizens regain a sense of pride and empowerment, supporting their
families, and are significantly lower risk to recidivism, public aid, and cycle through generations. 
Lowered recidivism decreases prison
overcrowding, further risk to inmates & prison staff; lowered state 
costs,
increased state revenue, application of academic & trade skills 
supported
while incarcerated toward a career upon release in a community that 
understands this, all while fulfilling the need of employers in the
community. Organizations also benefit from the Work Opportunity Tax
Credit per person employed, & acting socially responsible for the
betterment of the community. 
How are we going to get there?
2nd Chances Filed as a
Non-Profit Corporation, in the process of applying for IRS status. We are
aspiring to work with a fiscal agent to accept donations on our behalf, while
working toward our goal. Initial seed funds are needed to support legal
process, & operations for start up costs. Will work with other similar
non-profits where reentry resources are in place, as we focus on employment placement
services, supporting the community in tandem. 
Funds are needed for initial
assistance in order to continue to support efforts. Short term funds needed:
Initial goal:
o  VOIP phone $50
o  Custom Email $50
o  Domain $100
o  Meeting materials $400
o  Business cards $20
o  Thank you notes $50
o  Planning and forecasting
software $240
o  Corp filing, IRS filing $750
o  Legal agreements, Fiscal
Agent etc $500

story:
An online store for crafts handmade by women in the Philippines.

Give a man a fish, and you feed him for a day; show him how to catch fish, and you feed him for a lifetime.

Whether the proverb is attributable to Maimonides or Lao Tzu, or whether that idea had been around for ages that its origin can’t be traced back anymore, that proverb best describes the project that I’m asking kindly funding for.

I love travelling when time and finances allow. On my recent visit to the Philippines, Jan-Feb this year, I met craftswomen that belong to a sort of a club in which my mother is a member of. 

These craftswomen make retro style purses, coin purses and bags made from plastic and glass beads. They also make bangles, headbands, rings and earring from beads. They also sew messenger type bags made from cloth.  I bought 3 pieces of purses for my personal use and then it occurred to me that maybe I can help them to help themselves,  earn additional income. What I have in mind  is an online gift store as an outlet for their work.

Back in 2008, I travelled to India and met people through my friends who make handwoven scarves and shawls. They also string neck beads made from the wooden stem of a plant in India. I liked their work so I bought about Aus $ 200 worth (about 8,000 rupees) of their work but more so because I wanted them to earn some money from me. Of course, I used some of them but they are too much for one person's use, so I thought to sell the items but I became so busy that I’d forgotten about them.


Now, with the increasing use of online stores, I have decided to give these craftswomen a chance to sell their work to the bigger world. I have involved my sister to organize the production of the 3 craftswomen in the Philippines and I will manage the online store. (I'm on the right in the pic and my sister on the left, The picture at the top shows one of the maker named Karing).

So far I have spent about AUS $500 worth (around 16,500 Phil. Pesos) of purses and bags  to add to my Indian stuff as inventory.

There will be no risk for the craftswomen because I will pay them outright for items they make for the store. If I can’t sell them, that’s the risk I’m taking.

My funding request is only for US $ 2,500. The $600 is for putting the store online for one year, for template and domain name. My estimate is the cost at Shopify or Wix and the $1,000 or so, to get them materials to do  more of their crafts (to maintain a viable online store, a reasonable volume of inventory is needed)  and $900 for advertising, administration and contingencies. Hopefully, I can create the store from the template or else I’ll be in trouble.  So also, if anyone is a web developer here, I also seek donation of your time  to help me in case I got stuck. I believe this is a worthy project.

Westerners donate money to the third world people. I’m not asking money to give to them, instead we are “showing him how to catch fish, and we feed him for a lifetime”.  That may be a grand ambition, but anything big always starts from a small seed.

BTW, looking forward on to the future, profits made will be put back to the business to grow so we can involve more people to show their dignity through their work. Please donate for this worthy project, any amount will be highly appreciated. 

Thank you.

story:
Tampon Tribe is a monthly subscription for delivered organic cotton tampons and pads that are toxin free, plastic free, completely compostable, and that give back.

 

WHY WE DO THE THINGS WE DO

Our mission is to provide super easy access to affordable organic tampons and pads to all women. Everything about our product is focused on sustainability. Even our applicators are compostable and our packaging is made from recycled materials – no plastic. Period. 

THE SKINNY

What's in your tampons and pads? Here's what's in ours..

1.    Certified Organic, GOTS, ICEA. Our cotton is grown with extreme care and to international certified organic standards, which means everything from the soil, to water use, and of course chemicals, is strictly monitored and regulated. It also means that all stages of production are carefully monitored as well. (GOTS: Global Organic Textile Standard, ICEA: European Eco/Bio Standard)

2.    Toxin Free. Hypoallergenic, chemical free, and 100% organic cotton. Our tampons are encased in fine a 100% organic veil to avoid fibres staying in our bodies. We are chlorine bleach and dioxin free. With a woven cord, there are no glues, synthetics, perfumes, bleaches or dyes used in our products.

3.    Plastic Free. We don't use plastic. Our applicators are a smooth biodegradable, comfortable, and compostable cardboard, our wrappers are paper, and our packaging is burlap and recycled paper. Did you know that the average plastic-applicator tampon user goes through 7,300 plastic applicators in their lifetime? That’s a lot of plastic trash! And it ends up in our landfills and waterways – this is not okay with us.

4.    Completely Compostable ♥. Everything we use is compostable so we can limit the effect we have on our environment and the Earth.

5.    Customized Selection to Match Your Flow. Before each month's delivery, you will be prompted to select your tampon sizes online. If you can’t decide, or don’t have time, we’ll mix it up for you! Each monthly delivery is 16 tampons or 10 pads.

6.    Accessible to All Women. Our mission is to make organic tampons and pads affordable and accessible for everyone. No woman should be forced into using toxic products because she can’t afford or doesn’t have access to an organic option.

7.    Socially Responsible. As well as donating a healthy percentage of revenue to charities chosen by the tribe, focusing on those that make a significant impact on young girls’ (and boys’) confidence, pride and inner-strength, we will create an awesome team by employing people who perhaps haven’t had the same access to education or opportunity in our community. We’ll be working with retraining centers such as Chrysalis in Los Angeles, and seeking out skilled veterans, and special-needs adults to make Tampon Tribe the absolute best we can be.

NO MORE PERIOD PANIC

We deliver monthly, so you will never run out of tampons and pads - and why does that happen each month? We've got your back. No more breakdowns or breakups due to period panic.

ON A SERIOUS NOTE

WHAT'S IN YOUR TAMPON?

Today's tampons and pads are not what you think - they are made from a mix of cotton, rayon, and synthetic fibres. These materials carry toxins from wherever they have been grown/produced. They have been whitened with chlorine bleach that leaves dioxin - a cause of cervical cancer. They contain perfume, dyes, glues, and chemicals called "super-absorbents." And you're putting all of this inside or on one of the most sensitive parts of your bodies? It's time to make a change. Take back control.

WHAT YOU GET WITH TAMPON TRIBE 

Your first month’s Tampon Tribe selection of certified organic cotton tampons or pads, that are pure, simple and toxin-free, comes in a reusable burlap drawstring bag, which you can place in your bathroom cabinet, on the sink, or set centre stage as a conversation piece. Our tampons aren’t meant to be kept a secret!

Your subsequent refill months will be delivered in a recycled paper bag to lessen our impact on the Earth. You customize your selection online prior to delivery if you need, chose a mix of 16 regular, super, or super-plus. As we grow, we’ll have little purse and travel packs available too.

 

HELPING HOMELESS WOMEN

We've just added some perks that directly give back to homeless women in our community who need our help, especially with access to essential feminine hygiene. We will match purchases and deliver feminine hygiene pads to women on our streets. We are partnered with Venice, CA-based Purse Purge, where we fill purses and bags with essential items and either hand-deliver, or make available to, homeless women in the area. Here's our last live video packing purses!

 

PLASTIC FREE

This National Geographic Video says it all.  

There are no excuses for plastic applicators or packaging, that's why we don't use any. And our growing and manufacturing practices are ICEA certified - no toxic runoff, sustainable water use, no chemicals, anywhere. 

OUR SMILING TEAM

We are so excited to bring Tampon Tribe to you and create positive change in the world – you can be too! As entrepreneurs, marketing execs., business women, and passionate women, we are completely committed to Tampon Tribe's success. Together we can make a real difference in the world - disrupting the $16 billion-a-year feminine hygiene industry and that's in the U.S. alone.

 

WHERE THE FUNDS WILL GO

The funds we raise from our Indiegogo will enable Tampon Tribe to thrive. We will:

  • Inventory! We will  fill our warehouse with tampons and pads to send to you
  • A home! Rent a small warehouse for said tampons and pads
  • Employ a team of people! (small to start) who will relish in the opportunity to have an awesome job
  • Tell the World! Create a kick-ass advertising campaign to get more Tribe members and make our dream a reality
  • Education! Keep you up to date with everything health-wise that is going on in the world

PERKS

As the very first official Tribe members, you will be loved, nurtured, and adored by us - you will be treated to special offers, invited to launch and celebration events and know deep down in your heart that you make our day, everyday.

Even better than that - you will get our super-affordable tampons, for seriously excellent prices. Think BOGO, 50% off, bonus months, and for one lucky person, a conversation with Founder Dave (he is very smart, and doesn't speak to people often, this is a very good perk).

    NO MONEY?

    $1? Okay, if you don't have $1, then share this campaign and help spread the Tampon Tribe love.

    Remember - One Organic Tampon Can Change the World.

    OUR TAMPON SPECS

    • 100% pure certified organic cotton absorbent core
    • Hypoallergenic to reduce the risks of irritation and allergies
    • The absorbent core is wrapped with a special safety layer which prevents fibres from remaining inside your body
    • Cardboard applicator with rounded end tip for a comfort, and 100% biodegradable
    • Individually wrapped for convenience
    • Perfume and superabsorbent free
    • Viscose/rayon-free absorbent core
    • No chlorine or dioxin used
    • Recycled packaging
    • 16 organic tampons delivered each month
    • Size customizable on line prior to each month's delivery

     

    THE FUTURE

    Getting funded will also enable us to expand our product lines, adding more awesome organic products, washes, and accessories into our mix.

     

    OUR AMAZING PARTNERS

    A LITTE MORE ABOUT US AND WHY WE STARTED TAMPON TRIBE

    Tampon Tribe was started when Australian and Brazilian entrepreneurs from Beijing, Jennifer and Gaby, traveled to Los Angeles. Searching for healthy, organic products, it became clear that in the feminine hygiene arena, scarcity was king. Always running out of tampons, despite the event being a somewhat regular one, the duo paired their need for convenient and affordable tampons with sustainable, organic, and toxic free products. They are now poised to take Tampon Tribe to the world backed up by a growing enthusiastic team who inspire their passion and drive to create impact and change, and to ensure that no woman is forced into using toxic tampons due to availability or price.

    KEEN TO LEARN MORE?

    You can find out everything there is to know about Tampon Tribe, investing in us, and where we are headed. Check us out on WeFunder.com where we have just started a crowdfunding equity raise. Exciting!!

story:
Welcome to the BooZi Lifestyle


Hello, my name is Sheila, I am the creator of BooZi. My artist name is Like A'Fish, because, well...I enjoy alcohol a great deal. I began getting tired of the taste of lighter fluid in less expensive varieties, hated waking up the next day to headaches, dizziness, and nausea, and as an advocate for organics and cleaner living, I knew there had to be a better way to enjoy my favorite beverages. After years of development, university and field testing, BooZi: The Elixir Fixer, was born.

In the process of creating alcohol, through distillation and fermentation, impurities come along for the ride. We call these negative congeners.  It is these substances that create the hangover and the alcohol after taste that we know so well. Your body has to work hard to remove those negative congeners from your body, that is why people get sick.  Even if you only have one drink, those toxins are traveling through your body. What if I  told you that BooZi was submitted to Coastal Carolina University for third party testing, and is scientifically proven to remove those impurities; that harshness you find in alcohol dissipates. You are guaranteed a large reduction in hangover symptoms, now don't forget to drink plenty of water and eat, you're still consuming alcohol.  I would also like to add that it does not change the specific gravity or percentage of alcohol. 

"Well, Sheila, why don't you just buy top shelf? Everyone knows that it will taste better." I would say, "It is true that you invest in your hangover, however, during our testing we found that even the more expensive alcohols had negative congeners in them, just less than the lower priced spirits." 

"What about wine, Sheila? My friend Alice is sensitive to sulfites and she gets headaches." GREAT NEWS! BooZi is also proven to reduce sulfites in wine. So, Alice can enjoy a  glass of her favorite vino, and be headache free! They are also reusable, so one BooZi can be used in up to 4 large bottles of hard alcohol and up to 12 bottles of wine.

 "So, you are telling me that I can put BooZi in a bottle of alcohol and it will smooth out the taste because the impurities are gone, that I won't get a hangover, and that I can use it in wine? Sheila, this sounds amazing, why do you need my help?"  Well, let's just say, after all of these years in development, submitting BooZi for scientific study, field testing, etc; I am tapped out. I have put all of my personal funds into bringing this amazing product into the world that is simple to use, affordable and reusable. There is still one major thing that needs to be tweaked. 

Friends, BooZi looks like a giant tampon. I have heard it over, and over, and over again at tastings that I have held at BooZi headquarters, festivals, and at personal shindigs. At the time of initial development, the only option we had was white and because of what it did, I was completely impartial to color significance.  So, I have tested new materials that will still perform as well, and we have finally got it. It's black and we are calling it BooZi Stealth. 

Your contribution will go towards making the new Stealth BooZi; it's designed, tested, and ready for production. 

In the beginning, every penny will go toward production of the newly designed BooZi, then to uniform packaging; currently we hand stamp every package, which is time consuming and costly. Finally, the funds will go to marketing BooZi, because everyone deserves a chance to be a part of the BooZi lifestyle.

BooZi is 100% made in America. Your contribution is helping to build a company that wants to make American made products and create American jobs. 

Thank you for supporting a product that not only improves how you enjoy liquid refreshment, but also your well being. I'm counting on you to spread the word.

*Hey, we know BooZi is amazing and will change the way you drink, forever, but please do it responsibly.
story_txt: Welcome to the BooZi LifestyleHello, my name is Sheila, I am the creator of BooZi. My artist name is Like A'Fish, because, well...I enjoy alcohol a great deal. I began getting tired of the taste of lighter fluid in less expensive varieties, hated waking up the next day to headaches, dizziness, and nausea, and as an advocate for organics and cleaner living, I knew there had to be a better way to enjoy my favorite beverages. After years of development, university and field testing, BooZi: The Elixir Fixer, was born.In the process of creating alcohol, through distillation and fermentation, impurities come along for the ride. We call these negative congeners.  It is these substances that create the hangover and the alcohol after taste that we know so well. Your body has to work hard to remove those negative congeners from your body, that is why people get sick.  Even if you only have one drink, those toxins are traveling through your body. What if I  told you that BooZi was submitted to Coastal Carolina University for third party testing, and is scientifically proven to remove those impurities; that harshness you find in alcohol dissipates. You are guaranteed a large reduction in hangover symptoms, now don't forget to drink plenty of water and eat, you're still consuming alcohol.  I would also like to add that it does not change the specific gravity or percentage of alcohol. "Well, Sheila, why don't you just buy top shelf? Everyone knows that it will taste better." I would say, "It is true that you invest in your hangover, however, during our testing we found that even the more expensive alcohols had negative congeners in them, just less than the lower priced spirits." "What about wine, Sheila? My friend Alice is sensitive to sulfites and she gets headaches." GREAT NEWS! BooZi is also proven to reduce sulfites in wine. So, Alice can enjoy a  glass of her favorite vino, and be headache free! They are also reusable, so one BooZi can be used in up to 4 large bottles of hard alcohol and up to 12 bottles of wine. "So, you are telling me that I can put BooZi in a bottle of alcohol and it will smooth out the taste because the impurities are gone, that I won't get a hangover, and that I can use it in wine? Sheila, this sounds amazing, why do you need my help?"  Well, let's just say, after all of these years in development, submitting BooZi for scientific study, field testing, etc; I am tapped out. I have put all of my personal funds into bringing this amazing product into the world that is simple to use, affordable and reusable. There is still one major thing that needs to be tweaked. Friends, BooZi looks like a giant tampon. I have heard it over, and over, and over again at tastings that I have held at BooZi headquarters, festivals, and at personal shindigs. At the time of initial development, the only option we had was white and because of what it did, I was completely impartial to color significance.  So, I have tested new materials that will still perform as well, and we have finally got it. It's black and we are calling it BooZi Stealth. Your contribution will go towards making the new Stealth BooZi; it's designed, tested, and ready for production. In the beginning, every penny will go toward production of the newly designed BooZi, then to uniform packaging; currently we hand stamp every package, which is time consuming and costly. Finally, the funds will go to marketing BooZi, because everyone deserves a chance to be a part of the BooZi lifestyle.BooZi is 100% made in America. Your contribution is helping to build a company that wants to make American made products and create American jobs. Thank you for supporting a product that not only improves how you enjoy liquid refreshment, but also your well being. I'm counting on you to spread the word.*Hey, we know BooZi is amazing and will change the way you drink, forever, but please do it responsibly.

story:
Meet The Project:

Our City is Changing

 

We need a new journalism and digital media for a new emerging San Antonio. In the past two decades, San Antonio has transformed itself into a world-class culinary, art, and cultural destination. San Antonio is so much more than the River-Walk and The Alamo. This city is full of brilliant minds with diverse backgrounds who strive to create, collaborate, and educate others about what our city really has to offer, beyond what can be found on Yelp. The Down Market (www.thedownmarket.net) , does exactly that. 

Join The Down Market on an epic journey to power a new media that reflects San Antonio and the surrounding cities of Austin, Houston, and Dallas’ true diversity. As our country’s demographics shift, we also need to change the way we talk about ourselves.

 

Explore With Us.

 

 

The past few months a very small team have been working nonstop creating content. We have created original videos which some of you have seen called The Culture + Creative series that touches only the surface of what this great city has to offer.

We have essays, studies, articles, podcasts, graphics & animation coming. But we need more support, we need more resources, we need more video equipment and we need to hire more reporters, producers, editors, multimedia journalists, cinematographers, and writers to give a true depiction of the new emerging Creative Class of San Antonio, Texas.

Your donation will help us connect you to stories about your city and reporting with the honest and uncomfortable conversations we should be having to grow as a community.

 

Planned Impact

Give anything you can, every dollar counts in creating a new digital platform that is created for the people by the people.

The Down Market Stories, Series & Categories ::

As The Down Market grows, here are a small sample and description of the kinds of stories and documentary news we want to share, unique to San Antonio, Austin, Dallas, etc. The Culture + Creative series, Watch it below – and help us tell these stories.

  • THE CULTURE + CREATIVE series :

    • A guide through the modern culture of the creative. A digital media series showcasing the creative wealth of collaboration, experience, and community in San Antonio, Texas.

  • THE COMMON STREAM (studio) series:

    • Focused on expertly curating the best of the best in music and engaging youth in social conversations. weekly playlist of New, Indie, or rediscovered Music found on social media. exclusive performances. And interviews with local musicians who explain their complex relationships with music, life experience, and the music industry in Texas. Music Venue analysis and performance reviews by those who matter… the fans.

  • THE CHANNEL 3 (studio) series:

    • With daily news, entertaining reviews of the latest games, movies and comics, join The Down Market team as they explore the state of play, innovation and technology of San Antonio’s tech and film scene with live feed interviews and in depth commentary of today’s pop-culture landscape. Behind the scenes look at Alamo City Comic Con, The Alamo City Film Festival, and PAX South etc. 

  • THE ORCHARD (Limited) series:

    • The series navigates through local Farmer’s markets in Texas. A journey of biodiversity in food, health, and kinship. Live feed interviews and in depth commentary of San Antonio’s food producers, and the local businesses that sustain our local, organic, and healthy living.

  • GOD_i (Limited) series:

    • GOD_i documentary series is a journey of multiple perspectives and in-depth analysis on the state of religion and spirituality with young adults and the growing divide of religion in politics. If there are religious freedoms, it is the responsibility of the free to create social solutions that reflect the issues on civil, women, and gay rights. Our exploration will resist the sensationalism of religion in politics in favor of the meaningful conversation of what has bonded us together for centuries, religion and community.

 

  • THE LOCAL TRADE (Limited) series:

    • Ideas, Conversations, and Coffee + Lattes. These are the traits and trades of every business scene around the world from blue collar to the board room. The Down Market’s influential videos from expert speakers on education, business, science, tech, politics and creativity with a cup of coffee in hand, sit down with us at our favorite Coffee Houses in San Antonio. Only allowed 3 mins to talk to stir your curiosity, with live feed Q&A and behind the scenes commentary with The Down Market staff.

 

 

  • Go Voto Go! (Limited) series:

    • Universities, young adults, and diverse communities’ commentary on the 2016 election and beyond the vote. When big-name media outlets post headlines and share sound bites that bait you into debates, The Down Market will encourage the city to have real conversations about real issues.

 

What We Need From You

We are so confident in the compelling stories that our participants and our small crew of creatives have shared and will share, that with your contributions, we can continue to make beautiful film vignettes that will help attract private investors and grants to our work, and continue to fund the development of our custom website.

The more you invest, the more stories we can feature in this work. We hope you can see the power of your investment!

 

With your support, we'll be able to put the money towards the following:

  • Trademarks, Licenses & Other Permit Fees

  • Much-needed Audio & Film Equipment -- Cameras, Audio Hardware, Visual software, Web Hosting, etc.

  • Marketing Materials -- Signs, Merchandise, Physical & Digital Advertising

  • Research & Development -- Reporting Staff, Podcast, Animation, Studio Production, etc.

 

 

 

Anything over our initial monetary goals will go towards our stretch goal:  "Shows + Research & Development Fund." Our ultimate dream is to develop a creative studio allowing us to develop stories, create events and a sustainable digital platform for the communities of San Antonio and every area of the state of Texas to stay informed and united.

Our goal is to raise $6,000 with this campaign.

For each event, person, or organization we feature, the cost breakdown is $1500 for the film and editing crew.

Our stretch goal for filming is to raise an additional $15,000 so we can feature more citizens, and organizations. 

 

 

Work has already begun creating new stories and series, funded out of our own pockets with support from friends and family. While we have been able to fuel the start-up on sheer passion, we need your investment to see it through. We have an amazing team just waiting to dive in and create an artful and beautiful tribute to this unique city of saints. 

If you're not able to contribute, don't worry! Just share our story with your friends and spread the good word! 

 

The Goods + Perks
Here’s what you’ll get in exchange:

  • You’re changing the media. The Down Market isn’t funded by the same old massive media companies and local media affiliates that have steered the news for decades. It’s funded by people like you. That means we’re free to tell stories that everyone else is ignoring. We’re not here to represent advertisers or corporations – we are here to represent you and the urban creatives, small business, innovators and only brand advertisers who want to collaborate and help the community of Downtown San Antonio and its surrounding areas.

 

  • You’re changing society, too.The journalism and authentic local digital media content from The Down Market is going to showcase the innovation, culture and creative journey many people around the state of Texas know San Antonio to be but also content that places a spotlight on honest, illuminating, and sometimes uncomfortable dialogues. Giving people the opportunity to think differently about issues, and when they do, we’ll make sure local leaders, politicians, and big business take notice.

 

  • You’re a lifetime member of The Down Market. As a backer, you’ll have a standing invitation to our events – both digital and in the real world – and we’ll give you a sneak peek of the interviews, films, and stories we have in the works. Throughout the crowdfunding campaign and beyond, we’ll also give you ways to get involved and spread the word.

 

  • You’ll get access to rewards and gifts to show off your support. Get The Down Market gear and access to other exclusive content.

 

  • Your pledge gains exclusive access to Special Events, Eat & Meets and Our Official Launch Party of Spring 2017 season.

 
 

 

MEET THE TEAM

Jack of all trades and master of disguise.. not really.

Created Sundown United, an apparel brand. Created The Down Market, the media startup.

Jael believes we need a media that lives at the intersection of culture, innovation, and identity in a multicultural Texas. What you see presently and in the future of the down market, he either created it or helped cultivate the idea. 

Drawing across the spectrum of professional landscapes, Micco comes from a blend of Operations Management from his event planning company, problem solving as a project manager and consultant in Austin’s world renown technology scene, and a way with words as a writer for The Down Market.  Micco has supported The Down Market from its beginning and joined the team early on, wanting to contribute to the cultural movement espoused by the company and invest in the unique delivery of content using transmedia and experiential methodologies.  You can find Micco’s work for The Down Market in written articles covering music/politics/social/issues/festivals, running operations for The Down Market special events, or just experiencing The Down Market as whole where he continues to provide consulting and direction on the company itself.

As the team’s residential downtowner, Yliana Perez, brings to the team her love of culture, food, and event planning. On any given night you can find her in attending events throughout the city that she’s called home for almost two decades.  Her time spent overseas in Europe and Africa brings to the table a world perspective and a desire to expand the cultural dynamic of San Antonio, whether it be through her contribution to The Culture + Creative Series or one of the many fabulous events The Down Market has put on. As the team’s Event Planner, Yliana’s passion lies in supporting local businesses by bringing together local creatives and entrepreneurs while exposing the San Antonio culture to a community that reflects its ever growing diversity.  

Down Market Contributors

 

Wylie Kuykendall

David Perez

Georgette Lockwood 

Milton Hamilton

Ellen Kidwell

Anjelika Burkhart

Our film team has worked collectively on multiple projects from big budget events to music videos and independent work around the city of San Antonio, Austin, Dallas and the rest of the state of Texas. I will continue to donate my time as director, but we'll need your contributions to support our team.

Bottom line?

The more you invest, the more stories we can feature in this work. We hope you can see the power of your investment!

Local Team Ups 

The Down Market project, first originated and is powered by Sundown United Independent Brand.  The independent brand provides urban/street gear and other helpful resources when needed to the crew of The Down Market team and contributors. Since its start in Dallas, Texas in 2011, Sundown United has always promoted the idea of unity and social change, creating apparel promoting pride in oneself and their community, courage for those who seek it. Sundown United's goal is to become the premier apparel for the culture creative individual and the social positive brand for the people of Texas and Nationwide.

 

Risks & Challenges

We can not revolutionize the media in the cities of Texas without your help.

Our city of San Antonio, Texas specifically, is experiencing a seismic shift in our very identity, and the root of that change comes from three key components; technology, community, and culture. Each one is trying to find an identity that can have a lasting and true relationship with the people of San Antonio, the surrounding areas of Texas, and nationwide.

There are too many artists, innovators, activist, small businesses, too many voters – too many people – whose stories are not being told. And, too often, when the stories are told, they lack the necessary nuance and context.

 

So...what if we don't reach our fundraising goal?

The power and beauty of The Down Market is that the project can evolve organically to fit within the budget available to us, because its created by the people not a brand conglomerate with share holders to answer too with their own agendas. Whether or not it can become the masterpiece we have designed is up to you, the people and your support. Should we fall short of our campaign goal, we will scale back the number of film vignettes, project series and articles we start with, and hope that a larger body of work will help us to secure grants and private funding. Regardless of money, we will continue to create meet up socials and workshops to find the stories that our important to you, blog and write thought provoking articles, make photo essays, and record live feeds of stories and events even as a labor of love to the city of saints and find ways to continue to bring more stories from all around Texas of it's true strength of diversity, that only The Down Market: Digital Magazine can. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people just can't contribute, we understand but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Share this campaign on all your social feeds. Tag your posts #thedownmarket so we can find you and show our thanks.
  • There is a power in numbers. If you can't contribute financially, approach any organizations, businesses, our community leaders in the San Antonio area that you are affiliated with and tell them about our project.

Testimonials

story:
Hi I am Melanie and I want to Be part of campaign to save the Honey Bees

I grew up on a beautiful property that is home to wild unsprayed blackberries and fields of wild flowers.   As a child I remember seeing the Honey Bee everywhere  and now not so much.  The honey Bee is under threat due to Colony collapse disorder, the varroa mite and speculation of pesticides causing their disappearance.  We would like to take the opportunity to Hive up to 50 honey bee colonies here on our unsprayed 100 acre farm.  We purchased our first hive this year and would like to purchase 5 more for next year. 

We Need & What You Get

  • We need $2800 to obtain the five hives and bees, as well as set up an educational beehive for visitors.
  • Our Bees will have access to 100 acres of unsprayed wild flowers and blackberries.  We also plan to plant a large amount of lavender, one of bees favourite flowers.
  • If we do not reach our goal, the portion we do raise will go towards the a number of hives we can afford with the funds.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference not only for the colonies of honey bees we will purchase but will support the honey bee in their comeback by providing a chemical free bee-yard with plenty of pollen.

  • Food is vital, for all of us and honey bees are the key to agriculture success.
  • Apples, Cherries, pumpkins, pears all depend on the honey bee, think of the bees and appreciate what they do for us when you bite into a juicy pear this summer.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks with hiving honey bees, honey bees swarm and leave their hives if they are over crowded and are difficult to "over winter," thus allowing their colonel to continue into the new year.

  • I am working with a local apiary who has a PHD in Bees and agriculture.
  • Also many bee colonies starve to death from not having enough of their own honey to over winter, I would like to leave them with sufficient stores so they can have the health benefits of their own honey through out the winter.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Plant lavender and marigold flowers and look at dandelions not as weeds but as honey bees first source of pollen.
  • Appreciate bees and the contribution they make to your living.

The Impact Your contribution will make a difference not only for the colonies of honey bees we will purchase but will support the honey bee in their comeback by providing a chemical free bee-yard with plenty of pollen.  Food is vital, for all of us and honey bees are the key to agriculture success. Apples, Cherries, pumpkins, pears all depend on the honey bee, think of the bees and appreciate what they do for us when you bite into a juicy pear this summer.    Risks & Challenges  There are risks with hiving honey bees, honey bees swarm and leave their hives if they are over crowded and are difficult to "over winter," thus allowing their colonel to continue into the new year.  I am working with a local apiary who has a PHD in Bees and agriculture. Also many bee colonies starve to death from not having enough of their own honey to over winter, I would like to leave them with sufficient stores so they can have the health benefits of their own honey through out the winter.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Plant lavender and marigold flowers and look at dandelions not as weeds but as honey bees first source of pollen.
Appreciate bees and the contribution they make to your living.

story:
WORKING FOR FOOD

What started out as a small video in 2012 that told the story of a local farmer and his sustainable farm systems has now evolved into a 6 part series featured on the pages of Edible Ottawa magazine and has grown to involve 5 more characters connected in the world of food and the writers, filmmakers, & photographers who tell their story.

The series follows how food moves through the system from Farmer to Driver, from Gardener to Restaurant, from Brewer to Dairy.    These connections show us that food is a major part of our community and the people who are working behind the scenes to bring it to us do so out of passion and commitment to their craft.

We started by taking photographers to shoot the characters we had chosen.    Neither parties had met and by doing things this way we sought out to achieve a series of honest portraits of the people behind the food.   

We chose Edible Ottawa to print the story because of their commitment to quality content and beautiful imagery.    Now that all 6 portraits have been featured in the magazine we are now moving on to the next stage:   a documentary web series that tells the story of, not only the characters we chose, but how the incredible photography came to be (and why).   We feel the story is incredible and the resulting first episode really took what we felt was a great project to start to the next level.   

The best part of this whole idea is the matching of cultures.    We have taken passionate people in the food world and paired them with passionate people of the art world.   Each pays tribute to the other.   

We hope to see this project grow and go beyond the first six characters.    This crowd funding campaign is crucial to make that happen.   We hope to use the funds to:  a) complete the documentary web series eventually highlighting it in film festivals across Canada b) begin a second 6-part series highlighting the vibrant food community in Ottawa and area.

We have partnered with Mariposa Farms, Whalebone Oyster House, The Clocktower Brew Pub & Arlington Five/Wilf & Adas to offer an incredible roster of incentives for your support.   As well, with 6 talented photographers who have built a library of photos from the project, each unique to their own style, we can also start getting these photos out to the the community that embraces Ottawa growing food culture.  

WHY CROWDFUNDING?

Unfortunately there just isn't a lot of budget out there to support the scope of these projects and compensate the artists that work so hard to tell these stories.   However, with the response we received from the 6 part series in Edible Ottawa, we know that there is demand and people are truly excited about these stories.  This is why we are putting this campaign open for public support;  to see if that demand can take us to the next level.

If you support it, we will make it.    This is the true nature of why we have decided to crowd fund this project:   We believe in it and we think that we can bring something truly special to an excited audience.   

We have heard from the food community with their gracious support and faith in this project.   Now we are calling on you to help make it a reality.   

The Impact

Support us on any level.   That could be a donation, buy an incentive (which are amazing), share this link with your friends and family.   

Anything helps and for your help we are truly thankful.  We will do our best to maintain a commitment to supporting the stories of the food culture that are truly special as well as the artist that bring these stories to life.  

Thank you in advance for your support!!

Mike & Jessie

story:
Just last year FBN opened the Hartford Boxing Center. The Center is a community boxing gym striving to engage the youth. The Center has developed an afterschool Youth Development Program aimed at assisting the youth with tutoring, mentoring, and self development through Sports and Arts. As of today, we've accomplished so much with little to no resources; helping over 500 children, being featured on a national televised show called Knockout and being featured in an ESPN short documentary. Today I sit here with a broken heart. Our landlord has decided to increase the rent of our facility 50%. With the increase our rent will go from $1,600 to $3,500 per month. That is nearly 75% of all of our income. We are practically being forced to move out. On our desperate search for another location, we found a great affordable location to continue serving the children in the city of Hartford and surrounding towns. July 1st 2015 is our day to move in.

We have no money to make the move to our new location. If we don't have the money that we need to move to our new facility, we will be forced to close our doors. That would devastate the children and the community we serve. We need the money for security deposits, rents, moving expenses, labor, new training equipment, computers, etc. We first opened our doors with all used equipment and we hope to raise enough money to replace and add new equipment. Our staff will not sleep until we get the funding needed to continue to serve our city and our be-loved children. We are looking for $30,000 to pay for our immediate needs.

We need your financial support. Five or ten dollars won't make much difference in your life, but it will make a big difference in the life of these children because they’re our future..

Help us , please!
