story:
BACKGROUND- Hayes .490 Less Lethal Weapon and proprietary impact munitions.

Greetings, my name is John Hayes and my project idea was born out of the frustration I experienced  seeing many conflicts escalate with deadly consequences. Originally from NY. Became a police officer at 21 years old. Worked as a police officer and then was eventually promoted to detective in a city in the north east. Retired two years after being involved in the justified shooting death of a bad guy who robbed a bank and then tried to escape shooting at police who gave chase. After retiring I began to consider the "force continuum" that police must follow when protecting themselves. I was educated at the City University of New York, John Jay College of Criminal Justice, and was raised in one of the toughest neighborhoods of a major city in the Northeastern U.S.           Police are put into the most treacherous rapidly evolving situations, and we expect them to make the proper decision every single time they are faced with such pressure packed decisions. Graham v. Connor  490 U.S. 386 (1989) was a United States Supreme Court case where the Court determined that an objective reasonableness standard should apply to a free citizen's claim that law enforcement officials used excessive force in the course of making an arrest, investigatory stop, or other "seizure" of his person.        My campaign is to raise funds to produce my patented weapon and proprietary impact munitions to give police, (security forces, and the general public) , a tool to end conflict during the dynamic "force continuum" without a deadly outcome. 

  I have written and have been issued five (5) U.S patents for my weapon and munitions cartridges. The entire project is completely ready to roll out and to begin production of the weapon and impact munitions for immediate sales and use. After five years of product development and testing there could not be a better time to get this product to market throughout the world.

Time Magazine's 2012 person of the year was the protestor, and the recent large scale riots and protest events throughout the U.S, and, in fact, the entire world, make a compelling case for the need of less lethal weapon alternatives that will save lives. Impact munitions are extremely effective in safely reducing conflict and this fact has been shown in a 2004 US Department of Justice Study, "less lethal impact munitions can help law enforcement and military personnel effectively resolve potentially violent encounters in which deadly physical force might otherwise be used." (U.S. D.O.J. National Institute of Justice, October 2004 Impact Munitions Uses: Types, Targets, and Effects). My weapon is a lightweight, hand held, weapon that launches four impact munitions, one at a time, at the intended target subject. It is unique because the current technologies are large, bulky weapons that can not be easily carried. Most importantly though, is the projectile has been in use for over a decade and has never  caused a death. The launcher can also be owned by ordinary civilian persons for home protection. 

The competing technology is a handheld electrocution device that has unpredictable outcomes and has caused over 500 deaths in the last 10 years.
NEED
To get the first run of production completed requires expensive costs for creation of the main parts molds, precision machined hardened steel internal parts, speed load patented four shot cartridge mold, and all related advertising, marketing, insurance, contract manufacturing, and legal cost considerations. It is estimated that this can be accomplished with as little as $250,00.00 in funding. To date, this project has been funded with just under U.S. $1,000,000.00 in private funds from the inventor, friends, family, and sweat equity. The campaign has a $1,500,000.00 target amount as the "best possible case" to be able to market our product effectively throughout the world. We can get into production and have molds produced and manufacture the first 575 weapons and 50,000 rounds of our less lethal ammunition with a minimum of $250,000.00.  Each contributor will be rewarded with unique one of a kind items that will never be available to anyone other than a contributor. Please see the perks section. Any gap in the amount of funds raised in this INDIEGOGO campaign and the amount needed is planned to be filled through other traditional finance methods.
This product fills a gap in the "force continuum" with a predictable outcome. A target subject will be bruised without a penetration injury and the goal is compliance through pain, as opposed to an unpredictable outcome such as death through electrocution.  As was the case of Israel Hernandez in Miami Beach Florida 2013 and the 500 deaths over the past ten years by use of a Conductive Energy Weapon that electrocutes a person.
CHALLENGES

Traditional finance has been a difficult path because investors want "too much of the pie," so to speak. Television programs, such as Shark Tank give insight to exactly how investors operate; they want control. We are confident that enough good people will see the value in this technology and understand the need. The inventor has been working contract security gigs to "bootstrap" the project until funds can be raised to get into production. The goal is to continue on that path. Persistence and determination has been the mainstay characteristics that have kept this project moving forward to a completed production prototype and we will "stay the course."

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

If you truly believe in this solution for a predictable outcome in the deployment of less lethal force to safely reslove physical conflict then you can be an advocate for our product. Please tell your friends, family, politicians, and anyone that will listen that there is a technology now available that has a highly predictable outcome for de-escalation of violent encounters. The projectile has been in use for over ten years and has never caused a death.  Finally, thank you to my engineering team at Parametric Solutions in Jupiter, Florida, Dan Larcomb of Engineering Marvels in Stuart Florida for the Larcomb firing mechanism, and to the always polite & professional, Douglas Perry, Master Machinist, from Palm Beach Gardens, Fl. and soon to re-locate to Palatka, Fl.

story:
How this came about

Try Vegan is a concept I have been toying with for quite some time. The original plan was opening a restaurant, but I quickly realized finding capital for such a  venture would be quite difficult and time consuming. This is when I decided to start with something requiring less start up costs and with that, the Try Vegan food truck was born.

I have been practicing a plant based diet for over two years and it all started as a simple experiment. Being lactose intolerant, I cut dairy out of my diet and wanted to do a little test to see how I would feel cutting out meat and eggs as well. Within a week I had already started noticing a difference. My skin cleared up, I was more energized in the mornings, and I didn't have that heavy, regretful feeling after eating. 

The purpose of this truck is to show people how beneficial a plant based diet can be and how quickly they can start feeling results.  My goal in this project is to be another piece of the puzzle that is trying to help spread the awareness of how important food is to our overall health. Once the truck is up and running, I would like to go to different schools and give speeches explaining to students what they are doing to their bodies when they make the decision to eat processed foods and what they could be eating instead.


How to help me get on the road

I was lucky enough to get a vehicle relatively quickly for a great deal. Now, however, I need to fix it, design it, outfit it, and get it on the road. Doing so will cost me a few dollars which is where I need your help. Getting the truck to the point where it is on the road and selling food is going to cost money. To start I need a 3 bay sink, hand sink, water pump, water tank, water heater, generator, blender, panini press, refrigerator, etc. just to name a few. After all is said and done with all the numbers crunched, including the cost of the perks, 15k is the sweet spot for what I will need. But enough about me, lets talk about what you get!


What you get

Try Vegan is more than a food truck, it is also our message. Most of the perks offered are apparel or can be used at the gym. This is a great way to get spread awareness and get people talking about a plant based diet. As mentioned earlier, I am all about spreading the message, and what better way is there than wearing clothing and accessories showing off what you represent! 

Don't fear if I do not reach my entire goal, I will still be able fulfill all perks listed and will have the means to go about finishing up the truck although I may not be able to tailor fit the truck with all the bells and whistles I would like. 

*When checking out, let me know the color and design wanted for each shirt.


How you are helping

By contributing to my cause, you will help push forward a grass roots movement to help people learn the benefits of a plant based diet. You will be allowing me to go into different communities in order to teach people how a vegan diet can transform their bodies into efficient healthy machines. The message of Try Vegan is the same as all people who practice this lifestyle share, we all want to help each other become more healthy and aware. By helping me with this cause, you will in turn be helping those around you. I have made myself a few t-shirts using Iron-ons and while wearing it the shirt has come up in conversation and from there people I'm talking to become more interested. Through this, I have learned some people are still unaware what the word vegan means, and this is your chance to help let them know!
 

What makes you think you can do this, Vince 

Starting a business is always risky, you never know what may happen or if you are qualified. Luckily for me, I have served in retail for the 10 years, the past 5 of which I have been a salaried store manager. The stores I have managed were well known "Big-Box" stores and the most recent was a large scale supermarket in New Jersey which even had a mini restaurant inside. The store had many departments in which different types of raw food were handled and I have licenses from both The National Registry of Food Safety Professionals and ServSafe National Restaurant Association. While there, I was responsible for abiding by food safety regulations, health department inspections, providing customer service, managing 200+ employees, all while keeping track of a 70k+ sq-ft store. 

Being responsible for such a large scale operation at a relatively young age  was a major factor that led me to believe this is something I can do. Shrinking the operation down and allowing me to be at the helm feels like a logical move and I hope the qualifications I just mentioned put you at ease when thinking about whether or not this ship has the right captain. 


How else to help 

Please do not feel obligated to donate money. This is a movement that has become huge over the past few years and there are so many ways to help spread the word other than contributing your hard earned money. 
Check out my website at www.tryegannj.com  send me an e-mail at TryVeganNj@gmail.com or follow us on social media:
https://www.facebook.com/TryVeganNJ
https://twitter.com/TryVeganNJ
https://instagram.com/tryvegannj
share/like/follow away  :) 

Thank you for stopping by and viewing my campaign!

Keep checking back for more designs!

share/like/follow away  :) 



Thank you for stopping by and viewing my campaign!

Keep checking back for more designs!

story:
1-L’atlas

Dans les hauteurs, le vent a souligné les reliefs en soufflant sur la neige. Les pointes rocheuses se sont libérées du manteau immaculé, alors que des contreforts blancs se pressent contre leurs racines. Le paysage disparaît sous les pieds de l’homme, les nuages coupent le cordage qui le liait encore au monde. Ils forment un sol nouveau sur lequel il faut s’appuyer pour grimper encore, et admirer de plus haut ces champs cotonneux que seules transpercent quelques cimes enneigées.

Chaque ascension est un exploit physique, une victoire spirituelle. Quand, à l’accomplissement de ce périple, l’alpiniste lève les bras vers le ciel, son sourire triomphant est une louange profonde qui monte vers Dieu.

2-Notre projet

Hier, faire l’ascension des Dômes de Miage c’était un exploit sportif récompensé par la beauté d’un paysage à couper le souffle. Aujourd’hui, c’est une véritable rencontre avec nos frères Pierre et Charles DOUILLET qui nous ont quittés trop vite.

Notre projet est donc de proposer à ceux qui le veulent et qui se sentaient proche de Pierre et Charles de se joindre à nous pour gravir ce sommet. Avec au programme une montée au refuge des conscrits le premier jour suivi d’une soirée prière, confession et louange tous ensemble. Le deuxième jour sera composé d’une marche jusqu’au col des Miages avec la célébration d’une messe au sommet avec le père Gaspard Crapelet.


3-La neuvaine


Voilà la neuvaine qui vous sera transmise, pour que vous puissiez prier avec nous à partir du 27 juin et jusqu'au dimanche 5 juillet tout en ayant la possibilité de continuer à la prier après bien sur.


4-Le financement

Tous ceux qui en ont le désir doivent pouvoir participer à ce we, c’est pour que chaque jeunes puisse nous accompagner que je me tourne vers vous. C’est aussi une façon pour que chacun puisse participer à cette ascension.

Nos fonds récolté servirons à :

  - Aider chaque jeune à payer son trajet.

  - Payer le refuge qui accepte de nous accueillir et de ne pas nous laisser dormir dehors.

  - Optimiser la sécurité du we par un bon accompagnement et un équipement complet.

SI VOUS N'ARRIVEZ PAS A VOUS CREE DE COMPTE PAYPAL VOUS POUVEZ M'ENVOYER UN CHEQUE:

augustinrigal

286 chemin de la capite

73000 barberaz

ou bien par virement:

Titulaire
M. Augustin RIGAL

Code B.I.C                       
Code I.B.A.N
BOUS FRPP XXX FR76 4061 8802 6600 0408 0510 220

Domiciliation
18, quai du Point du Jour 92659 Boulogne-Billancourt Cedex
Code Banque         Code Guichet                N° compte                         Clé RIB

40618                        80266                             00040805102               20

story:
About Sitzon

Since 2014, Sitzon in West Islip, New York, has been designing handicap furniture that restores accessibility to your favorite activities. Our specially designed products help people regain their independence, dignity, and self image.

This lifting chair is unlike any other. Sitzon was developed by Donna Smith, a Yoga enthusiast  who was disabled due to complications from an accident. Her undying passion for the practice of Yoga drove her to evolve this chair, and she has found it to be an accommodating solution that has restored her independence and self-confidence. You to, may follow your passion with the help of Sitzon.

Reaching Better Heights

Sitzon isn't just useful for easily lowering you down to the floor. When you fall and cannot get up, simply reach for Sitzon to help  raise you back up. Unlike a traditional chair, this product goes all the way to the floor. Its operating range lowers you down to four (4) inches off the floor, or raises you 20 inches high (about the height of a regular chair). The raising and lowering process takes about a minute to complete, enabling quick access to what ever you need.

Sitzon's  design provides unparalleled comfort, mobility and functionality. Equipped with two wheels and a handle, the chair is able to fold down completely for maximum portability. This allows you to roll it around like a suitcase when you no longer need it.

Assistance for ALL

Everyone deserves to do what they love. Sitzon gives everyone a means to get down to the floor safely and conveniently. It is the perfect companion for the disabled, amputees, elderly, patients with neurological issues, and individuals recovering from surgery or injures. Sitzon is the perfect aid for Yoga, physical rehabilitation, and playing with children.

We Need Your Support

Sitzon is currently in the prototype stage and entering the second iteration of its design. Development is ongoing to make this the perfect aid for individuals with physical limitations, disabilities and handicaps.

Your support will help us complete the prototyping of the final product and  assist us in getting  Sitzon into production and make it available to all persons with physical limitations.

If you consider making a $5000USD donation, the following applies to shipping outside the United States.

The SITZON will be delivered to any location within the continental United States. Should the donor reside outside the continental
United States, You will be responsible for all duties and costs for packaging
and shipping.

story:
Hello!

Thank you very much for taking the time to watch our video about this campaign and thank you very much for thinking about making a contribution.

My name is Bill Knepper.  I am a volunteer for a not-for-profit organization that provides a genuine, proven, structured career path for disabled veterans.  We identify, recruit and hire these veterans and then we educate, train and mentor them for successful careers in the insurance industry.  So far we have successfully done this with four disabled vets and with your support of this fundraising campaign we can help another one.

That’s right – with your help today we can turn the world around for a disabled vet. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our initial goal amount for this campaign is to raise $32,492.  You might be asking, "Where did that number come from?"  That number comes directly from the actual average amount that it costs us to educate and train one disabled veteran during their six month training period.  That amount is broken down into 3 parts: $11,196 compensation for the veteran, $14,214 for training expenses and $7,082 for technology, logistical and administrative costs. 

I am personally hoping that we will exceed our initial goal – by a LOT!  If that happens and we double our goal that means that we will be able to help two disabled veterans … triple our goal and we can help three.  The sky is the limit!  Whatever money this campaign raises, please note that 100% of the contributions that we get will go toward accomplishing our mission to educate and train disabled veterans so that they might have a meaningful career in the insurance industry.

Disabled Veterans Insurance Careers

The name of the not-for-profit organization that I am part of is Disabled Veterans Insurance Careers (DVIC) and you are invited to check out our website at WWW.DVIC.US.  You can see how we have already helped four disabled veterans and how we do what we do.  There is a lot of great information on our site – information about our board and some of the heroes that are part of DVIC – there are also some great videos on our site there, including one where each of the four disabled veterans that we have already helped tell their story and how DVIC has helped them.  Those veterans’ comments make me proud to be part of DVIC and make me happy that I am in a position to help them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people just can't contribute.  If you are one of those people, that doesn't mean you can't help!  If you can’t make a contribution at this time, it would still be very much appreciated if you could help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. 

Share this campaign with your friends, post information about it on any social media sites that you use… publicize it in any way that you can!  Just think … if you shared this campaign with say 100 of your Facebook friends and just 2 or 3 of them contributed, then YOU have been a tremendous help to disabled vets!

Your Contribution is Tax Deductible

DVIC is a registered and verified IRS approved 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization and your contribution is tax deductible (in the United States.)  You can use any credit card for your contribution.  When you make your contribution, you will receive an email from FirstGiving, which is Indiegogo’s not-for-profit credit card payments processor.  This e-mail will be your receipt and will confirm the tax-deductible status of your contribution.  If you have any questions or if you would like to make a contribution in another manner, please contact us. 

The Bottom Line

Your contribution to our campaign will directly help a disabled veteran.  DVIC is an established, proven organization and we have already been successful with four disabled veterans.  You can get some great rewards for your contribution - including a personal thank you letter from the disabled vet that you helped.  100% of the contributions that we get from this campaign will go toward accomplishing our mission to educate and train disabled veterans so that they might have a meaningful career in the insurance industry.

Can you please make your contribution today?  Thank you!

story:
This campaign has now ended but if you would like to buy an Urban Survival Pry Bar either privately message me at  -  weaponcollector1@aol.co.uk  - or visit my blog for more details - http://weaponcollector.blogspot.co.uk/2011/12/weaponcollectors-urban-survival-pry.html


Both Blued and Black painted finish are availible for £30 + £5 postage - approx (postage to different countries maybe slighty more or less depending where you are and how soon you want it)


Summary

My name is Mike, and I created the Urban Survival Pry Bar Mutli Tools. 

The video above is a demo of the tools, below is a picture of the standards bars with gun blue finish -

The Pry Bars are designed as a survival tool for emergencies in either urban or non urban situations - the tools include two prying ends, cutting edge, saw back, tin / bottle opener, nail puller, sharpened hook, flat head screw driver and a paracord wrapped handle which contains an survial kit underneath which includes band aids, snare wire, lock pick, tension tool, saw blade, compass, matches, safety pins, and more - the contents may vary from each Pry Bar

The Pry Bar shown above is blued finish but I also do plain black paint, and can do any colour paracord wrapped handle, I may also do some in bright orange paint finish.

Below are some of the items under the paracord -

The purpose of this campaign is to generate funding so I can start making the pry bars on a larger scale, currently I make them in my shed with very basic hand tools.

If I can get better tools I can make more and sell them cheaper too, currently it takes half a day or more to make one pry bar with the tools I have and therefore the cost of selling them has to be higher than I'd like.

If enough funding is generated this could change my life, I could go into full production of the pry bars and it would become my main job.

What I Need

What I need is any funds, potentially even a small amount will at least allow me to buy some hand tools that I don't own, with bigger donations I can get decent power tools that will make the whole process much easier and lower the price too.

The Impact

As mentioned above this funding could change my life for the better, this would become my full time job. would give me a living, I could expand other ideas I have, it would really change things for me!


Risks & Challenges

There really are no risks, any funds will help to change how I make and sell the pry bars, a small amount will allow me to buy some basic tool and materials to get me started, larger amounts will change how the tools are made and the price they are sold.


WeaponCollectors Urban Survival Pry Bar Info

WeaponCollector's Heavy Duty Urban Survival Pry Bars, designed and created by myself.

The model shown will be Available from myself if this campaign is sucessful and later possibly coming soon to eBay.

The Pry Bars will be Available to ship Worldwide, and are shipped from the U.K

The Prybars are approx 10" 1/2 long and 1" 3/8 wide. all come with paracord wrapped handle and survival kit, but sizes can vary depending on what the buyer wants
Each prybar tool consists of the following - 2 x prying tools, 2 x nail pullers, wood saw and cutting edge, bottle and tin opener, flat screwdriver,  2.5m approx of paracord.

The Urban Survival kits under the paracord vary and can consist of  -
1 x lock Pick, 1 x tension tools, 1 x craft style blade / stanley blade, snare wire ,P-38 tin opener, matches, compass, magnifying glass, band aids / plasters, safety pins, wood saw, metal saw.
(No kit will include all these items, but will have many of them)

Dimensions : 10-1/2" (26.5cm)long, 1-3/8" (35mm)wide, 1/4" (6mm)thick approx, Weight - 450g / 1 lb  

Each is hand made and fully hardened and each can be made to the buyers specification if wanted, these changes can include - removing the blade or saw, making the prybar longer or shorter, making the handle thinner for smaller hands and other changes.

Recommended for E.D.C (Every Day Carry) or a in B.O.B (Bail Out Bag) or in the car or other everyday places like a rucksack, handbag, brief case, I have designed these tools as an Urban Survival item similar to Breacher bars and other entry / escape tools, ideal for carrying in the bottom of your bag while travelling on public transport, especially buses, trams and trains, it could save your life in an accident or other situations that are out of your control.
Maybe you are walking down the street and a incident happens, you may need to get away fast, or hide, these tools will get you in or out of a building or vehicle, that's what they are designed for, escape and evasion and to save lives, maybe a house is on fire and you need to get in or out, again this tool could save your life or someone else's.
But at the same time, you have other survival items - tin opener, para cord, blade and saws etc, all good for survival in urban or rural situations that occur everyday.
Either way I feel these are a great addition to any survival kit or every day carry bag, and a great alternative to the standard pry bars that are available.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this to your friends, especailly survivalists, Preppers etc  - Thank you

story:
Why I started Pie Ladie

Near the end of 2006 I was diagnosis with breast cancer. To make things worse, at the end of 2007 my husband became sick and in the middle of 2008 was diagnosed with lung cancer. His condition was the result of working in an aluminum mill for 45 years. After 41 years of marriage he died October 4th of 2008. It was a especially devastating lost.

Because there wasn’t enough life insurance I almost lost my home. So, to save my home I started Pie Ladie.

I live near a lot of car dealerships and went place after place in hope that people would like my pies, they did and so I was able to develop 3 routes. I started Pie Ladie in 2010 and it has grown and I work out of my home.


                                           


The pie business has kept me from losing my house. It allows me to cover my bills, while providing a joyous service for a lot of great people that bring me joy. But I need another oven to be able to fill my orders because I have no help and do everything in my one standard size oven and refrigerator. So, I am up sometimes 3 and 4 in the morning baking so I can deliver everything fresh the next day. I have priced the double convection oven and it is $3000.00. And I need an additional refrigerator which is over $2000.00. So I am trying to raise $5,000.00. 

So to show how much I really appreciate those collaborating with me I wanted to share something that is especially helpful to anyone. Over the years I have worked in the finance field and I have written a small eBook that I think can help a lot of people in debt. This is information I found quite valuable. For those who donate at least $25.00 I will email them this eBook entitled “Proven Strategies On How to Quickly Get Out of Debt and Pay Off a 30 year Mortgage in 10 to 15 years Without Refinancing and Build a Money Reserve So You Can Be Your Own Bank”. Most people don’t like a long read so I made this a short read without all the distracting details.
story_txt: Why I started Pie LadieNear the end of 2006 I was diagnosis with breast cancer.  To make things worse, at the end of 2007 my husband became sick and in the middle of 2008 was diagnosed with lung cancer.  His condition was the result of working  in an aluminum mill for 45 years.  After 41 years of marriage he died October 4th of 2008. It was a especially devastating lost.Because there wasn’t  enough life insurance I almost lost my home.  So, to save my home I started Pie Ladie.  I live near a lot of car dealerships and went  place after place in hope that people would like my pies, they did and so I was able to develop  3 routes.  I started Pie Ladie in 2010 and it has grown and I work out of my home.                                            The pie business has kept me from losing my house.  It allows me to cover my bills, while providing a joyous service for a lot of great people that bring me joy.   But I need another oven to be able to fill my orders because I have no help and do everything in my one standard size oven and refrigerator. So, I am up sometimes 3 and 4 in the morning baking so I can deliver everything fresh the next day.   I have priced the double convection oven and it is $3000.00.  And I need an additional refrigerator which is over $2000.00.  So I am trying to raise $5,000.00. So to show how much I really appreciate those collaborating with me I wanted to share something that is especially helpful to anyone. Over the years I have worked in the finance field  and I have written a small eBook that I think can help a lot of people in debt.  This is information I found quite valuable.  For those who donate at least $25.00 I will email them this eBook entitled “Proven Strategies On How to Quickly Get Out of Debt and Pay Off a 30 year Mortgage in 10 to 15 years Without Refinancing and Build a Money Reserve So You Can Be Your Own Bank”.  Most people don’t like a long read so I made this a short read without all the distracting details.

story:
THE WARM HEART CO.

The Warm Heart Company was started after 2 trips to Malawi, Africa. Malawi is a landlocked country on the Southeast side of Africa. With poverty consuming the majority of the nation, we felt called to make a difference.

Our idea is to partner with in-country nonprofits to make a lasting impact. The Warm Heart Company currently partners with two existing nonprofits.  Through our custom t-shirts and accessories, we have been able to raise funds, donate supplies, and help them spread the word. To make a bigger impact, our goal is to continually partner with more nonprofits and aid them in fundraising through our custom t-shirts. We want to bring an ever-changing clothing line to you, so that together we can bring hope to people in need.

OUR NEEDS

We are looking to YOU, our global community, to help us meet our needs and the current demand already established by our partnering nonprofits. These funds will also help us reach our goal of kick-starting our own official website, creating more custom t-shirt designs, and partnering with other nonprofits. 

If our goal of $2,000 is not met, the funds received will be split evenly and donated to the two nonprofits that The Warm Heart Company already partners with. 

THE IMPACT

Together, we can make a difference. Your contribution will help people living in poverty all across the world. We deeply appreciate every donation and are committed to doing what we can to make a difference. 

Over the past year, through the purchases of our t-shirts, we have been able to help the people of both Malawi and Rwanda in many ways.

  • Donated over 1,000 children's books to The Duha Complex School in rural Rwanda.
  • Spent 3 weeks in Rwanda assisting teachers at The Duha Complex School.
  • Aided in the donation of old laptops through the Rollins Laptop Legacy Project.
  • Donated over $1,000 to Children of the Nations and their work in Malawi.

CHALLENGES ALONG THE WAY

The Warm Heart Company has set us out on an entirely new endeavor in which we hope to continue to make a difference in the global community. In ensuring the independence, growth, and security of each nonprofit, we know that we will be presented with logistical challenges along the way.

  • Shipping globally.
  • Turning a profit while upholding our values.
  • Not imposing Western values on any community.
  • Making sure we represent each nonprofit in the best possible way.
  • Continually bringing new, custom designs to the store.
  • Language barriers.

With these in mind, we are confident in our problem solving and support network. We believe that these issues of global inequality are worth working through any obstacles we may face.

GET INVOLVED

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Remember, we need YOU to help make a difference. Use #thewarmheartcompany to spread the word. 

  • Share this campaign with your networks!
  • Follow us on Twitter
  • Connect with us on Instagram
  • Write to us! If you've got ideas we love to hear from our network from across the globe. Feel free to email us (thewarmhartcompany@gmail.com).
  • We are always looking to feature new t-shirt designs. If you are interested in creating a custom design for one of our nonprofits, please contact us!
You may also help by donating supplies in need to both nonprofits we currently partner with. Email us (thewarmheartcompany@gmail.com) for a current list of these specific supplies.

We are so thankful for each and every one of you.

story:
The Story

Clifton Gibbs was the person who always cheered you on, the one who gave his last to help whomever was in need, and the one who found the best ways to make you laugh. He was a friend. 

In 2012, he was hit by a distracted driver who was texting while driving. We had hope and prayed for a recovery, but 2 days later he passed away with his fiancé and mother by his side. The world may have carried on...but we will never forget his life, his love and his memory. 

I am giving away my birthday to support the organization made in his name: C.L.I.F. (Collegiate Life Investment Foundation). From now until February 14th (my birthday), I encourage everyone to donate at least $5 in support of his memory. Help me to keep his memory alive and not allow our loss to be in vain. 

About C.L.I.F.

CLIF, or the Collegiate Life Investment Foundation, is a 501(c)3 based in Memphis, TN that is dedicated to bringing awareness to the dangers of distracted driving. The Foundation is committed to educating the general public about distracted driving, the ways its negligence affects others, and the techniques that can be used to rid the roadways of its dangerous practices. 

The Impact

To date, the organization has raised nearly $3,000 in scholarships and sponsorships to Tennessee victims of distracted driving and traffic accidents. 

    $100 for the organization allows us to buy supplies for our CLIF C.A.R.E.S (Children Advocates for Road Education Safety) Program which is a peer to peer high school road traffic education program.

Other Ways You Can Help

Be sure to visit Clif2012.org and remember to be mindful when on the road

#ItsJustNotWorthIt

story:
Building the Foundation

My name is Sabra Michelle and I am a professional actor/dancer/singer/producer in NYC. I have performed in shows across the country and on national tours and around the world. I have hosted and entertained at hundreds of parties throughout the years and, together with some friends with similar backgrounds, have started a small Organization which has produced galas for national charities. CATCH Organization (Choose Action To Change Humanity) started out as an idea on how to make housing affordable to people in the entertainment industry, and give back to the community around them.  The idea of what C.A.T.C.H can be has grown, and the possibilities are endless.  

Now we want to buy a grand Victorian House in rural New Jersey to restore and turn into an Arts & Events Center, where wonderful things happen- tea parties for wedding/baby showers, children's birthday parties, and wedding receptions for starters! Our dream is to create a single destination for people within 90 miles of New York, NY, Philadelphia, PA, and Trenton, NJ where clientele would gladly escape the concrete jungle for a day of country respite and entertainment, run by professionals who have a great understanding of catering to city-dwellers' needs in a pastoral setting. NYC actors would live on the property to cater to guests' needs. We also aim to enrich the culture of the surrounding community by offering them an elegant place to gather to celebrate special events.

But we have so much more planned after that...

The Keys to the House

We’re looking to purchase an existing property in the NJ area for under $500,000 (including renovation estimates) with plenty of acreage (for peaceful photos and quiet nights away from neighbors) with room to build a second venue that can accommodate a versatile ballroom/theatre. 

Renovations will be done in phases;

Phase 1: 

Initially, within 6 months of purchase date, we will be ready to host quaint tea-parties and bridal/baby showers as well as grand wedding receptions and gala celebrations in the refurbished 1st floor parlours and beautifully landscaped gardens (including birthday parties, bar/bat mitzvahs, graduation parties, meetings, or even community dances). This space would also accommodate small dance classes and drama camp for local children, with the aim to grow and expand into Phase 2.

  1. Landscape the grounds
  2. Improve house exterior and porches
  3. Restore parlours/structural interior
  • Remove overgrown tennis court, above-ground pool, and children's playground equipment 
  • Install stone or brick terrace
  • Plant lawn and gardens
  • Rehabilitate extinct pond into serene water feature 
  • Refurbish rotting roof, siding, portico, and architectural flourishes
  • Remove decaying back porch and replace with larger  house-length porch for more entertaining space and service alleys
  • Update electrical, heating/cooling systems, and plumbing
  • Replace old broken windows with appropriate energy-saving windows
  • Repair water damaged ceilings and walls
  • Remodel kitchen for comfortable catering
  • Decorate ground floor for quaint tea parties and intimate gatherings (parlour and ballroom)
  • Finish 2nd floor suitable for residence (was recently habitable)
Phase 2: 
Within 5 years, we expect to turn enough of a profit to break ground on a separate  building on the back of the 8.5 acre property. This new venue will be built to be upgraded to a fully adapted theatre for authentic summer stock musical performances, as well as adaptable for indoor community events of any kind.
  1. Create 2nd Venue
  2. Complete restorations of the House 3rd floor 
  3. Create parking that will not disturb neighbors or infringe upon the beauty of the setting
  • Break ground on TheatreBarn to accommodate safe and versatile affairs, with appropriate plumbing. 
  • Add gazebo, paths, possible bridge over pond
  • All 3rd floor rooms in House are comfortable and inhabitable, including office and Bridal Suite.
  • Finish Grand bathroom on 2nd floor, add half-bath on 3rd floor
Phase 3: 
Providing buildings and gardens are easy; adding polish is more tricky and expensive. 
  1. Integrate modern theatrical lighting and acoustics for the most efficient ambiance in and around property and in 2nd Venue. 
  2. Resolve all non-primary issues
  3. Continue hosting events in House 1st floor parlours and porch, Outdoor terrace and gardens, and in TheatreBarn

Being Good Neighbors

We hate seeing this grand old house sitting there rotting away on the edge of a community that is actively working to improve their business district. There are no enterprises like ours in the area, and there are public forums on the town's BID (Business Improvement District) website where the community is begging for a quaint place to serve their intimate celebration needs.

My co-producers and I are already looking into partnering with local limo or “party bus” companies to chauffeur guests safely to and from the destination when alcohol or long distances are involved. Other partnerships would include caterers, florists, tent rentals, musicians, etc. The house will have a residence for actors once the theatre is underway, and will house the offices for the entire operation.

As starving artists in Manhattan for so many years, we have an attainable vision, but no capital to start it. With your help, we can quickly and easily make this a profitable and desirable haven. As an investor, you would also have access to the site and discounted seating at performances or reservations. Other perks are listed with specific donation amounts.

Fences & Barriers

The house is currently available for less than the renovations will cost, but according to the contractors we've already consulted, the whole thing can be up and running within 3 months if we can reach our goal. We have $10k to get started, but it will take more than 10x that to purchase the house before we can begin restoring the house and grounds to their former glory. We are convinced that we can quickly turn a profit with our gardens, enabling us to reinvest into further improvements on the residences (Bridal suite...) and eventually build the theatre/events building.

Community Chest

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this wonderful opportunity.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

This campaign is massively important to us because the project underpins everything we care about. 

We want to be able to serve the community using facilities like softplay, support services, learning support, youth areas and an indoor skatepark.

As you help today by sponsoring us you will be responsible for helping us provide amazing resources for not just young people but for young families and elderly people. Partnering together will impact the lives of 1000's.

What are we wanting to provide?

Skate Area - Purpose built skatepark for BMX, skate and scooter riders. We will use this facility as a full time skatepark open 6 days a week. We will continue to run skate coaching, clubs and Christian Skaters (Yuesday night bible study) from the park. 

Youth Space - An area that provides a warm, safe environment for young people to socialise

Support Services - this area is dedicated to providing services and social activities for the elderly

Cafe - providing refreshments to service the facilities within the building

Softplay - a great place for young families to socialise and play

Learning Centre - a facility to engage people in learning and  development covering a wide range of assistance e.g homework clubs, CV writing, filling in application forms etc

Our Goal

We are asking you to help us raise £50,000. 

£20,000 will go towards the building of a new skatepark

£10,000 will help pay for the softplay area.

£20,000 will help set up the area support services, learning centre and youth facility

Whats in it for you?

There are so many amazing perks that range from photo and video sessions with our guys that have had their pictures and video's published across some of the biggest extreme sporting magazines and websites. 

Also if you want to enjoy the facilities once built we have some massively discounted memberships for entry to the softplay and skatepark.

Or maybe you just think this is a great project to support. If so then thank you for your contribution. 

We do also have the option of setting up monthly direct debits.

The Impact

We are a church based organisation that have spent the last 8 years running successful youth projects, 5 of which have been The Unit Skatepark. The impact of what we are proposing is massive and can literally change peoples lives. 

Something we have noticed over the years is that young people especially don't seem to have the skills and help to write CV's, cover letters and fill in job application forms. Just one of the things we will be offering is free qualified assistants to work through these things with them.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways you can help. One of which is donating but most importantly we need you to get the word out their about this and get people excited about what could be an excellent facility to serve the community.

story:
INTRODUCING THE ROLLY BOWL

The Rolly Bowl is a unique, all-in-one food storage system with a built in roll over lid . I invented the Rolly Bowl as an alternative to food storage containers that have detachable lids that can easily become lost or damaged. In 2014 I received a Certificate of Achievement from Purdue University Calumet and The Center for Entrepreneurship Success for my Rolly Bowl, which ranked in the top five of entrepreneurial ideas in the Big Sell Entrepreneurship Competition.

The Rolly Bowl will come in a package of three. There will be three sizes, small medium and large. Colors will include: white, red, blue, pink, and green. I am currently working on some designs so they will be introduced at a later date. I believe the cool colors and designs will provide a unique, convenient and fun way to store, display and preserve food and snacks. I thing kids will love the fun designs. I know parents will love the time they save by not having to search their cabinets for lids that fit, and also the money they will save by not having to constantly replace containers with lost, damaged or ill-fitting lids. 

(Design idea)

(Design idea)


The Rolly Bowl is great for storing food, snacks and leftovers. It can also be used to store small toys, crayons and art supplies.
 
 
 

The attached, fully retractable lid can be rolled over the top of The Rolly Bowl then snapped closed for airtight storage.

the bowl and used for reheating and eating.
 
   

The Rolly Bowl is refrigerator, freezer, dishwasher and microwave safe. It saves time and can be stacked so that it doesn’t take up much space.
 
 

Hello, my name is Janice Beier. I am the inventor of the Rolly Bowl. The Rolly Bowl is an  innovative, fun and versatile food storage container that will revolutionize the food storage container industry. I am raising funds for a new start-up company which will manufacture, package and market this new product.  After my funding goal is reached I will buy the small, medium and large sized molds necessary to create the bowls. I will begin the manufacturing process some time in April. Once I have manufactured the first 100 bowls I will work with an artist to come up with a design for the packaging. The Rolly Bowls should be packaged and ready to ship by mid May. Once the bowls have been packaged I will begin fulfilling my pledges. After all pledges have been sent I will begin manufacturing bowls for marketing and trade shows.

    supplies.












   






  



 







The attached,
    fully retractable lid can be rolled over the top of The Rolly Bowl then
    snapped closed for airtight storage.
the bowl and used for reheating and eating.





   



 

  







The Rolly Bowl is refrigerator, freezer, dishwasher and
    microwave safe. It saves time and can be stacked so that it doesn’t take up
    much space.





   





  

Hello, my name is Janice Beier. I am the inventor of the Rolly Bowl. 
The Rolly Bowl is an  innovative, fun and versatile food storage 
container that will revolutionize the food storage container industry. I
 am raising funds for a new start-up company which will manufacture, 
package and market this new product.  After my funding goal is reached I
 will buy the small, medium and large sized molds necessary to create the bowls. I will begin the 
manufacturing process some time in April. Once I have manufactured the first 100 bowls I 
will work with an artist to come up with a design for the packaging. The Rolly Bowls should be packaged and ready to ship by mid May. Once the bowls have been packaged I will begin fulfilling my pledges. After all pledges have been sent I will begin manufacturing bowls for marketing and trade shows.

story:
Short Summary

Westside Rental has a reputation for unscrupulous business behavior. Their unethical practices have resulted in numerous complaints and very low review ratings across the internet. If you have ever used Westside Rentals you probably paid $60 and found that many of the rentals that they offered for that fee were not actually available. In short, you paid for nothing! We are going to challenge this paradigm. 

Johnson & Musmann Enterprises is a company built on a single concept: Provide Exceptional Service with Integrity - Always. We believe there is no greater obligation to society. To consistently do the right thing, regardless of the consequences, is a lifestyle and business model we gratefully embrace. Our mission is to bring an honest and ethical brand of high-level client services to the Southern California Rental Market. 

Johnson & Musmann Enterprises clients and agents are more than just customers and employees, they are family. We understand that we cannot succeed without them. We are ever mindful of their impact on our personal and professional lives. From those who entrust with the marketing of their homes to those looking to us to help them find the home of their dreams – we treat everyone with the same level of courtesy and respect we would give to our mothers. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $2500 in total to add a few key components to our website that will enable us to present a viable alternative to the highly complained about Westside Rentals. 

We will be adding a unique portal where landlords and property owners can log on and list their properties for free. Once they have done so, they will have exclusive access to view and evaluate the potential renters that are interested in renting their properties.

The Impact

We will be drastically lowering the cost to search for rental home in Southern California while simultaneously improving the reputation of rental listing services by providing a degree of service unparalleled in the industry.

Risks & Challenges

We already have an established presence in the South Bay are of Southern California. We fully expect that our efforts will be meet with challenges by Westside Rentals which will likely include a pricing war. We look forward to, and will embrace this challenge as in the end it will benefit the consumer. As we are licensed with the State of California and Westside is not, we are well positioned to escape this conflict unscathed. 

Thank You

We appreciate your consideration. We believe that a small donation will result in a dramatic and valuable change to the landscape of rental real estate market. We hope that you can see the benefit in be a part of a solution to a problem that has existed for 16 years.

story:
Making travel more social, allowing you to use your social media skills to earn yourself a discount on your next trip!

We are travel enthusiasts, passionate about online travel and have our own dream to innovate the online travel industry to be more up with current trend, and modern. This is why we have decided to launch our own online platform, offering YOU, our fellow online "discount" seeker, "large inventory" searcher, and travel-holic, the opportunity to find that flight for less, that hotel that you always wanted to stay at, and why not throw in a rental car.
We are based in Switzerland, in the heart of Europe, with our online platform being accessible globally and with a full inventory worldwide (from regular to low cost airlines, from luxury to budget hotels, and car rentals on your doorstep.)
To keep adding more features to the website, more products, and to boost our online marketing, worldwide, we need your help! 
The platform is fresh, user interactive, simple and easy to use.

WE NEED YOU! 

WE NEED YOU TO #TRAVEL...MORE!

WE WANT YOU TO SPEND LESS! 

WE WANT YOU TO #SOCIALISE!

WE WANT YOU TO BE #TRENDY!

WE WANT YOU TO SEE THE WORLD WITH #TRAVELS !


  • We are aiming to secure a total of 100,000 USD, to assist us with our online marketing campaign and add more quirky features to the platform
  • Searching for your next trip or package holiday from an interactive map
  • Social media integrated, allowing you to share and tweet for immediate discount
We want to change the current travel concept and online planning from the rigid, mundane existence to a modern one full of joy, ease, and user comfort and satisfaction.
Can't pledge funds today towards our campaign? Don't worry! Save our website address, and next time you are planning a trip, or even thinking about escaping your office desk for a break away, come join us on www.hashtagtravels.com #explore #travel #enjoy #escape #discount #socialmedia #online 
Have a friend who may be interested in TRAVEL? Please! Send them our indiegogo campaign and share our website with them!

#travels

story:
Welcome to Senses Candles:

•  We are Senses Candles. We care about the environment. We care about our customers. Our values impact everything we do; how we make our candles, how we purchase our materials, which companies/organisations we interact with and even down to what ink we choose to use on our eco-friendly business cards. Both of our founders (find out more on our website) have intrinsic links to the environment and animal rights, so wanted to portray that through the medium of business to help increase awareness and bring luxurious products to market, without damaging environments/habitats. 

•  Our campaign is to lease a small warehouse unit, where we can continue to hand-make our scented candles, enabling us to continue to meet demand from eco-friendly and forward thinking consumers and businesses throughout the world. Not only would this create jobs locally, it will eventually allow us to create our own essential oil farms and protected wood areas internationally, thus helping on a global scale. As part of our ethical values, we donate to charities and we are committed to donating sufficiently to ensure animal rights charities get access to the funding they need to continue their good work. Please help us to achieve this.

•  As detailed above, helping to continue Senses growth will provide not just our founders, our employees or our customers with these luxurious products, but will allow you and Senses to act as a force for change and good to demand ethical trade standards on a global basis. We want Senses to be the leader in this positive change and for you to join us in this movement.


Quid Pro Quo:

•  We need £5000 to put a deposit down on a small warehouse unit, which we want to ultimately call home to Senses 

•  We don't want to reveal too much about our perks here, however we want to make sure you each have a piece of Senses going forward. This will include smaller things such as hand-written 'thank you' notes, eco-friendly branded t-shirts and Senses Hampers right through to larger things like a tour of the warehouse unit, personalised candle making lessons and even an exclusive meal out with and paid for by the founders. 

•  If we don't reach our end goal, then do not despair. We will continue to use the funds appropriately, including to boost our presence to continue the education process around ethical trade as well as start developing new scents for our range


Risks & Challenges:

•  We have a committed team that work tirelessly day and night to ensure our candles are always perfect for our customers and continue to educate via our blog the benefits of natural essential oils and using soy wax over its paraffin alternative. We understand our customers and clients and take pride in our work, with customer service taking massive priority over sales. This is what keeps our customers/clients coming back, including larger chains that operate not just nationally, but internationally. These recent orders can only be maintained with having our own dedicated premises to meet demand. 

•  If we cannot access the full required amount, then our team will continue to meet demand through our current ultra small facility, without sacrificing the quality. It's as simple as that. We don't make excuses. We only make results.


Other Ways You Can Help:

•  Please talk about us. Write about us. Take photos of our products. Write songs and create dance routines about us. Anything you can do to help is very much appreciated and we like to thank people individually for their contributions. Honestly, our founders have sent personal messages to people on Facebook as we're that excited you believe in us.

•  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!


THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME & WE HOPE YOU BECOME PART OF SENSES HISTORY, PRESENT & FUTURE :)

story:
Summary

Abuse is a very serious but often ignored issue. However awareness alone is not enough. Thousands of women depend on homes like the Salvation Army’s Carehaven as their only way out of the cycle of abuse. By helping to raise funds for Carehaven, you help an organization that supports not only women but their children too. Funds will help Carehaven provide more women with essentials like food, clothing and educational programs.

The Impact

The impact of every contribution, large or small, is huge in the lives of the women and children whom you’ll be helping. Many women are forced to leave everything they know. Your contributions can help them start a new life with their children, free of abuse. More funds will allow Carehaven not only to increase the number of women they can help but also help further their education.

Where Your Money Will Go

Our final Goal amount is $10 000. The first $3 000 will go to a much needed re-roofing and painting.

If we reach the $5 000 mark we will have enough to increase our facilities and upgrade our playground for our children.

If we reach our final goal amount of $10 000 we will have enough to upgrade our therapy and creche facilities.

Risks & Challenges

The challenge is to turn words into action. Many people are quick to condemn abuse and share a status or ad, but actions speak louder than words. Homes like Carehaven need your support to help those women affected by violence. They struggle daily with the reality of abuse, both physically and psychologically. The reality is that they need your help so they can help others.


Other Ways You Can Help

Abuse is not a pleasant topic but we can’t allow it to be ignored. Never turn a blind eye to domestic abuse and spread the word that there are places like the Salvation Army that people who need help can turn to.

story:
Short Summary

The Outdoor Vibe was created by Jon Hurley to allow people to discover the incredible outdoor adventures people can experience in Argentina. After moving to Argentina in 2011 from the UK, Jon Hurley wanted to continue the outdoor lifestyle he'd grown up with, whilst living in the capital of Argentina, Buenos Aires.  This lead to the idea of The Outdoor Vibe and all it offers. 

Discover Argentina your way

The Outdoor Vibe offers a bespoke tour service to both visitors from overseas  and locals enabling them to discover all the joys the countryside of Argentina has to offer.  Specializing in the core areas of Hunting, Fishing, Polo, Horse riding, Trekking and now Paddle Boarding.


“This campaign is aimed at targeting the development of Paddle 

Boarding tours in Argentina. “


Why Paddle Boarding?

Argentina has some of the most pristine lakes and rivers anywhere in the 

world and yet Paddle Boarding, or SUP as it's also known, is not a common 

sport here.  


In the modern age of eco-tourism where protecting the environment we live in 

is as important as allowing people to discover its beauty, Paddle Boarding is 

the perfect none invasive way for the waterways of Argentina to be 

discovered without damaging the habitat around us.

Why are we campaigning?

With the money we raise from this campaign we will be able to buy the 

equipment needed to develop tours around the country allowing people a 

completely new way to see the beauty Argentina has to offer. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $20,000 USD but the good thing is that we can tailor 

the growth dependent on how much we raise. We have chosen to run a flexible campaign because no matter the amount we raise, it will be put to good use.


$10,000

If we can hit the $10,000 mark this will allow us to purchase enough 

equipment for small tour parties of up to 4 people along with the development 

and promotion of 1 location for short weekend breaks.


$20,000

The full $20,000 will enable us to purchase enough equipment to 

accommodate parties of up to 10 people at a time whilst also being able to 

develop and promote 2 locations for the tours in Tigre and Salta allowing us to 

be much more flexible in both the size of the tour and the lengths of tour we 

can offer.


If we hit our target we will start a short tour around the Tigre delta, one of the 

world's UNESCO sites, as well as a longer tour in the mountainous lakes of 

Salta. However, no matter what we raise, all perks will be valid.


“By contributing now you can be a pioneer in bringing 

Paddle Boarding to Argentina.” 


The future

Further tours are planned to Patagonia in the South of Argentina and any further monies raised will be used for equipment & tour development in this area to bring our clients the very best experience.


The Perks

The great thing about The Outdoor Vibe is that we offer tours in numerous 

outdoor activities so even if you aren't a big Paddle Boarding fan you can still 

use your perk across all the tours we offer and still support our bid to bring 

Paddle Boarding to Argentina.


We’ll double your donation

The system of perks we are offering is very simple, we have various different 

monetary options for you to choose from so that, no matter your budget, you 

can take advantage of this campaign, and whatever amount you contribute, you'll 

receive double that amount off a tour offered by The Outdoor Vibe. Our perks 

start from just a $50 contribution receiving $100 off a The Outdoor Vibe tour right 

up to a $1000 contribution receiving $2000 off a tour, and this reduction can be 

used across our entire range of outdoor activities. The perk is valid for up to 2 years after the end of the campaign so you will have plenty of time to arrange your trip.

If you don't wish to go on an outdoor adventure with us but still wish to contribute we also have 3 options ranging from $10-$25 which gives you recognition of being a Paddle Boarding Pioneer without the expense of the higher costing perks.




“You can use your perk to enjoy one of our many outdoor activity tours 

either in Argentina or at one of our other destinations around the world.”


We currently offer activity tours in Horse Riding, Shooting, Fishing, Polo, Trekking, Golf, Wine Tasting, White Water Rafting and Ice Trekking across 3 continents including countries such as Australia, Nepal, Iceland, The Bahamas and Ireland.


If we don't hit our target the good news is that we can still move forward with 

our plans, albeit on a smaller scale. The equipment we need will be 

purchased in numbers dependent on how much we raise with our aim being 

10 boards and paddles. If this isn't possible we will get as many as possible 

with the amount we raise.


In a world with growing obesity and every shrinking natural habitats, 

motivating people to get outside, discover the wild outdoors, and become 

more active is of huge importance.  SUP is the fastest growing water sport in 

the world today, it's great exercise and is completely none invasive to the 

waterways you use unlike some other forms of transport.


The Outdoor Vibe firmly believes in discovering the beauty of the natural 

world whilst ensuring its survival for future generations and these beliefs are 

passed on to our clients during our tours.


Risks & Challenges

Argentina is a vast and diverse country and so it takes local knowledge to 

plan the best outdoor activities. With The Outdoor Vibe aiming to offer SUP 

tours in 3 different locations with very different environmental and weather 

conditions in each, it is going to be necessary to use local guides to develop 

these tours. Finding the right local partners may prove time consuming and 

difficult however the strengths of using local guides will be so much more 

beneficial to the clients' enjoyment of their tours in the long run.


Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that not everyone is in a position to contribute but you can still 

help our campaign achieve success.  If you like what we are aiming to 

develop please do share it amongst your friends via social media, this is 

easily achieved using the Indiegogo share tools.


Thank you for your time.

story:
WHO WE ARE

If you care about media freedom you will be excited to learn about a groundbreaking citizen journalism project in South Africa. TeamCJ is a group of citizen journalists from Potchefstroom in North West Province. We are passionate about media freedom and giving a voice to communities who have been sidelined by mainstream media. The rise of the citizen journalist phenomena worldwide has created opportunities for ordinary people to generate news that has real relevance for their lives. In the era of social media sensational new possibilities have opened up to tell the full South African story. 

WHAT WE DO

TeamCJ receives training from a team of seasoned journalists and communication experts associated with Kreativmedia Hub, a dynamic New Media company in Potchefstroom that specialises in publishing, design and marketing across all media platforms.


HUMBLE BEGINNINGS

TeamCJ started as a small community project in June 2014 when we began training a dozen volunteers from disadvantaged communities to master the basics of news reporting. Many of the people who became involved are unemployed. 

TeamCJ empowers people by giving them the skills and tools to become citizen journalists who can report on grassroots issues in a professional, balanced and ethical manner. 

A local newspaper in the Tlokwe Municipality,The NorthWest Independent, came on board and established a community newspaper catering specifically for contributions from citizen journalists. As a result theThe NorthWest Independent Ikemele-kasi, a newspaper for the people by the people was born, for the first time providing a platform for these communities to express their views and participate in the public sphere. We pride ourselves on being independent from big media monopolies so that we can report news without bias or prejudice.

WHY CITIZEN JOURNALISM MATTERS

This initiative has the potential to transform the media landscape in our country. South Africa desperately needs media diversity to help deepen and defend our sometimes fragile democracy. In a country plagued by crime, corruption, inequality and social injustice we need every watchdog we can get to hold those in power accountable – at every level. 

We also, of course, need to tell the good news coming from marginalised communities where people are overcoming unbelievable odds to survive and prosper. To become good citizen journalists, volunteers need intensive training but also support in terms of resources. South Africa’s internet access ranks amongst the most expensive in the world and our cell phone costs are among the highest in Africa. Lack of transport is also a major obstacle to reporting news in remote parts of the country. 

We have come as far as we can with the resources available to us and now we are eager to take TeamCJ to the next level.

WHAT WE NEED

·  Our most immediate concern is to provide TeamCJ’s journalists with the essential tools they need to report the news.

·  If we make our target of $20 000 we will be able to provide the core team of 15 volunteer journalists with computers, smart phones, cameras and internet access. TeamCJ has already made magic with the little we have. Imagine what we can do if every team member has the kind of equipment good journalism requires?

·  Any additional funds we raise will go towards developing our online news platform, NewsClick, and to appoint a fulltime web administrator and editor.

·  We will also use donations to help the citizen journalists to get driving licenses and eventually invest in a TeamCJ car.

·  Our long-term goal is to establish a permanent media centre for the benefit of people who do not have access to computers or the internet within the disadvantaged communities. This media centre would double up as a communal meeting place and a research hub for students and scholars.

THE IMPACT

By getting involved you will make a very real difference in people’s lives. Becoming a citizen journalist and making a positive contribution to your community gives participants a sense of pride en belonging. Your contribution will also help create employment opportunities in a country with an unemployment rate of almost 25%. The proficiencies people acquire through this citizen journalism project will be a lifelong benefit to them.

Several of TeamCJ’s members have been inspired by this project to apply the skills they’ve learnt to entrepreneurial projects of their own. Empowering people to become part of the digital economy has a huge ripple effect. We’ve seen how people’s lives take a new direction when they get recognition and an opportunity to tell their own stories. TeamCJ has also done a lot to promote racial harmony in an environment that is often still plagued by apartheid's ugly legacy. 

Imagine what kind of country we can become if millions of South Africans are able to access and impart information and really exercise their constitutional right to freedom of expression?

KEY PARTNERS

Apart from Kreativmedia Hub, our current key partners are the NorthWest Independent newspaper and the Hello Pietie consumer service. We feel very strongly that citizen journalists should be rewarded and we are aiming to become more profitable by merging our news service NewsClick with a popular local consumer page on Facebook, Hello Pietie. We have made contact with key people in our local municipality and we have the support of the mayor of our town, Kgotso Khumalo. We have also received support from the North-West University’s Potchefstroom campus.

OUR INSPIRATION

When we started with citizen journalism training in Potchefstroom, we were inspired by the words of our beloved former president Nelson Mandela. “A critical, independent and investigative press is the lifeblood of any democracy.” We are also guided by a very profound principle Madiba demonstrated to us: Evil happens when good people do nothing.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We know everybody can’t make a financial contribution, but we also welcome any other kind of donation that will help TeamCJ keep up the good work. If you have an old computer or cell phone please consider passing it on? You can be sure it will be put to good use by TeamCJ.

Please share this initiative as widely as possible. Especially with friends or family who are passionate about media freedom. Contact us for more information - kreativmediahub@gmail.com

story:
My Story

 Thank you for reading my story and considering being a part of my dream and vision!
  • I have been surrounded by books my entire life. I have a deep passion for words, how they shape us, and how they come alive. I would love to provide McPherson with affordable books.
  • I have worked in bookstores ranging from used to corporate for 5 years. I have had a dream of owning and operating my own used bookstore for years. Just now have I been given the opportunity to make it possible. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising money to assist in our start-up inventory, advertising, and to secure a bank loan.
  • Check out the perks I have set up for everyone that has contributed! Don't miss out!!!!!
  • All money raised will go directly to business funds. If we don't hit our goal we will have to resort to loans from other sources.

The Impact

What your contributions will mean for us:

  • As a contributor you are creating a positive environment for children, teenagers, and adults. We will be providing a safe place for the community to gather, learn, and grow together.
  • Every dollar given is getting us one step closer to our dream, and providing affordable literature for those in our community.

Risks & Challenges

 With any new business there lots of steps before opening the doors to the public or online.

  • We have already taken strides in forms of a feasibility study, research in the market, and community leaders' support. Now we just need a little assistance in raising initial funds, and that's where you come in!
  • We have local small business owners and consultants coaching us each step of the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize not everyone can afford to contribute money at this time so here are a few ideas that would also really help out:

  • We ask that you share this post, let others know about it, and get the word out, we need all the help we can get!
  • We would also love any book donations you might have as well. We need a lot of books to get started, and every one counts!
  • If you have any questions please just ask, that's what we are here for. And remember, SHARE SHARE SHARE, we need as many people to know about this as possible.

story:
We want to help our wonderful town, Jacumba California to grow again. What better way to bring people back then to feed them "Something Delicious."
 I (Amanda) grew up here in this town. I've also left many times but always seem to end up coming back but didn't know why. Now I do!
I (Michele) didn't grow up here but moved her from a bigger city. I fell in love with the small town life and want to help bring back this beautiful town to what she once was.
We both had the same dream..."open a bakery." Feed people things that are just outstandingly delicious and mind blowing. It's a great satisfaction to make something so good that people can't stop talking about it. That is what the both of us do. We want to draw people in with our outstanding baking skills. We want people to fall in LOVE with home cooking again. Fresh baked goods with fresh ingredients. Bring back the 30s, 40s and 50s where real baked goods was what was on the menu. With your contributions we can help people fall in LOVE with "Something Delicious"

story:
My name is Cally Apicella and I quit my job working for a stock brokerage firm in Baltimore and moved back to my hometown to care for my parents.  I was able to start my own business and keep flexible hours by painting furniture for clients and selling at local shows and venues.  I no longer am needed fulltime with my family so after 7 years of putting my life on hold, I've decided to follow my dreams.

I am asking friends, family, associates and anyone who has ever had a dream to  help me fund my start up store, Kendall Taylor Home.  We will specialize in vintage, reimagined furniture and home décor.  I have participated in other venues selling my furniture and I have lots of experience.  This campaign is important to me and I feel its important to the revitalization of downtown Hagerstown, MD.   My true belief is that my business will bring people from other areas to shop in our fabulous town.  I believe so strongly that I have risked everything to do so.  I wish to create a learning annex in the basement of my store that will provide interesting classes for people in our community, help bring out others creative side and bring overall revenue to our fine city.

Here's what I need:

I need to raise at least $2,500, the money will go to small renovations, paint, supplies and utility deposits as well as helping me to pay for other start up fees such as liability insurance.

I will have some interesting perks, such as a Free American Paint Class for anyone who makes $150 donation.  For anyone offering $200 or more will receive a 10% on all purchases over $100 for our first six months in business.  If I am not able to raise the full amount I will still be able to receive whatever is donated.

 Your Contribution will impact myself and the City of Hagerstown, Md.
  • This project is valuable in helping bring other businesses to the downtown area as i will be one of many that will begin to build a business here in a place filled with empty storefronts.  The Downtown Movement has been vital in helping me to get my business started. 
  • I have been successful in the sales field for over 30 years, so experience is on my side.
Again, I have risked everything to make this happen and I have many supporters who fully trust and believe in what I am trying to acheive and my hope is that you will too.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 

  • If you are unable to contribute, please get the word out to everyone that Downtown Hagerstown is open for business and so is Kendall Taylor Home.

Thank You!

story:
Hi, Anthony Curtis here with DigitalProfitAcademy.org.  

In the past few years, there have been two major breakthroughs in the world of online advertising... 

  1. Wholesale advertising costs have dropped 70-90% (SHOCKING, I know)
  2. Advanced audience targeting capabilities have made online advertising more effective than ever 
...thanks to a new auction technology called Real Time Bidding (RTB).  

Remember the days when only Wall Street stock brokers could buy and sell stocks? Then along came E-Trade, which gave direct access to consumers and dramatically decreased the cost of trading stocks.  History is repeating itself, this time in the digital advertising industry.

This game changer could be the difference between life and death for many SMBs trying to survive in today's economy.  

There's also a HUGE opportunity for those that want to learn RTB advertising, manage local ad campaigns, and earn a 400% profit for doing so.

The problem is... nobody knows about it!

I've made it my personal mission to spread the word about this incredible opportunity for any company that needs more visibility, leads and customers (that's all companies, right?).  

You may be wondering... "Who is this Anthony guy?"  I've been generating digital profits for companies large and small since 1998, including Adobe, Nokia and FedEx.  I spend most of my time these days helping my 1700+ Udemy students worldwide build and grow their businesses.


What I Need

  • $2,500 to keep spreading the word to small businesses all over the world
  • $2,500 to continue to research and stay on top of the ever-changing RTB landscape

What You Get

  • The course has an MSRP of $299 -- See it here:  https://www.udemy.com/how-i-earn-400-pct-profit...
  • But our Indiegogo supporters receive an all-access lifetime pass for just $5, $7, $9, $11, $13, $15, $17, or $19 -- Early Birds get the best perks!
  • Course access credentials will be DELIVERED WITHIN 24 HOURS

Other Ways You Can Help

Help your favorite independent local businesses THRIVE by telling them about this exciting 60-day campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!
What businesses depend on new customers to survive?  
Realtors, Doctors, Dentists, Auto Mechanics, Restaurants, Insurance, just to name a few.
